Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Kom werken bij CloudNation, waar we de kracht van data en AI benutten om industrieën te innoveren en te transformeren. We zijn een dynamisch team van gedreven professionals, ondernemers en tech-enthousiastelingen die zich inzetten voor het leveren van baanbrekende oplossingen.




Functieomschrijving:

We zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde Machine Learning Engineer om ons snelgroeiende AI-team te versterken. Bij CloudNation helpen we onze klanten om hun weg te vinden in het complexe en snel evoluerende AI-landschap.




Het aanbod:

Bruto maandsalaris tussen de €3.200,- en €4.700,-

Bij hard werken hoort een passende beloning. Dat snappen we bij CloudNation goed. Daarom krijg je bij ons een 'rebel package' met de volgende perks:

The usual: Een goed salaris dat past bij je verantwoordelijkheden, skills en ervaring plus laptop en telefoon van de zaak. Je mag kiezen: MacBook, Windows, iPhone, Android.
Ook goed geregeld: Mobiliteitsbudget, pensioen, thuiswerkvergoeding, studiebudget.
Work hard, play harder: Je krijgt van ons 26 vakantiedagen + 1 extra per 6 maanden niet ziek (2 extra dus totaal 28), omdat we vrije tijd voor dingen waar je écht blij van wordt ook belangrijk vinden.
Bij CloudNation hanteren wij hybride werken: dat betekent een combinatie tussen werken op kantoor, bij de klant en thuiswerken. Workation is in goed overleg ook mogelijk.
Samenwerken en plezier hebben: AWS en Azure dagen op woensdag en maandag. Ook belangrijk: een grote keuken voorzien van alle gemakken om samen te lunchen. Vanaf 16.00
uur borreltijd!
Nog meer plezier: Elke laatste vrijdag van de maand houden we de Grote CloudNation Vrijmibo! Met snacks, drinken en zo veel mogelijk CloudNation rebel's aanwezig.
TGIF: Elke vrijdagochtend worden er een virtuele meetings gehouden m.b.t. Share & Inspire en Deep Dive. En de week wordt afgesloten met wederom borreltijd.
En veel meer: bedrijfsuitjes naar de sneeuw of Berlijn, tafelvoetbal, darten, gamen, om mee te spelen en vrij in te vullen, company funded, teambuilding activiteiten.




Belangrijkste verantwoordelijkheden:

Ontwikkelen en onderhouden van op Python gebaseerde back-enddiensten (FastAPI).
Betrokken zijn bij het bouwen en gebruiken van REST API's.
Samenwerken aan machine learning-projecten, inclusief het implementeren van modellen en het integreren van AI/ML-functionaliteiten.
Deelnemen aan de volledige ontwikkelingscyclus, inclusief ontwerp, codering, testen en productie-implementatie.
Werken in een teamomgeving om nieuwe ideeën te bedenken en bestaande processen te verbeteren.
Communiceren met klanten.




Gewenste vaardigheden:

Ervaring met frontend-ontwikkeling in React en TypeScript is een pluspunt.
Ervaring met data-engineering.
Bekendheid met Docker, microservices-architecturen en cloudomgevingen.
Kennis van Large Language Models (LLM's) en machine learning-frameworks.




Kwalificaties, jij hebt:

0-3 jaar ervaring in softwareontwikkeling.
Een bachelor in informatica of aanverwante gebieden, of gelijkwaardige praktische ervaring.
Sterke probleemoplossende vaardigheden en het vermogen om samen te werken in een team.
Een ondernemende instelling en de bereidheid om verantwoordelijkheid te nemen voor je werk.
Het vermogen om snel nieuwe technologieën te begrijpen.
Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden.

Show more
HTML:
Kom werken bij CloudNation, waar we de kracht van data en AI benutten om industrieën te innoveren en te transformeren. We zijn een dynamisch team van gedreven professionals, ondernemers en tech-enthousiastelingen die zich inzetten voor het leveren van baanbrekende oplossingen.


Functieomschrijving:

We zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde Machine Learning Engineer om ons snelgroeiende AI-team te versterken. Bij CloudNation helpen we onze klanten om hun weg te vinden in het complexe en snel evoluerende AI-landschap.


Het aanbod:

Bruto maandsalaris tussen de €3.200,- en €4.700,-

Bij hard werken hoort een passende beloning. Dat snappen we bij CloudNation goed. Daarom krijg je bij ons een 'rebel package' met de volgende perks:

  • The usual: Een goed salaris dat past bij je verantwoordelijkheden, skills en ervaring plus laptop en telefoon van de zaak. Je mag kiezen: MacBook, Windows, iPhone, Android.
  • Ook goed geregeld: Mobiliteitsbudget, pensioen, thuiswerkvergoeding, studiebudget.
  • Work hard, play harder: Je krijgt van ons 26 vakantiedagen + 1 extra per 6 maanden niet ziek (2 extra dus totaal 28), omdat we vrije tijd voor dingen waar je écht blij van wordt ook belangrijk vinden.
  • Bij CloudNation hanteren wij hybride werken: dat betekent een combinatie tussen werken op kantoor, bij de klant en thuiswerken. Workation is in goed overleg ook mogelijk.
  • Samenwerken en plezier hebben: AWS en Azure dagen op woensdag en maandag. Ook belangrijk: een grote keuken voorzien van alle gemakken om samen te lunchen. Vanaf 16.00
  • uur borreltijd!
  • Nog meer plezier: Elke laatste vrijdag van de maand houden we de Grote CloudNation Vrijmibo! Met snacks, drinken en zo veel mogelijk CloudNation rebel's aanwezig.
  • TGIF: Elke vrijdagochtend worden er een virtuele meetings gehouden m.b.t. Share & Inspire en Deep Dive. En de week wordt afgesloten met wederom borreltijd.
  • En veel meer: bedrijfsuitjes naar de sneeuw of Berlijn, tafelvoetbal, darten, gamen, om mee te spelen en vrij in te vullen, company funded, teambuilding activiteiten.


Belangrijkste verantwoordelijkheden:

  • Ontwikkelen en onderhouden van op Python gebaseerde back-enddiensten (FastAPI).
  • Betrokken zijn bij het bouwen en gebruiken van REST API's.
  • Samenwerken aan machine learning-projecten, inclusief het implementeren van modellen en het integreren van AI/ML-functionaliteiten.
  • Deelnemen aan de volledige ontwikkelingscyclus, inclusief ontwerp, codering, testen en productie-implementatie.
  • Werken in een teamomgeving om nieuwe ideeën te bedenken en bestaande processen te verbeteren.
  • Communiceren met klanten.


Gewenste vaardigheden:

  • Ervaring met frontend-ontwikkeling in React en TypeScript is een pluspunt.
  • Ervaring met data-engineering.
  • Bekendheid met Docker, microservices-architecturen en cloudomgevingen.
  • Kennis van Large Language Models (LLM's) en machine learning-frameworks.


Kwalificaties, jij hebt:

  • 0-3 jaar ervaring in softwareontwikkeling.
  • Een bachelor in informatica of aanverwante gebieden, of gelijkwaardige praktische ervaring.
  • Sterke probleemoplossende vaardigheden en het vermogen om samen te werken in een team.
  • Een ondernemende instelling en de bereidheid om verantwoordelijkheid te nemen voor je werk.
  • Het vermogen om snel nieuwe technologieën te begrijpen.
  • Sterke communicatieve vaardigheden.

Title: Applied Data Scientist
Description:
Microsoft’s Health and Life Sciences team is dedicated to empowering healthcare organizations ton achieve their goals and improve patient care. We aim to create an efficient and connected healthcare ecosystem by bringing the healthcare ecosystem together which empowers everyone across the healthcare journey to collaborate, communicate, and innovate together to provide better experiences for their workforces and patients or members alike.

Our team has an exciting opportunity for an Applied Data Scientist to expand our Dragon Ambient eXperience (DAX) product to international markets. DAX listens to doctor/patient conversations and

writes highly accurate clinical summaries of the encounter for review by the physician. DAX is an industry leading solution in the US healthcare market, and we are expanding our languages and market to include Germany and France.

#hlsp #dax-intl

Responsibilities

Responsibilities include:


Demonstrate broad understanding of state-of-the-art in machine learning concepts and applications.
Collaborate directly with product leaders, researchers, and engineers within Microsoft Health and Life Sciences division.
Develop state-of-the-art clinical summarization technology using advanced LLM capabilities in multiple languages.
Identifies approaches, and applies, improves, or creates a research-backed solution (e.g., novel, data driven, scalable, extendable) to positively impact DAX international summarization.
Applies language expertise and knowledge of clinical documentation to create high-quality clinical summaries for European markets.
Performs data analysis by reviewing criteria that reflect quality and technical constraints. Reviews data for inclusion in model training, taking actions to address data quality problems.


Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications


Doctorate in relevant field OR equivalent experience
Demonstrated research or applied science experience in Natural Language Processing
Proven experience with LLM technologies and generative AI
Language fluency in English AND French or German, or Dutch


Other Requirements

Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check:


This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.


Preferred/Additional Qualifications


Experience in medical text analytics and/or clinical information retrieval
Experience with text summarization and/or text generation


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer

Utrecht, Nederland

Tot 80k + benefits




-Dutch Speaking-




Ben jij een getalenteerde Machine Learning Engineer met een passie voor in productie brengen van models. Word lid van een dynamisch en zelforganiserend klein adviesbureau dat flexibiliteit, samenwerking en het leveren van hoogwaardige oplossingen voor predictive klanten.




Het Bedrijf

Sinds 2015 heeft ons kleine adviesbureau zich gevestigd als een gemeenschap van data-experts, sterke klantrelaties opgebouwd en innovatieve oplossingen geleverd.




De Rol

Als Machine Learning Engineer zul je:

Samenwerken met klanten om hun behoeften te begrijpen en op maat gemaakte datasolutions te leveren.
Aan de slag gaan met het in productie brengen van modellen en end-to-end projecten.
Bouwen van data platforms en data infrastructure.
Samenwerken met een team van experts en deelnemen aan kennisdelingssessies elke vrijdag.




Ervaring

4+ jaar ervaring in data science, met een focus op voorspellende modellering en forecasting.
Vaardigheid in Python, PyTorch, Keras en Databricks.
Nederlands sprekend




Benefits

Een ondersteunende en collaboratieve werkomgeving.
Regelmatige kennisdelingssessies elke vrijdag.
Sociale evenementen om teamverbindingen te versterken.
Competitieve reisvoordelen.
Mogelijkheid om te werken met een gerenommeerd merk en een sterke klantenbasis.
Hybride werkbeleid met 2-3 dagen op kantoor en flexibiliteit op basis van projectvereisten.
Een competitief salarispakket (inclusief Bonus)




Klaar om spannende uitdagingen aan te gaan en te werken met een divers klantenbestand? Solliciteer via de knop op deze pagina en stuur je CV naar Elisabeth Oudman.

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Word jij onze nieuwe collega?

Heb jij een passie voor data-analyse en wil je bijdragen aan innovatieve oplossingen binnen de accountancy? BGH | Rademaker zoekt een Data Scientist om ons dynamische team te versterken. Als Data Scientist bij ons jonge en energieke accountantskantoor speel je een cruciale rol bij het ontwikkelen en implementeren van geavanceerde data-modellen.

Wat ga je doen?

  • Je werkt zelfstandig of in teamverband aan uitdagende data science-projecten voor diverse klanten;
  • Je onderzoekt complexe datasets met behulp van SQL en Python, waardoor je in staat bent om trends en patronen te identificeren;
  • Je werkt nauw samen met interne belanghebbenden om zakelijke uitdagingen te begrijpen en op maat gemaakte data-oplossingen te bieden;
  • Je ontwikkelt en implementeert voorspellende modellen voor financiële prognoses en risicobeheer om strategische besluitvorming te ondersteunen;
  • Je draagt bij aan het verbeteren van data-analyseprocessen en -infrastructuren om de leidende positie van ons accountantskantoor in de branche te versterken.


Dit ben jij;

Naast passie voor het vak en een proactieve, teamgerichte en integere werkhouding, beschik je over:

  • Een HBO of WO achtergrond in Data Science, Statistiek, Computerwetenschappen of vergelijkbaar;
  • Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring als Data Scientist;
  • Uitgebreide kennis van en ervaring met SQL en Python. Ervaring met Power BI is een pré;
  • Sterke analytische en probleemoplossende vaardigheden;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels


Fijne arbeidsvoorwaarden en een goed salaris

  • Een uitdagende functie voor 32-40 uur per week;
  • Een competitief salaris en aantrekkelijke secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden;
  • 27 vakantiedagen en een goede pensioenregeling;
  • Een laptop en thuiswerkvergoeding;
  • De mogelijkheid om jezelf persoonlijk en professioneel te ontwikkelen.


De mensen maken het bedrijf. Bij BGH zijn we blij met al onze collega’s en die waardering spreken we ook uit. Plezier in je werk vinden we namelijk het allerbelangrijkste. We verzetten samen het werk. We hebben oog voor elkaar én voor onze klanten. De sfeer is goed en je krijgt veel vrijheid om je eigen werk in te delen. We stimuleren persoonlijke ontwikkeling op basis van jouw eigen doelen en wensen. Kortom, bij BGH ben je verzekerd van leuke en behulpzame collega’s, uitdagende opdrachten en uiteenlopende klanten.

Interesse?

Solliciteer direct via onderstaande button!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (ID: 2165)
Description:
As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will:


Work on a key topic: Financial Economic Crime.
Develop, manage, and maintain Azure infrastructure tailored for high-performance machine learning and artificial intelligence applications.
Collaborate in a multi-disciplined, highly skilled team to develop scalable solutions and ML pipelines throughout the entire ML cycle.
Ensure the health of the system and models by monitoring data quality, performance, and business impact, and devising mitigation plans.
Identify underlying issues and opportunities across the ML development cycle and introduce tools for efficient development and testing.
Implement solutions in alignment with architectural guidelines in collaboration with your team.
Continuously evolve your craft by staying up to date with the latest technologies.


What You Bring to the Table:


A completed relevant HBO or WO education.
Minimum of 4 years of relevant experience in Software, Data, or ML Engineering, with at least 2 years specifically in ML Engineering.
Experience working with large data sets using Python and PySpark (Azure Data-bricks experience is a plus).
Software development skills and good practices such as Git, release management, unit tests, and testing strategy.
Experience working in a cloud environment, preferably Azure.


You should possess the ability to:


Be customer-oriented, driven, and possess a strong analytical mind.
Be a true team player and eager to learn new techniques and developments.
Collaborate with data scientists and machine learning practitioners to provide infrastructure support for model development and deployment.


What We Bring to the Table:


An opportunity to make a significant impact on Financial Economic Crime and Customer Due Diligence.
A platform-centric approach to optimizing the ML Model workflow, development, and deployment.
A focus on automating the entire Model Lifecycle to provide a stable platform that delivers models in a secure and regulatory-compliant way.
An environment that encourages continuous learning and development with the latest market developments.
A collaborative and supportive team culture.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer - Hybrid - 12 Month Initial Contract







Our client is a leading Financial Services company in Europe looking to build out their team in the Netherlands, they are looking to add 3 mid-senior level Machine Learning Engineers to their growing team




What You'll Work With:

Python, MLOps, PyTorch, MLflow, Tensorflow, Pandas, AWS, Azure, Scik




You will be playing a pivotal role in the development of data science features alongside data engineering. In this role, you'll be responsible for designing ML pipelines, implementing algorithms to address dataset complexities, and spearheading the creation of a groundbreaking financial platform. You'll be an essential member of a dynamic and skilled team within a high-energy environment.




Responsibilities:

Develop forecasting and prediction models from inception to production-ready status, starting from proof of concept

Collaborate closely with product, research, and development teams to ensure product alignment and enhance product efficiency
Play a pivotal role in the research phase, identifying optimal market solutions for defined business challenges
Deploy machine learning models into production environments, ensuring scalability, reliability, and efficiency
Offer guidance and expertise to both the R&D and product teams




Requirements:

3+ years' experience as a Senior Software Engineer, Machine Learning Engineer, Data Engineer with a key focus on Machine Learning
5+ in hands-on engineering roles with Python
3+ years of experience in SQL, including proficiency in complex queries such as aggregations and analysis
Exposure to working on cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Expertise in machine learning algorithms and techniques, including supervised and unsupervised learning, deep learning, and reinforcement learning
Experience with classical machine learning models and techniques
Solid understanding of data engineering concepts, including data preprocessing, feature engineering, and ETL processes
Familiarity with MLOps and ML pipeline tools, along with experience with scientific libraries




Who We Want To Speak With:

Independent, self-motivated, and inherently curious Engineers, passionate about creative problem-solving and critical thinking
A collaborative team player with exceptional communication skills




If this position would be of interest to you or anyone within your network please apply through the link or send an updated resume to adam@umatr.io for consideration.

Our client is a leading Financial Services company in Europe looking to build out their team in the Netherlands, they are looking to add 3 mid-senior level Machine Learning Engineers to their growing team


What You'll Work With:

Python, MLOps, PyTorch, MLflow, Tensorflow, Pandas, AWS, Azure, Scik


You will be playing a pivotal role in the development of data science features alongside data engineering. In this role, you'll be responsible for designing ML pipelines, implementing algorithms to address dataset complexities, and spearheading the creation of a groundbreaking financial platform. You'll be an essential member of a dynamic and skilled team within a high-energy environment.


Responsibilities:

Develop forecasting and prediction models from inception to production-ready status, starting from proof of concept

  • Collaborate closely with product, research, and development teams to ensure product alignment and enhance product efficiency
  • Play a pivotal role in the research phase, identifying optimal market solutions for defined business challenges
  • Deploy machine learning models into production environments, ensuring scalability, reliability, and efficiency
  • Offer guidance and expertise to both the R&D and product teams


Requirements:

  • 3+ years' experience as a Senior Software Engineer, Machine Learning Engineer, Data Engineer with a key focus on Machine Learning
  • 5+ in hands-on engineering roles with Python
  • 3+ years of experience in SQL, including proficiency in complex queries such as aggregations and analysis
  • Exposure to working on cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, GCP)
  • Expertise in machine learning algorithms and techniques, including supervised and unsupervised learning, deep learning, and reinforcement learning
  • Experience with classical machine learning models and techniques
  • Solid understanding of data engineering concepts, including data preprocessing, feature engineering, and ETL processes
  • Familiarity with MLOps and ML pipeline tools, along with experience with scientific libraries


Who We Want To Speak With:

  • Independent, self-motivated, and inherently curious Engineers, passionate about creative problem-solving and critical thinking
  • A collaborative team player with exceptional communication skills


If this position would be of interest to you or anyone within your network please apply through the link or send an updated resume to adam@umatr.io for consideration.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
HTML:
At a glance

ABN AMRO is seeking a Machine Learning Engineer (MLE) to join the ML & AI platform enablement team. This role is ideal for individuals passionate about working at the cutting edge of financial services technology, developing a central Machine Learning (ML) platform to meet evolving business needs. The candidate will work closely with Azure DevOps engineers and is expected to have a robust set of technical skills in machine learning, system design, and coding, combined with strong business support.

Department Goal

Analytics Engineering is the infrastructural heart of ABN AMRO's data and analytics capabilities within Platforms & Technology department. We focus on building multifunctional data platforms in secure way for turning data into value. Our core technical characteristics are reliability, security, innovation, and sustainability.

Department Culture

Analytics Engineering (AE) has a young and dynamic culture, focusing on delivery, fun and innovation. We work in a sustainable environment and foster a start-up atmosphere. Team members are encouraged to experiment with new ideas while developing reliable solutions. The department values proactive engagement with technology and effective teamwork, facilitated by a Scrum/Agile working methodology.

Your job

As an integral part of ML platform team, you will be working with Azure DevOps engineers in order to develop ML platform and adapt it to multiple Data Science teams across ABN AMRO. Your main goal is to enable MLOps capabilities on the central ML platform based on user needs and create clear guidelines and processes on using it.

Main Responsibilities

  • Participate in the ideation and design of ML platform with Azure DevOps engineers;
  • Experiment and implement new ML capabilities in the central ML platform;
  • Development of mock use cases, CI/CD templates and standardized frameworks;
  • Create guidelines and process for Data Science teams to use MLOps capabilities;
  • Connect with domain Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers to understand pain points and bring it back to the central ML Platform team.


Your profile

  • You have an academic background (MSc.) with a degree in Technology, Engineering or Mathematics;
  • You have 3+ years of experience in building machine learning based solutions, applicants are expected to have some practical experience;
  • You have a sense for business, and understand how machine learning delivers value;
  • You are pragmatic and value-focused, e.g. not afraid to work with existing solutions to reduce time-to-market;
  • You are able to communicate effectively with technical and business counterparts;
  • You are a team player that requires minimal steering to be productive;
  • You are up to date on the latest developments within ML and can guide others in finding optimal solutions;
  • You are familiar with the ‘tools of the trade’, e.g. Python, Spark, Git…;
  • You have experience with Azure Cloud, specifically Machine Learning Cloud solutions, such Azure ML and Databricks;
  • You are fluent in English.


Equal opportunities for all

The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.

Disclaimer external recruitment agencies

External recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. In addition, a recruitment agency can only submit a resume when invited by a Talent Acquisition Specialist to join the search for a right candidate. All unsolicited resumes sent to us will be considered property of ABN AMRO BANK N.V. In this case, ABN AMRO will not be held liable to pay a placement fee.

Wij vragen

  • Een klantgerichte visie
  • Een ondernemende houding

Title: Junior data scientist
Description:
Junior Data Scientist:

Zichtbaar werk: Je verwezenlijkt de missie en strategie van PostNL met data science oplossingen die op grote schaal gebruikt en gewaardeerd worden door collega’s binnen E-commerce

Uitdaging: Je komt terecht in een team dat groeit in volwassenheid en daarmee complexere vraagstukken voor e-commerce realiseert

Goede sfeer: Samenwerken, uitdagingen aangegaan en plezier hebben tijdens het werk zijn belangrijke elementen voor de fijne sfeer in dit team

Vrijheid: Je hebt de flexibiliteit om deels vanuit huis te werken en deels op een flexplek in ons levendige en hypermoderne kantoor in het historische Stationspostgebouw, naast station Holland Spoor.

Verantwoordelijkheid: Je hebt de vrijheid om je functie en werktijden grotendeels zelf in te vullen.

Ontwikkelkansen: Er zijn volop mogelijkheden om opleidingen te volgen en door te groeien naar andere functies of afdelingen binnen het bedrijf.







We bezorgen elke dag pakketten en zijn de onmisbare schakel tussen verzenders en ontvangers. We verbinden werelden en als Data Scientist ben jij cruciaal om onze e-commerce bezorging te verbeteren en bij te dragen aan de missie van PostNL.




Dit is jouw rol

We zijn op zoek naar een nieuwsgierige Junior Data Scientist om ons Data Science E-commerce team te versterken. In deze functie werk je aan artificial intelligence en machine learning (AI/ML) oplossingen die direct bijdragen aan onze missie om de favoriete bezorger te zijn. Je speelt een belangrijke rol in het mogelijk maken van data-gedreven besluitvorming binnen de afdeling E-commerce, waarbij je rechtstreeks bijdraagt aan onze strategie en nauw samenwerkt met data scientists in het team. Als je van uitdagingen houdt, graag out-of-the-box denkt en een passie hebt voor de nieuwste technologieën op het gebied van machine learning en automatisering, willen we graag van je horen.




Je zal op je plek zijn bij PostNL als je resultaatgericht en innovatief bent en bedrijfswaarde wilt leveren door het ontwikkelen van machine learning oplossingen, en vooral als je weet wat de onderdelen van de machine learning lifecycle zijn.




Waar je aan zult werken:

Ontwerpen en bouwen van geautomatiseerde AI/ML oplossingen voor de E-commerce afdeling
Zorgen voor hoogwaardige data science oplossingen door middel van testen, best practices, engineering standaarden en lifecycle management
Impact maken als teamspeler en relaties onderhouden met zowel technische als niet-technische stakeholders
Bijdragen aan de vooruitgang van data science bij PostNL binnen onze data chapter




Jouw collega's

Je zult deel uitmaken van een dynamisch en innovatief Data Science E-commerce team dat floreert door samenwerking en gedeelde doelen. Ons team bestaat uit fantastische data scientists die niet alleen experts zijn in hun vakgebied, maar elkaar ook graag ondersteunen en van elkaar leren. We geloven in de kracht van teamwerk en koesteren een cultuur waarin jouw ideeën worden gewaardeerd en jouw bijdragen een tastbare impact kunnen hebben op onze bedrijfsstrategie. Je krijgt de kans om samen te werken met mensen die net zo toegewijd zijn aan het ontwikkelen van data science-oplossingen als aan het creëren van een fijne en ondersteunende werkomgeving. Samen verleggen we de grenzen van wat mogelijk is, en zorgen we ervoor dat we ieders favoriete bezorger zijn.




Dit breng je mee

Ervaring met R of Python en SQL
Kennis van statistiek
Ervaring met het bouwen van libraries/modules in Python
Goed begrip van fundamentele machine learning concepten
Kennis van rapportage- en visualisatietechnieken (bijv. Plotly, Tableau, Power BI, Streamlit, etc.)
Bereidheid om diep in problemen en achterliggende data te duiken om technische problemen en bugs op te lossen
Bekend met het gebruik van API's, het bouwen/onderhouden ervan is een plus
Goede Engelse communicatieve vaardigheden




Dit bezorgen we jou

Een salaris tussen €3.817,00 en €5.260,00 per maand (schaal 10) bij een werkweek van 37 uur.

De mogelijkheid om hybride te werken met flexibele werktijden. Werk je twee dagen of meer per week vanuit huis? Dan ontvang je een vergoeding van € 45,- netto per maand.

8% vakantiegeld en 25 vakantiedagen op basis van een fulltime dienstverband.

Reiskostenvergoeding voor woon-werkverkeer.

Een goede pensioenregeling via het PostNL Pensioenfonds.

Opleidings- en ontwikkelmogelijkheden via de PostNL Academy.

Korting op vakanties, evenementen en producten.




Het sollicitatieproces voor deze functie bestaat uit 2 interviews. We kijken uit naar je sollicitatie. Twijfel je of je aan alle voorwaarden voldoet, maar ben je wel heel enthousiast na het lezen van de bovenstaande tekst? Aarzel dan niet en solliciteer, we horen graag van je!




Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Coders Connect is excited to partner with a groundbreaking company driving the energy transition in the Netherlands. This innovative organization is harnessing cutting-edge technology to optimize real assets and batteries, creating immediate impact for both customers and society at large. They’re on a mission to build a sustainable future, and we’re helping them find a confident, independent Senior Data Scientist to lead the charge.




What You'll Be Doing:

Leading and growing the Data Science function within the business.
Taking existing algorithms to the next level through innovation and cloud deployment on AWS.
Applying your expertise in Time Series analysis while working hands-on with Python, SQL, and advanced technologies such as Pytorch and Tensorflow.
Implementing data models that deliver actionable insights to drive business value and accelerate societal impact.




Requirements:

5+ years of experience in Data Science, with strong Python and SQL skills.
Expertise in Time Series analysis with a solid mathematical foundation.
Cloud deployment experience using AWS.
An independent, curious problem-solver who thrives on ownership and enjoys implementing innovative models.
While experience in the energy sector is a plus, it’s not a must.




Benefits:

Be at the heart of the energy transition, working on projects that have an immediate and tangible real-world impact.
Shape the future of the Data Science department with the freedom to implement your ideas and make a direct contribution to the company’s growth.
Join a close-knit team, working alongside a CTO, three developers, and a part-time Data Scientist, all committed to advancing technology in this rapidly growing sector.
Hybrid work environment in the vibrant city of Utrecht.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
I am partnered with an exciting Artificial Intelligence💫 research start-up based in Rotterdam, Specializing in automating the visual surveying of industrial assets.




Apply now and become a part of a rapidly growing and visionary company 🚀







Key Responsibilities




Overseeing the performance of AI models, and making sure that they are constantly being improved with the new data received from our clients.
Identifying new approaches that can further improve the performance of AI models through data augmentation, as well as pre and post processing methods.
Quickly recognizes opportunities and develops creative solutions that add to the company's unique selling proposition, this can also be related to components outside of AI.
Conducts quality control of all models and systems to ensure an overall robust infrastructure; this includes overseeing and potentially managing a small labeling team for projects that are assigned to you.
Making the AI production ready by increasing performance and reducing processing times through improvement of the actual AI pipeline.







Required Skills and Abilities




A Master or PhD degree in AI, Computer science, Engineering or any other related technical field.
Experience in full stack development
3+ years of experience developing and designing Computer Vision technologies and systems.
You have hands-on experience with deep/machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.
Strong commercial experience with Python.
Industry experience with software such as Git, Linux.
Experience in GIS/Geomatics
Able to perform multiple tasks, balance priorities, and meet deadlines; ability to work under pressure.
Able to work independently and as a member of a multidisciplinary agile-driven team.
Takes initiative and has a high level of ambition, motivation, and passion.
Must be based in the Netherlands, preferably close to Rotterdam.







Benefits:

salary package up to 75,000 gross
Travel allowance
Flexible working




Make sure to apply here or contact me: @george.rayner@vivdresourcing.com

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
LocationUtrecht, NetherlandsBusiness SectorAIContact emailJob ref23546Published7 days ago

We are seeking an experienced Data Scientist to join one of our clients in MedTech. The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing data-driven insights, predictive models, and advanced analytics. You will collaborate closely with engineers and clinicians to translate data into actionable insights.

Responsibilities


Analyze large, complex healthcare datasets to identify trends and generate actionable insights.
Develop predictive models and algorithms to improve clinical decision-making and patient outcomes.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data science solutions into medical devices and healthcare applications.
Ensure data quality, integrity, and security in compliance with healthcare standards.
Stay updated with the latest advancements in data science and apply them to healthcare challenges.



Qualifications


Proven experience as a Data Scientist, ideally within the healthcare or MedTech industry.
Strong proficiency in Python, R, SQL, and data visualization tools.
Expertise in statistical analysis, machine learning, and predictive modeling.
Experience working with large datasets and cloud-based data platforms.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams.
Professional proficiency in English.



Can this be interesting for you or anyone you know? If so, please send Gabriel Andrade: g.andrade@panda-int.com, your number/CV ASAP and I'll give you a call. Interviews will start next week.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Responsibilities:


We are hiring a senior data scientist for the machine learning and advanced analytics DS team.
Apply machine learning and advanced analytic methods to solve challenging problems and deliver scalable game solutions in development, publishing, and live operations.
Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes and provide end-to-end data solutions with large-scale data analysis, experimentation, machine learning/deep learning/reinforcement learning model development, validation, and serving.
Interact cross-functionally with various teams and provide actionable business insights for stakeholders.


Requirements:


Graduated with a master’s or Ph.D. program in a quantitative discipline such as statistics, machine learning, computer science, math, economics, etc.
Expertise in one or more of the following areas: machine learning & statistical learning, deep learning, reinforcement learning, statistical analysis, experimentation, NLP, computer vision, recommendation system, and any other data science-related domains.
Experience utilizing analytics, inference, experimentation, or machine learning techniques in real-world applications is preferred.
Excellent knowledge of data science methods and best practices, such as data analysis and visualization, supervised learning, unsupervised learning, and time series.
Proficient in SQL and Python.
Show more
HTML:
Responsibilities:

  • We are hiring a senior data scientist for the machine learning and advanced analytics DS team.
  • Apply machine learning and advanced analytic methods to solve challenging problems and deliver scalable game solutions in development, publishing, and live operations.
  • Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes and provide end-to-end data solutions with large-scale data analysis, experimentation, machine learning/deep learning/reinforcement learning model development, validation, and serving.
  • Interact cross-functionally with various teams and provide actionable business insights for stakeholders.

Requirements:

  • Graduated with a master’s or Ph.D. program in a quantitative discipline such as statistics, machine learning, computer science, math, economics, etc.
  • Expertise in one or more of the following areas: machine learning & statistical learning, deep learning, reinforcement learning, statistical analysis, experimentation, NLP, computer vision, recommendation system, and any other data science-related domains.
  • Experience utilizing analytics, inference, experimentation, or machine learning techniques in real-world applications is preferred.
  • Excellent knowledge of data science methods and best practices, such as data analysis and visualization, supervised learning, unsupervised learning, and time series.
  • Proficient in SQL and Python.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Senior Data Scientist at Data Tribes – For Data-Driven Solutions




About Data Tribes

Welcome to Data Tribes, where community, growth, and innovation thrive. At Data Tribes, you're not just a title or degree—you're potential waiting to be unleashed. We offer an environment where learning by doing is the norm, fostering both personal and professional growth.




Your Role

As a Senior Data Science Consultant at Data Tribes, you'll be instrumental in transforming complex business challenges into actionable solutions. You'll collaborate with our dynamic, Amsterdam-based startup, dedicated to helping clients fully unlock their data potential—efficiently, accurately, and with ease.




Responsibilities

Transform user requirements into cutting-edge products.
Develop dashboards, reports, and algorithms that convert structured and unstructured data into actionable insights.
Utilize storytelling to visualize data, making it accessible and impactful.
Take on roles such as Data Analyst, Storyteller, or Data Scientist, leading projects and impressing clients with your deliverables.




Qualifications

Minimum of two years of professional experience and a degree at HBO or university level.
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or SAS VA/Viya.
Familiarity with Microsoft Azure/Synapse and SAS is a plus.
Knowledge of R, Python, Spark, Scala, Hadoop, HBase, MongoDB, AeroSpike, AWS, TensorFlow, Matlab is advantageous.
Understanding of Topic Modeling, Recurrent Neural Networks, Generative Adversarial Networks, Deep Learning, Word Embedding, Tree-Based Models, Dimensional Reduction, Clustering, Optimization, and Statistical & Machine Learning Methods is beneficial.




What We Offer

Extensive training and courses for personal and professional development.
Competitive salary with comprehensive benefits.
Mobility budget.
Monthly internet allowance.
Hybrid working options.
Laptop and phone reimbursement.
24 vacation days per year.




Our Culture

At Data Tribes, we prioritize your safety and comfort, making you feel as at home as in your favorite hoodie. We believe in merging work with lively, respectful discussions, often sparking the most innovative ideas. Our startup is committed to helping clients achieve their sustainability goals through data-driven solutions, creating a lasting green impact. Join us to help transform the world with your data expertise.




Are We a Match?

We're looking for passionate individuals eager to join us in our ambitious journey. Are you seeking a challenge and a place to learn and grow? If so, we’d love to hear from you!




Apply Now

Ready to join Data Tribes as a Senior Data Science Consultant? Apply now and become part of a team that’s driving change and making the world greener.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data, Analys & Rapportering är ett nyetablerat team som stöttar samtliga funktioner inom Commercial Lines i syfte att uppnå ett högre användande av data och analys i aktiviteter och beslut.

Vi supporterar organisationen samtidigt som vi kontinuerligt söker tillämpningar inom analys, maskininlärning (ML) och AI som driver utveckling och lönsamhet.

Teamet har också ett övergripande ansvar för Commercial Lines rapportering och rapporteringsplattform i Power BI.

Vi söker nu en kund- och affärsfokuserad Data Scientist som vill jobba i ett team med höga målsättningar inom ett av Commercial Lines strategiska satsningsområden.

Du utforskar, analyserar och visualiserar stora mängder kunddata från olika datakällor och bygger prediktiva modeller som ökar träffsäkerheten och skapar värde i våra aktiviteter och kundinteraktioner.

Om rollen 

Som Data Scientist kommer du att jobba med både operativa och strategiska frågeställningar.

Du utforskar och testar nya ML- och AI-metoder och verktyg och är med och utvecklar vår data- och analysmiljö.

I rollen arbetar du både under eget ansvar och i nära samarbete med andra analytiker, intressenter och kollegor från många olika delar av organisationen.

Exempel På Arbetsuppgifter Och Ansvarsområden


Kombinera och transformera stora mängder data från både interna och externa datakällor.
Genomföra kvantitativ analys och segmentering i syfte att bättre förstå våra kunders behov och beteenden, samt identifiera trender och segment med hög potential.
Kontinuerligt söka nya ML och AI use-cases, samt delta i, initiera och vara ansvarig för analysprojekt.
Bygga och implementera prediktiva modeller som gör våra aktiviteter mer träffsäkra och lönsamma.
Automatisera modeller och dataflöden.
I samarbete med IT säkerställa access och integrationer med nya och befintliga datakällor och bidra i utvecklingen av Commercial Lines data- och analysmiljö.
Presentera analysresultat och ge rekommendationer till våra intressenter.


Placeringsort är i Stockholm eller Malmö och rapporterar till Chef Data, Analys & Rapportering. 

Din profil och kvalifikationer

För att lyckas och trivas i denna roll tror vi att du har: 


Master/Magister- eller civilingenjörsexamen med inriktning mot Statistik/Matematik/Data.
några års erfarenhet i liknande roll.
mycket goda kunskaper i statistisk analys och metoder.
erfarenhet av att bygga och implementera prediktiva modeller.
goda kunskaper i SQL och ETL-processer.
erfarenhet av analys och modellering med Python och/eller R.
förmåga att presentera analysresultat på ett pedagogiskt sätt.
förmåga att uttrycka dig väl på svenska och engelska både i tal och skrift. 


Som person är du skicklig på att systematiskt bryta ner och hantera komplexa frågor.

Du tar gärna initiativ, arbetar effektivt och har en motivation att nå framdrift.

Du är nyfiken på att förstå affärens och mottagarnas behov och utvecklar därefter datadrivna lösningar som gör skillnad i verksamheten.

Du uppskattar att samarbeta med människor från olika bakgrunder för att tillsammans nå förbättrade resultat. 

Vad vi erbjuder dig

Hos oss blir du en del av ett team med kunniga och nyfikna kollegor och en inkluderande arbetsplats med ett stort hjärta.

Trygg-Hansa är en arbetsplats där alla ska kunna vara sig själva. Vi tror på att utveckling och lärande något som ständigt pågår – och vi vill att du växer.

Vi tror också att ett personligt engagemang är bra både för dig och för företaget. Här kan alla använda några arbetsdagar per år till ideellt arbete.

Ansökan 

Välkommen med din ansökan via länken nedan. Då urvalet sker löpande ser vi gärna att du inkommer med din ansökan snarast möjligt.

Vid frågor om tjänsten, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Frank Svensson på via mejl: frank.svensson@trygghansa.se. 

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! 

Vi undanber oss kontakt från annons-, konsult- och rekryteringsföretag gällande våra annonserade roller.

Fackliga representanter  

Akademikerföreningen: Cecilia Jarlstedt, cecilia.jarlstedt@trygghansa.se    

Forena: Elias Bakk, 070-730 68 54  

jobbrekvisitions-ID: 26171

Trygg-Hansa har gjort skillnad i människors liv sedan 1828 och är i dag en del av Tryg-koncernen, Skandinaviens största sakförsäkringsbolag. Som medarbetare på Trygg-Hansa arbetar du med 7 500 engagerade kollegor över hela Tryg-koncernen i Sverige, Norge och Danmark. Tillsammans skapar vi trygghet för livet.


Show more

Title: Data Scientist (Analytics), New Verticals
Description:
Job Description

About the New Verticals Group

The New Verticals Group is all about expanding Wolt beyond Restaurants and helping deliver anything our Customers want with unprecedented convenience and world-leading customer experience. We want to make Wolt, the best place to order groceries, convenience, pharmacy, electronics, home, pet stores, clothing, and other retail goods. Our vision is to make Wolt the world’s best shopping mall, in your pocket.

We work closely together with cross-functional teams to ensure that we have solid organic and inorganic growth plans, that we execute those perfectly in our country operations, and disseminate best practices across the organization to reduce the growth pains of rapid scaling (it always hurts when you grow >2x per year!) 🚀

About The New Verticals Analytics Team

Our New Verticals Analytics team sits at the intersection of product development, strategic planning, and operational execution. We partner with Product, Engineering, Design, and Operations teams to guide measurement and tactical decision-making using advanced analytics as we expand the Wolt platform across the globe.

You’ll be part of this team working with top Data Science and Analytics Engineering professionals.

About The Role

As a Data Scientist at Wolt, your role involves diving into our data to solve crucial business problems. The scope of this role ranges from diagnosing problem areas to identifying solutions, to designing experiments and ultimately influencing decision-making. This is a rare, operational, and actionable data-driven experience that combines scientific expertise with stakeholder engagement. When you join this team, you will be taking ownership of the business outcomes.

If you enjoy finding patterns amidst the chaos, are excited to build from the ground up, and have experience using data science skills to solve business problems, we want you on our team.

Our offering to you


The online delivery platform that Wolt is building will offer you interesting and complex challenges together with the opportunities to create a big impact with your skills. Lots of geolocational and temporal data in real-time combined with differences in the economics and dynamics of the cities we operate in make Wolt both a challenging and so interesting company to practice analytics.
You can choose the location from our tech hubs Helsinki, Berlin and Stockholm, or you can work entirely remotely anywhere in Finland, Germany, Sweden and Estonia. You have the chance to decide the ways of working — a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the location above. 💙 Read more about our remote setup.
You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda’s greatest achievement. Read more about how we work.


Our humble expectations


Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
4+ years of experience in a Data Analytics or Data Science position.
Expertise in statistical analysis using statistical software packages in Python or R.
Expertise in causal inference (Diff in Diff, Synthetic control).
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets.
Prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar.
Relentless pursuit of new ideas and data sources, and have the ability to systematically tackle ambiguous problems with a data-driven, hypothesis-based approach.


Next Steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Zhanna Filintseva (zhanna.filintseva@wolt.com)

About Wolt

Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt is not just a delivery app – we’re a technology company building a commerce platform to seamlessly connect our millions of customers with thousands of merchant and courier partners, in real-time across 23 countries and 250+ cities. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt’s name, brand, product, technology and team.

Working in Product Development at Wolt

At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together!


Show more

Join us today to build Wolt together!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
This is Readly

Readly offers unlimited access to thousands of national and international magazines and newspapers, all in one app. We’ve partnered with 1,000+ publishers, providing readers with 8,000+ titles. We’re a value-driven ecosystem committed to unlocking a world of editorial content. Our goal is to boost journalistic content consumption through digitalisation, while minimizing our climate impact. With a dedicated team of 100+ professionals in Sweden, Germany and the UK, we’re making magazines and trusted journalism more accessible.




Data and Analytics @ Readly

The data and analytics team is based in Sweden (either Stockholm or Växjö) but works towards all markets, providing actionable insights and data-driven services and models to marketing, content, product, management and finance departments. The analytics team consists of data engineers, data analysts and data scientists and we work cross-functionally with business, product and tech stakeholders. We value work/life balance but also believe that we grow and develop when we meet which is why we have a few mandatory days when we work from the office together.




About your role:

We are looking for a curious and driven data scientist/ML engineer to help continue Readly’s strive towards a data driven organization. You will have the opportunity to make a big difference in all areas of the company and will come across projects that will help our customers to find the most relevant content for them and to find their way in the app. Or projects that help business managers understand who might be a potential customer and predict trends in the market and customer behavior.




You will need to take a high degree of ownership for the end-to-end process from idea to productionised solution and you will need a few years of work experience from a similar role to accomplish this. That said, the team strives to help and learn from each other and to share both challenges and successes, so you will not be alone in your responsibilities. The role gives you great opportunities to influence both technical and business decisions.




Key role responsibilities

Work with teams and stakeholders to identify business opportunities and how to realize them using data and machine learning
Translate business and product needs into technical requirements
Develop new and manage existing data models and pipelines
Develop, deploy and maintain machine learnings models and workflows in production, we currently use AWS sagemaker and fargate, terraform, dbt and snowflake




Required Experience & skills

A BSc or higher in a relevant field such as Engineering, Data/Computer Science, Statistics or other quantitative field.
Strong skills and interest in statistical analysis and machine learning/AI
Minimum 4 years working experience in a similar role
Experienced in Python programming in a professional setting. (or extensive experience in other languages combined with knowledge of python)
SQL experience
Experience from end-to-end data science for product development (e.g. recommendation engines, user segmentation, content classification) or for marketing/customer relations (e.g. marketing optimisation, customer life-time value, churn propensity)
Good communication skills and ability to lead discussions related to Data Science opportunities
Must already be eligible to work from either the Stockholm or Växjö offices, we do not offer relocation or visa assistance




It is a big bonus if you also have one or more of the following

Architectural skills or experience in MLops
Experience with data science and machine learning on the AWS platform
Experience with infrastructure as code and CI/CD pipelines
Extensive Data modeling/data engineering skills




And most important of all is a curious mindset and a willingness and interest to learn and expand your skill set.




Readly has been listed on the Allbright list three years in a row for having a gender balanced management team. In addition we are very proud to also have a 50/50 gender split among our employees and managers. We encourage people of all genders, ethnicities and ages to apply. If you think the role sounds like a good match for you and want to join us on our journey we would love to learn more about you. Don’t hesitate to get in touch!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Company Description

We are a consulting company with a bunch of technology-interested and happy people!

We love technology, we love design and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where each individual is highly valued.

With us, each individual is her/himself and respects others for who they are and we believe that when a fantastic mix of people gather and share their knowledge, experiences and ideas, we can help our customers on a completely different level.

We are looking for you who want to grow with us!

With us, you have great opportunities to take real steps in your career and the opportunity to take great responsibility.

Job description:

The primary tasks for a Machine Learning Engineer in MLE area are:


Develop AI/ML software products including but not limited to explore large data set, try out new algorithms, feature engineering, test and evaluate model output, deploy the solution for production usageandscale out for a maintainable solution.FH&
Design, develop and maintain the large-scale data infrastructure required for the AI/ML projects.
Leverage on understanding of software architecture and software design patterns to write scalable, maintainable, well-designed, and future-proof code.
Develop solutions, components, services and frameworks to address both specific and common needs in AI/ML projects, like feature reuse, model traceability, monitoring, A/B test, versioning, release, and serving of both online inference end-points and batch inference.
Work in cross-functional agile team of highly skilled engineers, data scientists, business stakeholders to build the AI ecosystem within the company.



Required skills and experiences:


Have a BSc or MSc degree in computer science, engineering or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
Have 4+ years professional experience working in relevant role(s) for a Machine Learning Engineer.
A hands-on person, with great software engineering skills, who loves coding, and like applying software engineering practices to machine learning and AI projects.
Have experience in developing software products that have been successfully deployed to production and scaled in a bigger organization.
Have several years of coding experience in modern programming languages, and strong background in Python programming, i.e. 4+ years.
Have great hands-on experience with cloud technologies for ML development, preferably Google Cloud Platform, and also including Vertex AI.
Have solid experience in MLOps practices, developing ML pipelines, data pipelines and deploying ML applications to production.
Have a strong working knowledge of a variety of AI/ML techniques and experience working with different frameworks.
Have experience handling and developing for high volume heterogeneous data (both batch and stream), preferably also including hands-on development in DBT, and have also a solid understanding of cloud data storage technologies and data quality.
Have experience from aligning and analyzing requirement; driving design solutions; breaking down work into stories and tasks; and making sure organizational standards and best-practices are implemented and followed.
Familiar with agile ways of working, team collaboration, data-driven development, reliable and responsible experimentation.



Required cloud certification: GCP Professional Machine Learning Engine

We are looking for you who:

Start: Immediately

Location: Stockholm

Form of employment: Full-time until further notice, we apply 6 months probationary employment

We interview candidates on an ongoing basis, do not wait to submit your application.

Title: DATA SCIENTIST
Description:
Arbetsuppgifter

För vår kunds räkning söker vi nu en erfaren och driven Data Scientist som vill arbeta i en dynamisk miljö och bidra till strategiska beslut inom finans. Du kommer att samarbeta nära med Head of Treasury, data teamet och andra data scientists på Qliro. Tillsammans kommer ni att använda gemensamma verktyg för maskininlärning, främst Python och SQL, för att ta fram avancerade prediktionsmodeller för finansiella transaktioner och nyckeltal.

Som Data Scientist hos vår kund kommer du att:

Arbeta med att utveckla och optimera prognosmodeller för finansiella transaktioner och nyckeltal.
Analysera data och skapa prediktiva modeller med hjälp av Python och SQL.
Samarbeta med olika avdelningar för att säkerställa att dina analyser och modeller bidrar till affärsstrategiska beslut.
Leverera insikter och förutsägelser som stödjer och förbättrar finansiella processer.


Kvalifikationer
Du har erfarenhet av att arbeta inom finans, med fokus på dataanalys och prediktiva modeller.
Du har starka kunskaper i Python och SQL.
Du har erfarenhet av att arbeta med prognosmodeller för finansiella transaktioner.
Flytande i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
Meriterande
Erfarenhet från e-handel är ett stort plus.
Du har en analytisk och lösningsorienterad inställning.
Du har förmågan att arbeta både självständigt och i team.
Du har starka kommunikationsförmågor och kan tydligt förklara komplexa analyser.
Personliga egenskaper


För att lyckas i rollen som Data Scientist hos vår kund ser vi gärna att du:

Är analytisk och har en naturlig fallenhet för att lösa komplexa problem.
Är självständig och tar egna initiativ i ditt arbete.
Har ett noggrant och strukturerat arbetssätt.
Är kommunikativ och kan tydligt förmedla insikter och slutsatser till olika intressenter.
Är flexibel och anpassningsbar i en snabbt föränderlig miljö.

Om oss

JobBusters är ett auktoriserat personaluthyrnings- och rekryteringsföretag som är inriktade mot tjänstemän och har funnits sen 2011. Vi på JobBusters bryr oss om våra konsulter och vårt mål är alltid att bygga långsiktiga relationer med både konsult och kund. Vårt mål är alltid att matcha våra kunders drömkandidat med våra kandidaters drömjobb!

När du blir en av oss


Som konsult hos JobBusters kan du känna dig trygg med ett kollektivavtal i ryggen, tillgängliga konsultchefer och engagerade rekryterare. Du som konsult får även tillgång till vårt nätverk av spännande företag och uppdragsgivare! För oss är det viktigt att du som konsult trivs, känner en trygghet och gemenskap till oss som arbetsgivare. Vi erbjuder tjänstepension, löneväxling och möjlighet till flexpension. Du får även tillgång till vår förmånsportal, där du utöver friskvårdsbidrag har tillgång till mängder av rabatter och erbjudanden inom hälsa, hem och fritid, transport, sjukvård och mycket mer! Ditt välmående är av högsta prioritet för oss och vi erbjuder därför dig som anställd Företagshälsovård för att hantera vardagens alla utmaningar, både på jobbet och i privatlivet.

Lön


Enligt överenskommelse.

Tillträde och ansökan


Heltid, kontorstider. Vår kund önskar start omgående och uppdraget förväntas löpa t.o.m. 2025-02-28 med möjlighet till förlängning. Du kommer att vara anställd av JobBusters som konsult hos vår spännande kund. Vi går igenom ansökningarna löpande och i konsultvärlden går processerna oftast snabbt. Rollen kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum, vänta därför inte med att skicka in din ansökan (gärna i Word-format). Sista ansökningsdag är 2024-08-22.

Title: Data Scientist, Programming & Editorial
Description:
Spotify’s mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the opportunity to enjoy and be inspired by these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music, podcasts & books. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service with a community of more than 615 million users. We are looking for an outstanding Data Scientist to join the Content Analytics group and build core analytics to support our Music Editorial teams, meaning the teams of music experts at Spotify who curate playlists and musical experiences

What You’ll Do


Learn about music data, build relationships with music experts around the world, and over time, take on a variety of ad-hoc analyses. You’ll extract actionable insights from large datasets and drive decisions in the field of music recommendations.
Improve on a suite of data tools primarily built for Spotify’s editorial teams, covering a range of angles into how listeners seek out music and engage with recommendations.
Communicate data-driven insights and recommendations to non-technical audiences, through clear visualizations and data storytelling
Train editorial teams around the world on how to use data & insights. Own and improve on the documentation of data tools and training material
Engineer novel data sets that shed a new light on the dynamics of music listening


Who You Are


You have a degree in a quantitative field, such as Computer Science/Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics; advanced degree is desirable
2+ years of relevant experience performing data analysis or data science.
You are entirely autonomous in SQL (a must)
Data visualization is one of the aspects of data science that you enjoy the most. You have a strong aptitude with business intelligence softwares such as Tableau and Google Data Studio. (a must)
Experience with Python is a strong plus
Experience creating and scheduling datasets is also highly valued.
You are passionate about music. Previous experience in creative industries is a preference, but not a hard requirement if you have a deep empathy for how the music art form is created and enjoyed.
You are a natural communicator. You focus just as much on how you deliver your findings, as you do on the technical craft of uncovering new insights.


Where You’ll Be


Onsite: New York, Boston, Berlin, London or Stockholm


The United States base range for this position is $86,691 to $123,844, plus equity. The benefits available for this position include health insurance, six month paid parental leave, 401(k) retirement plan, monthly meal allowance, 23 paid days off, 13 paid flexible holidays, paid sick leave. These ranges may be modified in the future.

Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
My client is looking for a Data Scientist who has a real interest in a more programming heavy role, to join their vibrant team in their sleek Stockholm office.

The company's main focus is working alongside businesses (small, medium and enterprise) to ensure that they are maximising their business operations; this includes anything from auditing, payroll to VAT accounting, declaration or business acquisition.

They are now looking to build their impactful technology dept with a Data Scientist.

Responsibilities


Enhance MLOps environment: Continuously improve the machine learning operations (MLOps) environment to streamline model deployment and monitoring processes.
Work with Large Language Models (LLMs): Develop and optimize models using large language models to meet various project requirements.
Deploy ML models to production: Manage the end-to-end deployment of machine learning models, ensuring they are robust, scalable, and efficient in production.
Collaborate with internal teams: Partner with internal business teams to understand their needs and provide data-driven solutions.
Engage with portfolio companies: Work closely with companies within the portfolio to deliver machine learning solutions that address specific business challenges and opportunities.


Qualifications


Minimum of 2 years working as a Data Scientist or a Software/Data Engineer who's worked with building ML algorithms
2 years engineering experience with Python
Confident working with cloud and most preferably Azure - their tech stack includes Form Recognizer, Cognitive Search, Storage and others
Worked with supervising models in production
Familiar with a MLOps enviro, supervising models in productions and LLMs
It's beneficial if you've previously deployed unsupervised and supervised ML models to production
BSc/MSc in a relevant field
Fluency in Swedish and English


As a Data Scientist, you will get a lot of trust to do your own thing and take on a huge amount of responsibility where you can make a lot of your own solutions and have full control over the Data Science strategy.

This is a great opportunity if you're somebody who loves having a broad role in an environment that encourages you to grow and learn new things, while working with modern tech.

Interested in finding out more? Apply with your updated CV.

  • Engage with portfolio companies: Work closely with companies within the portfolio to deliver machine learning solutions that address specific business challenges and opportunities.

  • Minimum of 2 years working as a Data Scientist or a Software/Data Engineer who's worked with building ML algorithms
  • 2 years engineering experience with Python
  • Confident working with cloud and most preferably Azure - their tech stack includes Form Recognizer, Cognitive Search, Storage and others
  • Worked with supervising models in production
  • Familiar with a MLOps enviro, supervising models in productions and LLMs
  • It's beneficial if you've previously deployed unsupervised and supervised ML models to production
  • BSc/MSc in a relevant field
  • Fluency in Swedish and English

As a Data Scientist, you will get a lot of trust to do your own thing and take on a huge amount of responsibility where you can make a lot of your own solutions and have full control over the Data Science strategy.

This is a great opportunity if you're somebody who loves having a broad role in an environment that encourages you to grow and learn new things, while working with modern tech.

Interested in finding out more? Apply with your updated CV.

Title: AI or ML Engineer
Description:
Are you looking for a role within an exciting world of AI technologies, where you can both contribute to the project with your expertise and keep on learning?

We are starting a new chapter within ASSA ABLOY’s organization, and we are looking for top talent to help us grow our AI Technical Development Teams from scratch.

Join our Team in Stockholm, Sweden and enjoy a collaborative culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.

What would you do as our AI or ML Engineer

We are looking for an AI generalist to join our brand new project related to AI Technical Development, together with our newly created Team of Engineers, based in Stockholm.

We work in cross-functional teams, responsible for developing modern, secure and top-quality solutions. We develop embedded applications and integrate them with Mobile Applications, Electronic Access Control software using cloud and microservice architecture.

You would also:


Stay up-to-date with the latest AI technologies.
Be responsible for ML and GenAI development processes.
Perform data preparation, validation, cleaning, testing.
Be responsible for model training, deployment, tracking.


The Skills And Experience You Need

We are looking for someone who:


has previous experienced as an AI or ML engineer, including building data pipelines, training models or developing Gen AI LLM based apps and deploying them safely to production.
has hands-on experience with MLOps and training modern ML models.
is experienced in LLMs and other models, Gen AI and ‘Chatbots’.
is experienced in Python, Jupyter, TensorFlow/PyTorch.
has knowledge of Cloud infrastructure, data bases, CI/CD.
is fluent in English, spoken and written.


What We Offer

We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a lifelong career with us – here’s what we have to offer:


Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
A competitive salary and incentive schemes.
Hybrid model of working.
Flexible working hours.
Stable employment in a friendly international atmosphere.


We review applications regularly, so don’t wait

We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply here, no later than 15th Septembe 2024.

To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, email Daria Skucha, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at Daria.Skucha@assaabloy.com.

Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!

To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com

We are the ASSA ABLOY Group

Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.

As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.

As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.
