Title: Senior Data Scientist, Learning
Description:
We are looking for an entrepreneurial and business minded senior data scientist to join the band to help explore and execute on learning as a new opportunity for Spotify. It is a phenomenal role for someone who wants to work on a truly 0 to 1 project and have an impact on the company's growth trajectory!

As a data scientist in this team you’d partner with the full cross-functional team to help with research, data modeling and data-informed decision making related to building the product and driving impact for users, creators and the business. This is a fantastic opportunity to join our fast-paced team where you’ll get the chance to wear multiple hats and contribute to the product research and business analytics efforts to help craft and execute the product roadmap.

What You Are


Help build out the insights foundations that will allow us to gather conclusive evidence on the trajectory and viability of learning as an opportunity for Spotify. This includes instrumentation all the way through to analysis as well as understanding the learning space from multiple angles such as user, UX, content, marketing, creator and business perspectives to help inform decision making.
Develop business intelligence-, growth model- and product metrics framework.
Perform analysis on large sets of internal data to extract practical insights that will help drive product, platform and business decisions.
Design and conduct A/B tests to generate insights and drive impact across the entire learning product.
Build dashboards, data pipelines, and recurring reporting results, empowering business and product decision making
Develop models which power on- and off-platform promotion of learning based content
Help develop interest graph and content demand models for the content powering ML recommendations for users
Communicate data-driven insights and recommendations to key partners
Work closely and embedded with cross-functional team including engineering, product, design and business decision makers


Where You'll Do


You believe that Spotify can truly create an impact in the learning space and have a point of view on that.
You care end to end about the product, the implementation, the design, the creators, the business, and you are ready to wear multiple hats to achieve your goals.
You have experience in a data science role in a related field and expertise in science, computer science, statistics, economics, mathematics, or similar quantitative subject area.
You have experience with business intelligence, product analytics and complex data-driven decision making.
You have broad experience performing analysis with large datasets and strong understanding of experimentation, statistics and machine learning for decision making.
You value cross-disciplinary work and understand how to match qualitative research with your quantitative analysis.
You take pride in your ability to identify and solve complex, unfamiliar problems, and present them to the rest of the team.
You have a growth mindset, are curious and not afraid to be experimental. You share your ideas and continuously improve yourself and the team around you.
You have excellent skills across the data science stack including Python, SQL and visualization tools (we primarily use Jupyter notebooks, BigQuery and Tableau)


Where You'll Be


The team is distributed across the CET region with most people located in Stockholm and London.


#JobSite-Main-DataResearchAndInsights

#JobSite-Sub-DataScience

#HireRight Sweden Package

Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

Title: Data Scientist to a startup within mobile games
Description:
Our client is a Mobile Games studio in Stockholm, and is looking for an experienced Data Scientist who likes to tinker with data engineering and analytics.




Responsibilities:




Develop and Manage Databases: Design and maintain databases and data warehouses, ensuring efficient storage, retrieval, and data integrity.
Performance Optimization: Optimize database performance through indexing, query optimization, and regular maintenance.
Data Cleaning and Preprocessing: Clean and preprocess raw data to ensure quality and suitability for analysis, effectively handling missing data, outliers, and other data quality issues.
Model Performance Monitoring: Continuously monitor model performance, making necessary adjustments to maintain accuracy and relevance over time.
Data Visualization: Create compelling data visualizations and dashboards to present data insights clearly and effectively.
Communication of Complex Data: Use visualization tools to facilitate the understanding and communication of complex data.
Data Analysis: Analyze large datasets to extract actionable insights, identifying trends, patterns, and correlations that inform strategic decisions.




About You

We believe you have a background in data engineering and analytics within the gaming industry and have a passion for mobile games.




Requirements:




SQL Proficiency: Expert in SQL for querying and managing relational databases.
Google BigQuery Expertise: Experienced in using Google BigQuery for data warehousing, including understanding its SQL dialect and optimization techniques.
Scalable Database Solutions: Knowledgeable in creating distributed and scalable database solutions.
ETL Pipelines: Experienced in developing and managing ETL pipelines for data ingestion, processing, and transformation.
Statistical Analysis and Data Mining: Skilled in statistical analysis and data mining techniques to uncover insights from large datasets.
Dashboard Development: Proficient in building dashboards and supporting self-sufficient data models.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Experience working in cross-functional teams, providing data insights to support product improvements.




Their office is located in central Stockholm, and they all work on-site. They are looking for someone who wants to do the same.

Title: Data Scientist in Computer Vision
Description:
Scania aims to drive the shift towards a sustainable transport system, creating a world of mobility that is better for business, society, and the environment. Our department plays a central role in this journey by providing the information, tools, and systems needed to maintain, diagnose, repair, and upgrade the products qualitatively and cost-effectively.

About Us

We are a highly motivated and skilled team that values each other's ideas and supports one another whenever needed. Working in an agile manner, we continuously strive to enhance our methods. The team comprises Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers, Data Engineers, and Cloud Engineers. Our journey thus far has been notable, solidifying our reputation as a leading AI team engaged in the entire development process—from data collection to modelling, testing, and deploying ML models in production. However, to further elevate our achievements and scale our initiatives, it's imperative that our team grows.

You will together with the team



Develop, implement, and maintain state-of-the-art YOLO object detection models tailored for real-time applications, specifically in vehicle maintenance workshops.
Develop and evaluate different methods and frameworks to enhance YOLO object detection model performance in a production environment, optimizing data collection and annotation processes.
Utilize Active Learning techniques to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the training process by selecting the most informative data points from large-scale video streams.
Optimize data annotation processes and manage the challenges of handling large volumes of video data in real-time, ensuring high-quality model training data.
Utilize Agile methodology to ensure efficient and value-driven project delivery.



As a key member of our Data Science team, you will collaborate with diverse teams across the organization, from R&D to Sales & Marketing and beyond, as well as with other Data Science teams at Scania.

Our dream candidate

We are looking for someone with:



A background in engineering and a Master's degree in Machine Learning, Data Science, or a related field.
Solid knowledge and experience in Image/Video processing, YOLOv8, evaluation metrics for object detection (such as IoU and mAP), Deep Learning, Python, AWS, and Active Learning Frameworks.
The ability to work independently and effectively within an Agile environment and to collaborate across multidisciplinary teams.



As a person, we expect you to be structured, communicative, and service-minded. Fluency in English, both spoken and written, is essential.

What We Offer

We offer an inspiring workplace, with great respect for the individual, where you have great opportunities to shape your work and your future. Your personal and professional development is essential and something we encourage and support.

In addition, we offer benefits such as employee car, mutual bonus, occupational pension, flexible working hours, lunch at reduced prices, and much more. If you live in Stockholm, we offer a direct bus service between Stockholm and Södertälje, Scania Job Express.

Additional Information

Please contact Jesper Brauer, Head of Strategic Product Planning and Advanced Analytics, +46 8 553 50078.

Application

Your application should include a CV, personal letter, and grade copies. Please apply as soon as possible but no later than 2024-08-29. Ongoing selection and interviews will take place during the application period, the position may be filled before the end of the application period.

We use logic and personality tests in our selection process and a background check may be conducted for this position.

Welcome to apply!
Show more
HTML:
Scania aims to drive the shift towards a sustainable transport system, creating a world of mobility that is better for business, society, and the environment. Our department plays a central role in this journey by providing the information, tools, and systems needed to maintain, diagnose, repair, and upgrade the products qualitatively and cost-effectively.

About Us

We are a highly motivated and skilled team that values each other's ideas and supports one another whenever needed. Working in an agile manner, we continuously strive to enhance our methods. The team comprises Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers, Data Engineers, and Cloud Engineers. Our journey thus far has been notable, solidifying our reputation as a leading AI team engaged in the entire development process—from data collection to modelling, testing, and deploying ML models in production. However, to further elevate our achievements and scale our initiatives, it's imperative that our team grows.

You will together with the team


  • Develop, implement, and maintain state-of-the-art YOLO object detection models tailored for real-time applications, specifically in vehicle maintenance workshops.
  • Develop and evaluate different methods and frameworks to enhance YOLO object detection model performance in a production environment, optimizing data collection and annotation processes.
  • Utilize Active Learning techniques to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the training process by selecting the most informative data points from large-scale video streams.
  • Optimize data annotation processes and manage the challenges of handling large volumes of video data in real-time, ensuring high-quality model training data.
  • Utilize Agile methodology to ensure efficient and value-driven project delivery.


As a key member of our Data Science team, you will collaborate with diverse teams across the organization, from R&D to Sales & Marketing and beyond, as well as with other Data Science teams at Scania.

Our dream candidate

We are looking for someone with:


  • A background in engineering and a Master's degree in Machine Learning, Data Science, or a related field.
  • Solid knowledge and experience in Image/Video processing, YOLOv8, evaluation metrics for object detection (such as IoU and mAP), Deep Learning, Python, AWS, and Active Learning Frameworks.
  • The ability to work independently and effectively within an Agile environment and to collaborate across multidisciplinary teams.


As a person, we expect you to be structured, communicative, and service-minded. Fluency in English, both spoken and written, is essential.

What We Offer

We offer an inspiring workplace, with great respect for the individual, where you have great opportunities to shape your work and your future. Your personal and professional development is essential and something we encourage and support.

In addition, we offer benefits such as employee car, mutual bonus, occupational pension, flexible working hours, lunch at reduced prices, and much more. If you live in Stockholm, we offer a direct bus service between Stockholm and Södertälje, Scania Job Express.

Additional Information

Please contact Jesper Brauer, Head of Strategic Product Planning and Advanced Analytics, +46 8 553 50078.

Application

Your application should include a CV, personal letter, and grade copies. Please apply as soon as possible but no later than 2024-08-29. Ongoing selection and interviews will take place during the application period, the position may be filled before the end of the application period.

We use logic and personality tests in our selection process and a background check may be conducted for this position.

Welcome to apply!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer – Data & Analytics at SEB in Stockholm
Description:
SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.

We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to strengthen our team in Stockholm, working with our scalable Advanced Analytics products.

About The Job

We are working together with our colleagues from different parts of SEB to provide advanced analytics to all at SEB. Our team consists of world-class Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers. Together we design, develop and deploy ML models to GCP and deliver value from data and analytics.

Together, we will increase the frequency of finding valuable insights within our data in the bank waiting to be found. Our team is dedicated to making data science and machine learning accessible by creating user-friendly, secure and governed tools that standardize the ways of working.

We belong to the SEB Data & Analytics tribe, an international environment with multiple agile development teams working in an enterprise superset of scrum located in Stockholm and Vilnius, consisting of experts in various Big Data and Advanced Analytics technologies.

Who are you?

We are looking for an engineer with system operations experience and an interest in system development and machine learning.

You and your fellow team members will create and maintain products in the Advanced Analytics team, together with data scientists and other internal customers.

If you are analytical, curious and have a passion for problem-solving and discovering new ways of working, you will enjoy it here. Especially if you also like Swedish fika!

Required Skills


A degree in engineering, computer or data science, or equivalent work experience
Experience from designing, implementing and deploying ML models
Experience from working in Linux environments
Programming and scripting skills (e.g. Python and bash scripting)
Experience in developing services (e.g. REST APIs)
Collaboration skills and a high sense of responsibility. We always work and deliver as a team, and the ability to share knowledge and experience is fundamental.
Well-versed in matters of IT security
Automation and configuration management systems (e.g. Ansible, Terraform, Chef)
Cloud technologies, such as GCP
CI/CD, such as GitHub Actions or GitLab pipelines


Nice-to-have


Programming skills in Java and Scala
Experience in working with container orchestration (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift).
Data engineering experience, e.g. Apache Spark
Database knowledge (RDBMS and/or NoSQL)
Knowledge of authentication and authorization services (e.g. Kerberos, LDAP, OAuth 2.0)


Learn More About Working At SEB At Www.sebgroup.com/career

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity are crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

Great people often know great people – please share if you have a friend who would love this job.

Welcome with your application

Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contributeto our journey. We will contact candidates on a running basis, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 2024-08-31. Please note that due to the summer holiday season, responses might take a bit longer.

If you have questions about the position, please contact Dina Dervisevic, EngineeringManager – Advanced Analytics and Data Services, at dina.dervisevic@seb.se

SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
Show more

Title: Staff Data Scientist - Generalist
Description:
We are looking for a motivated Staff Data Scientist as Generalist capable of designing and developing value-add data-driven applications. You will be responsible for creating highly scalable and performant applications to deliver functionality to our engineers, enabling them to achieve the best quality in our manufacturing processes.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to contribute to a sustainable future by shaping the way we produce energy. You will work with cutting-edge technology in a dynamic, global environment. As part of a diverse and collaborative team, you will help achieve ambitious goals and be at the forefront of transforming the battery industry through data and AI innovation.

Key Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To


Data Analysis and Problem Solving: Handle extensive, intricate data sets to address challenging and non-standard analytical issues using advanced techniques. Perform thorough analysis, including data collection, requirements specification, processing, analysis, continuous reporting, and presentations.
Collaboration: Work closely with stakeholders to refine problem definitions, scope analyses, and leverage findings to guide data-driven decision-making.
Manufacturing Quality Improvement: Identify opportunities for improvement, design effective solutions, and develop software tools to enhance the quality of manufacturing processes.
Prototype Development: Create and iteratively refine analysis pipelines to deliver large-scale insights.
Application Support: Manage and support the operation of production applications within manufacturing environments.


The person we are looking for is someone with strong problem-solving skills and analytical thinking. Excellent communication skills are essential, as you'll need to present technology in a clear and concise manner. The ability to work effectively in a team and collaborate with diverse groups of people is crucial. We also value self-motivation and the ability to work independently.

Northvolt is an equal opportunity employer. We're a diverse group of individuals, united by a common mission, who recognise that while our actions as individuals have a role to play in driving Northvolt towards its goals, we always seek to move forward as a team. We offer you an open and welcoming atmosphere where we win as a team – and fail as a team. Northvolt is growing at the speed of light and we are a strong believer in internal career development. For us it’s important to look at your skills and potential, please refrain form including your picture and age with your application to help us with this.

We Believe That You Have


Technical Proficiency: Strong proficiency in Python and SQL.
5+ years of experience in a data scientist role, preferably in the manufacturing or R&D sector.
Statistical and Machine Learning Expertise: Solid foundation in statistics and machine learning.
Model Building Experience: Proven experience in building machine learning models that deliver company value.
Software Development Skills: Experience writing clean and tested code in a professional environment.
DevOps and CICD Experience: Familiarity with Kubernetes, Docker, Jenkins, and related technologies.
Familiarity with AWS and Azure, especially data storage, processing, and compute technologies.
Hands-on experience with data transformation and WMS tools (e.g., Spark, Airflow).
Understanding of deploying and hosting web applications via Flask, FastAPI, or other frameworks.
Communication Skills: Strong verbal and written communication skills with an emphasis on clear documentation.
Attributes: Smart but humble, with a bias for action.


Bonus Points For


Educational Background: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent.
Experience in Computer Vision and/or in Natural Language Processing Projects
Fullstack Knowledge: Comprehensive understanding of fullstack development.
Knowledge of front-end development in React and Python frameworks like Streamlit, Plotly/Dash.
Sysadmin Capabilities: Basic system administration skills.
Big Data Experience: Experience with Hadoop and Spark.
Stream Processing: Experience with streaming and stream processing frameworks such as Kafka, MQTT, Faust, Spark Streaming, etc.


Apply with CV in English.

Full time employment, fixed salary.

Planned starting date is ASAP.

Please note that candidates considered for employment with NV may be subject to a mandatory background check process.

Please note that any applications submitted via email or direct messaging will not be considered.
Show more

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Are you interested in contributing to the advancement of AI in mobile and web app development? Join us as an AI Engineer at Bontouch, where you'll play a key role in integrating Generative AI and Large Language Models into transformative applications for global brands. 🚀 This role involves developing and deploying scalable AI solutions that enhance functionality and user engagement. If you’re passionate about innovation in a collaborative setting and eager to continuously learn and grow, we invite you to help us shape the future of digital experiences. Together, let’s make a meaningful impact. ✨💪

BECOME A PART OF THE TEAM

At Bontouch, we work based on one simple but ambitious principle: to make the world’s greatest apps for the best brands on the planet. Currently, we work with partners such as Swish, PostNord, SJ, SEB, among many others, to build highly useful, beautiful-looking mobile and web apps that make life easier for millions of users in the real world.

During summer 2023, we joined forces with Denmark’s leading app agency Shape as well as Waterland Private Equity with the goal to create the leading digital product agency worldwide. This new venture is called Framna, and we want you to be part of our journey! 🚀

🏢 Joining our office in Stockholm, you will get to work in a cross-functional dedicated in-house team consisting of developers, designers, QA testers, analysts, and a product lead and team lead.

💼 Your day-to-day will include everything from leading AI research and model development, and deploying solutions at scale, to communicating, educating, and managing stakeholders and their expectations.

🌱 Finally, you also have the support of other AI enthusiasts with different backgrounds, such as data analysts, developers, and designers, who work on our AI projects to learn from one another, share experiences, develop new skill sets, and collaborate.

What You'll Do

As an AI Engineer with us, you’ll play a crucial role in pushing our AI initiatives forward, ensuring they're not just well-loved, but also tailored to our users’ needs. 🌟 If you're into dreaming up big AI ideas and getting your hands dirty coding and deploying them, you'll fit right in here.

More Specifically, In Your Role, You Will Be


Leading the exploration and application of LLMs and Generative AI, venturing into new areas within these fields, including multi-modal capabilities. You will be the go-to expert when creating new business opportunities, assisting sales, and pitching AI solutions to our partners.
Developing, testing, deploying, and evaluating AI models, focusing on scalability and efficiency.
Managing and improving data pipelines that are the backbone for training our AI models, making sure they perform at their best.
Collaborating in cross-functional teams to integrate AI solutions and lead projects that enhance our AI capabilities.
Sharing what you learn and discover about AI with our internal teams and external partners. Your insights will help us all grow.
Taking the lead on internal projects using Generative AI to make our company smarter and more efficient, leveraging all the cool AI tools out there.
Keeping your finger on the pulse of the latest AI trends and breakthroughs, so we’re always ahead of the curve.


Who We Think You Are

Are you ready to make this role your own? 🙌 We believe you might feel at home with us if you have:


A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related fields.
Hands-on work experience in AI, machine learning, LLMs, including prompt engineering, fine-tuning, RAG.
Experience with at least one of the cloud platforms, AWS, Azure, and GCP.
Strong programming skills in Python and experience with DevOps tools such as Kubernetes and Docker.
Familiarity with AI/ML frameworks (e.g. LangChain, LLM orchestration frameworks).
Experience with data engineering tools and platforms, and can handle large, complex datasets.
Great problem-solving and analytical skills, with an ability to work on complex projects and translate business challenges into AI/ML-driven solutions.
Strong communication skills with the ability to effectively convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, both internally and externally.
An adaptable and collaborative spirit, you thrive in a changing environment and enjoy working collaboratively with a team dedicated to innovation.


Benefits Of Working At Bontouch


A beautiful office in the heart of Stockholm, a hybrid-remote work setup, flexible working hours, as well as some other pretty neat benefits like a generous wellness grant, top-up on your parental leave, occupational pension, and much more. ✨
A culture of sharing. We have Friday demos, Wednesday lunch-and-learn, conceptathons, and Product Lead camps. We host an internal conference with all of our studios once a year – every time in a different part of the world. 🗺️
A flexible environment where you get to explore and create your role based on your passion.


Are you curious about our benefits and what it is like to work with us? Read about us here 👈

About Bontouch

At Bontouch, we work based on one simple but ambitious principle: to make the world’s greatest apps for the best brands on the planet. To have the greatest impact on users all over the world, we partner up with our favorite companies to create highly useful, beautiful-looking, visionary mobile and web apps that make life easier for millions of users in the real world. We work with partners such as Swish, PostNord, SJ, SEB, among many others. We offer our partners a unique long-term engagement model where we provide all the skills required for modern digital product development including strategy, design, development, testing, and maintenance.

What is the secret of our success? We are a team, we work together, learn from each other, and trust in each other. For us, collaboration, knowledge exchange, our diverse backgrounds, and shared passion for creating the best possible digital products are our winning combination. We work together in-house in our Bontouch studios to ensure that we deliver products of the highest quality with the end user in focus.

Bontouch is the leading app agency in Sweden and has together with leading agency in Denmark (Shape) joined forces with Waterland Private Equity in 2023 with a joint ambition to create the leading digital product agency worldwide. Today the group consists of more than 400 employees across offices in Copenhagen, Stockholm, Zurich, New York, London, Åre, Östersund and Kalmar. The group will continue to grow organically while pursuing international expansion through acquisitions of digital product agencies that have achieved a leading position in their respective markets by delivering best-in-class mobile apps.

HIRING PROCESS

🕵️ Psychometric assessment - Skills and Logical Reasoning test

👥 1st meeting with the Talent Acquisition Specialist

🎬 Technical challenge and case study presentation

🎯 Final meeting

Please note: For this role, you need to be based in Sweden and we are unfortunately not able to offer a relocation package.

We serve clients in North America, Europe and Asia from five studios in Sweden, London and New York. The products we help create are used by more than 50 million people in 195 countries. Read about our products at bontouch.com
Show more

HIRING PROCESS

🕵️ Psychometric assessment - Skills and Logical Reasoning test

👥 1st meeting with the Talent Acquisition Specialist

🎬 Technical challenge and case study presentation

🎯 Final meeting

Please note: For this role, you need to be based in Sweden and we are unfortunately not able to offer a relocation package.

We serve clients in North America, Europe and Asia from five studios in Sweden, London and New York. The products we help create are used by more than 50 million people in 195 countries. Read about our products at bontouch.com

Title: Data Scientist, Solna
Description:
We seek to strengthen our position and increase the speed of the implementation of data science, machine learning and AI solutions in PostNord. We are looking for three Data Scientists who will play an important role in helping PostNord to become an AI and data driven business. We offer you a cutting-edge Analytics environment, very competent colleagues as well as good benefits and a really cool office. Apply now to the Data Scientist role!

Join us

The Technology Acceleration area with Group IT is responsible for establishing the future IT landscape that will be the foundation for PostNord' s continued AI and data driven journey. PostNord is the leader of logistics and postal services in the Nordics. As a Data Scientist at PostNord you will engage in projects, combining technical expertise within areas such data collection and exploration, model development and model deployment and operation. As a Data Scientist, you will are able to independently develop and deploy models, both statistical and machine learning. We are looking for data scientists for our existing ML team which delivers production volume forecast to PostNords business and we are also looking for data scientists to our newly formed AI- and Concept development teams. It is our goal to deploy efficient and accurate models and keep the models up to date through a set of well-defined MLOps practices.

Job Duties


Work in an agile team to deliver the best possible data solutions for PostNord.
Identify, prepare, explore and analyze data from various data sets.
Understand the business requirements and develop ML solutions accordingly.
Ensure best practices, such as quality and security, are followed in all stages of the product development life cycle.
Identify, collect and analyze data and train new ML models.
Collaborate within team boundaries aiming to share knowledge and best practices.
Keeps up to date with data science trends in and outside of PostNord.
Sound knowledge of statistics and machine learning.
take ownership of the teams solutions whether new or old and help establish best in class MLOps .


We are looking for you who have


A bachelor's degree or higher in computer science, mathematics, statistics, or a related field.
At least 3-5 years of work experience
Proficiency in Python and at least one of the following frameworks: TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, or Scikit-learn.
Sound knowledge of statistics
Strong knowledge of machine learning concepts and techniques, such as supervised and unsupervised learning, classification, regression, clustering, feature engineering, and model evaluation.
Experience in applying machine learning methods to real-world data sets and problems, preferably in the domain of production forecasting or time series analysis.
Understanding of core AI and ML concepts, algorithms, and their applications
Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders, and to translate business requirements into data-driven solutions.
Experience in working with time series data and using frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, or Keras for building and training neural network models for forecasting or anomaly detection.


Your profile as an Data Scientist

You have worked with statistical analysis and Machine Learning solutions in an agile team before. You like to work hands on, and to work directly with our business stakeholders. You have an academic background and as a person you are curious to learn and evolve your skill set in accordance with the state-of-the-art pace in the domain that you work in.

Meritorious experience: (Nice-to-have)


Experience in developing and deploying end-to-end machine learning pipelines in cloud-based environments (Azure preferred) using tools such as MLflow, Azure ML Studio and Azure DevOps.
Experience in working with cloud platforms (Azure preferred) and using their services for data storage, processing, and analysis.
Data visualisation experience; preferably in Power BI
Prior experience implementing generative AI/LLM’s or ML.
Experience in applying DevOps principles and practices to machine learning projects, such as version control, testing, continuous integration, and continuous delivery.
Experience in using containerization and orchestration tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, or Helm for building and deploying scalable and reproducible machine learning applications.


System requirements:


Azure ML Studio, Azure DevOps, Azure Open AI (or similar AWS/GCP technologies)
Python, Pandas
SQL
Power BI


Language requirement:

Fluent English in speech and writing. Proficiency in at least one Scandinavian language is meritorious.

We offer you

Benefits

We offer you a flexible hybrid workplace with a prestige-free environment where we as a team help each other to reach our goals. We encourage self-sufficient leadership for development and career opportunities. In addition to the benefits mentioned above, we offer:


Work in a Nordic/International and flexible environment.
Good insurance and occupational pension conditions
Wellness allowance & access to office gym and swimming pool
Employee benefits through PostNord's own employee foundation PostNord Plus
Employment according to a collective agreement.


We make everyday life easier

PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region.

We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless if we lead our self or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at postnord.com

Apply

We look forward to receiving your application! If you have any questions or concerns, you are welcome to contact Christian Mejlvang, Christian.mejlvang@postnord.com

Click here for union contacts

Title: Lead Data Scientist, Support (GenAI)
Description:
Job Description

We're looking for an awesome someone to join our Support Group, the development organization that builds our in-house customer service tooling. They work on topics like support chat, operational tooling for support agents, and self-service and automation. We see great opportunities for applying machine learning and AI in this domain, and are now strengthening the data science team there.

We're looking for someone to take the helm of the Data Science Team Lead role. The team is still small, and our data scientists work embedded in cross-functional development teams where they work together with engineers, designers, and product and analytics people owning that domain end to end. The engineers and other crafts have their own people leads. Your focus is going to be on the Data Science side.

You know what it takes to scale Data Science as a function, take exceptional care of exceptional people, and above all: take our Data Science to the next level by also working hands-on owning Machine Learning and AI use cases as part of that team. You'll be a facilitator and an enabler for the team to do what they do best by making personal development plans, hosting regular 1on1s, and so forth. You’ll work directly with senior stakeholders to set the data science vision and direction for the group, executing and implementing DS/ML projects end to end.

We’ll be looking for you to facilitate the future of Data Science at Wolt, whether that’s hiring new team members, levelling up Data Science across the company, or helping the organization to understand the possibilities of Data Science, Machine Learning and AI.

📍This role can be based in one of our tech hubs in Berlin, Helsinki, or Stockholm, or you can work remotely anywhere in Finland, Sweden, Germany and Estonia. Read more about our remote setup here. If you live outside of these countries - not to worry! We provide relocation support to help you make your way to Finland, Germany or Sweden.

Our humble expectations

What we hope from you is that you first and foremost identify yourself as a Data Science enthusiast. Solving problems and making a business impact via Data Science is what makes you jump for joy!


You have previous experience building Data Science, Machine Learning and AI solutions with a measurable impact. You understand how to build data products, and deeply care about the end user experience;
You also understand what it takes to build production-level ML and AI solutions, and can help the team members with technical challenges. You have experience with real-time applications and large scale deployments, and can handle the entire life cycle of data science solutions from ideation to maintenance;
We would also like you to have strong experience in leading a technical Data Science team to make sure we keep on improving our DS best practices at Wolt while taking care of our people;
You have previous experience from making personal development plans, hosting regular 1on1s, and taking part in recruitment;
Deep understanding and experience with Machine Learning and AI, a solid understanding of Statistics, and experience and knowledge in NLP. Experience in working as a part of an engineering team, building solutions to complex problems with large scale and real-time requirements.
Interest towards LLMs and GenAI and their applications to solving problems in production.
You’ll also need to be the representative of your function towards the rest of the organization, so strong communication and presentation skills are needed. We value experience in working with senior stakeholders to set the team vision and direction.
Lastly, as this is a team effort you have to be a strong cultural leader that cares for the well-being and constant improvement of your team members and represents Wolt values as your daily work.


Next Steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Fernanda Prado e Silva (fernanda.prado.e.silva@wolt.com).

About Wolt

Wolt is a Helsinki-based technology company that provides an online platform for consumers, merchants and couriers. It connects people looking to order food and other goods with people interested in selling and delivering them. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local logistics to retail software and financial solutions – as well as operating its own grocery stores under the Wolt Market brand. Wolt’s products include Wolt+ (subscription service for customers), Wolt for Work (meal benefits and office deliveries for companies), Wolt Drive (fast last-mile deliveries for merchants) and Wolt Self-Delivery (service for merchant partners with their own delivery staff). Wolt’s mission is to make cities better by empowering and growing local communities. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 29 countries today, 25 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.

Working in Product Development at Wolt

At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 700+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 60 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Description

Join us at Palm, a well-funded, early-stage fintech startup, on a mission to guide the world’s money flows. As part of our founding team of treasurers, finance specialists, and engineers, you'll help build a world-class treasury management system for enterprises.

Are you ready to build and own the machine learning/data science function from the ground up? Based in Amsterdam or Stockholm and open to mostly remote work? We want to hear from you!

About Palm Engineering

Engineering at Palm today consists of a team of five engineers with diverse engineering and cultural backgrounds. We are located in Amsterdam and Stockholm, mostly working remotely with frequent gatherings in one of our locations or at off-sites where it is warmer and sunnier 🏖️

The engineering team has been working together since November 2023 so there is still a lot of opportunities for high impact work as well as playing an important role in further shaping the engineering organisation and culture.

Palm Engineering is defined by our principles:


Bias to Action: In the face of uncertainty, we prototype fast and often.
Open Communication: We courageously voice concerns to realign our direction as needed.
Passion for Challenges: We love the problem and embrace challenges.


In order to achieve this we lean on a culture of collaboration and knowledge sharing, where curiosity, respect and openness are some of our guiding principles. We truly value diversity and are happy to have our perspectives challenged. And of course, let’s have fun together!

Our tech stack


Data Pipelines: Python, BigQuery
Database: PostgreSQL
Cloud: GCP
Version Control: Git
We are continuously iterating and exploring technologies as we go - so there’s more to come!


How will you make an impact?


Our customers need to understand what happened across their bank accounts in the past as well as how balances evolve in the future. We have our first categorization & forecasting models for this. You’ll join as the first Data hire with a broad mandate:
Define success metrics for our models
Create & evaluate forecasting & LLM models to drive those metrics
Build internal tooling to customise models to new enterprise customers
Build infrastructure to monitor performance and act on it
Build the underlying data infrastructure together with our engineering team (you’ll meet them during the interviews!)
Explore new technologies that improve all of the above.
Collaborate with engineers, designers and founders (they come from Fintech & Treasury!) to understand better what needs to be built and speak up when we are focusing on the wrong things


Our wish list


There are a lot of different paths into Data. We think you might have:
5+ years of experience in software engineering with 2+ years experience in ML/DS
OR 5+ years in business-facing ML/DS with a keen interest in the underlying data infrastructure
Experience with maintaining production-level ML solutions, with solid software engineering and ML principles
Strong Python and SQL skills
Experience with ML frameworks e.g. Tensorflow or PyTorch
Experience with data analysis libraries e.g. numpy, pandas or jax
Being proactive and love picking up new things
Able to collaborate and clearly communicate your ideas
High sense of ownership
Nice to Have:
Experience with LLM-based features
Experience in product improvement and data visualisation.
Experience with MLOps

Benefits Of Working At Palm


Travel: Meet all your new colleagues at quarterly offsites - the last 3 were in Lisbon, Stockholm & Amsterdam.
WeWork Membership: Work from home is our go-to - we love spending time with friends and family instead of commuting. We have WeWork memberships for when you want to escape into the city.
Stock Options: Own a large chunk of Palm and reap the rewards as you help us grow the company to a global player.
Pension & Health Insurance: Best-in-class local insurances and pension schemes so you don't have to worry.
Wellness Stipend: 500 EUR in annual wellness benefits - gyms, massages, you name it.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist till ICA Gruppen
Description:
ICA Gruppen gör en stor satsning på Data Science och AI! Vår avdelning stöttar alla bolag inom gruppen genom att utveckla analytiska modeller och produkter, samtidigt som vi driver ICA Gruppens omvandling till en fullt datadriven organisation. Genom våra bolag – ICA Sverige, Apotek Hjärtat, ICA Banken, ICA Försäkringar, ICA Fastigheter och Rimi Baltic – har vi tillgång till stora mängder data. Detta ger oss otroliga möjligheter att skapa verkligt värde för både våra kunder och vår verksamhet genom att utnyttja kraften i banbrytande analys och innovation inom data science.

Är du redo att vara en del av vår resa?

Dina arbetsuppgifter

Som Data Scientist hos oss kommer du att arbeta i multidisciplinära team tillsammans med Data Engineers och verksamhetsexperter. Ni kommer att driva data science-case från idé till produktion inom hela ICA Gruppen. Du kommer att vara delaktig i att utveckla modeller och algoritmer inom ett brett område, och bidra till att utveckla data-drivna lösningar för affärsutmaningar.

Din roll kommer att innefatta hela data science-flödet, från insamling och bearbetning av data till modellering, visualisering och kommunikation av resultat till stakeholders. Du kommer också att arbeta med att sätta lösningar i produktion samt att experimentera med stora datamängder för att identifiera användbara signaler i data. Arbetet innefattar både snabb, utforskande utveckling och framtagning av strukturerad, skalbar kod för produktion.

Din profil

Vi söker dig som har ett stort intresse för att skapa affärsvärde med hjälp av data, maskininlärning och AI. Du har en universitetsexamen inom datateknik, statistik, matematik, fysik eller liknande, samt goda kunskaper i Python och SQL. Erfarenhet av att arbeta i molnmiljöer är en fördel, gärna i GCP som är vår primära utvecklingsmiljö.

Erfarenhet av agila arbetssätt samt moderna mjukvaruutvecklingskoncept som DevOps och CI/CD är meriterande, men viktigast är en vilja att lära och utvecklas. Du är analytisk, nyfiken och lösningsorienterad, och du har ett starkt eget driv. Förmåga att kommunicera tydligt och att anpassa tekniska insikter till affärsnytta är centralt för rollen.

Goda kunskaper i svenska språket är extra meriterande.

Kontaktinformation

Vid frågor gällande rekryteringsprocess, kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Bojana Mijocevic tel. 076 695 15 33. Vid frågor ang tjänsten, kontakta rekryterande chef, Ola Ottosson, 0733 91 88 33.

Sista dag för ansökan

Ansök så snart som möjligt, då vi gör löpande urval, men senast 2024-09-20.

ICA ska spegla våra kunder såväl som samhället i stort och är beroende av medarbetare med olika kompetenser. Vi strävar därför efter att anställa människor med olika bakgrund och värdesätter den kunskap och erfarenhet det medför.

ICA värnar om goda arbetsmiljöförhållanden för våra medarbetare. Vi har som målsättning att ha totalt rökfria arbetsplatser. Vi tillämpar drogtestning i samband med rekryteringsförfarandet. Är du nyfiken på oss och vill bli en av våra nya kollegor? Klart du är! Välkommen med din ansökan!

Välkommen med din ansökan!
Show more
HTML:
ICA Gruppen gör en stor satsning på Data Science och AI! Vår avdelning stöttar alla bolag inom gruppen genom att utveckla analytiska modeller och produkter, samtidigt som vi driver ICA Gruppens omvandling till en fullt datadriven organisation. Genom våra bolag – ICA Sverige, Apotek Hjärtat, ICA Banken, ICA Försäkringar, ICA Fastigheter och Rimi Baltic – har vi tillgång till stora mängder data. Detta ger oss otroliga möjligheter att skapa verkligt värde för både våra kunder och vår verksamhet genom att utnyttja kraften i banbrytande analys och innovation inom data science.

Är du redo att vara en del av vår resa?

Dina arbetsuppgifter

Som Data Scientist hos oss kommer du att arbeta i multidisciplinära team tillsammans med Data Engineers och verksamhetsexperter. Ni kommer att driva data science-case från idé till produktion inom hela ICA Gruppen. Du kommer att vara delaktig i att utveckla modeller och algoritmer inom ett brett område, och bidra till att utveckla data-drivna lösningar för affärsutmaningar.

Du kommer också att arbeta med att sätta lösningar i produktion samt att experimentera med stora datamängder för att identifiera användbara signaler i data. Arbetet innefattar både snabb, utforskande utveckling och framtagning av strukturerad, skalbar kod för produktion.

Din profil

Vi söker dig som har ett stort intresse för att skapa affärsvärde med hjälp av data, maskininlärning och AI. Du har en universitetsexamen inom datateknik, statistik, matematik, fysik eller liknande, samt goda kunskaper i Python och SQL. Erfarenhet av att arbeta i molnmiljöer är en fördel, gärna i GCP som är vår primära utvecklingsmiljö.

Erfarenhet av agila arbetssätt samt moderna mjukvaruutvecklingskoncept som DevOps och CI/CD är meriterande, men viktigast är en vilja att lära och utvecklas. Du är analytisk, nyfiken och lösningsorienterad, och du har ett starkt eget driv. Förmåga att kommunicera tydligt och att anpassa tekniska insikter till affärsnytta är centralt för rollen.

Goda kunskaper i svenska språket är extra meriterande.

Kontaktinformation

Vid frågor gällande rekryteringsprocess, kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Bojana Mijocevic tel. 076 695 15 33. Vid frågor ang tjänsten, kontakta rekryterande chef, Ola Ottosson, 0733 91 88 33.

Sista dag för ansökan

Ansök så snart som möjligt, då vi gör löpande urval, men senast 2024-09-20.

ICA ska spegla våra kunder såväl som samhället i stort och är beroende av medarbetare med olika kompetenser. Vi strävar därför efter att anställa människor med olika bakgrund och värdesätter den kunskap och erfarenhet det medför.

ICA värnar om goda arbetsmiljöförhållanden för våra medarbetare. Vi har som målsättning att ha totalt rökfria arbetsplatser. Vi tillämpar drogtestning i samband med rekryteringsförfarandet. Är du nyfiken på oss och vill bli en av våra nya kollegor? Klart du är! Välkommen med din ansökan!

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
BrightBid is a rapidly growing AdTech company using the best of AI and human expertise to create Google Ads recommendations for businesses and help drive customer acquisition. Combined with BrightBid’s marketing and sales expertise, its AI- and human-led offering enables companies to compete, seeing at least a 35% increase in results on average. Founded in 2020, BrightBid is well in the top 10% of the fastest-growing SaaS companies globally and has achieved over 500,000 conversions for its 400+ customers.




We are now looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our team in Stockholm within the Data & AI team.




As a Senior Data Scientist at BrightBid, you will play a pivotal role in developing advanced algorithms and models to enhance and automate our platform further.




Responsibilities:

Design and implement ML algorithms to optimize ad targeting, bidding strategies, performance prediction.
Become a key contributor and tech lead for our Generative AI solutions in order to empower our Ad platform with powerful and relevant text automations at scale.
Lead the deployment of your models into production, ensuring scalability, reliability, and performance.
Conduct A/B testing and experimentation to validate the effectiveness of your models within relevant statistical frameworks.
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including Data Scientists, Data Engineers, Software Engineers, and Product Managers, to integrate our AI solutions seamlessly into our platform.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements and innovations in ML and Generative AI, ensuring BrightBid remains at the forefront of AI technologies.




What we are looking for:

In addition to an appetite to work with the above responsibilities, the ideal candidate will have a successful track record within at least some of the following areas:

4+ years in developing and deploying ML models in a production environment [required]
Good knowledge of software development practices such as versioning, CI/CD, etc. [required]
Proficiency with Python and standard ML libraries, algorithms and frameworks (Scikit-learn, PyTorch/Tensorflow).
Large Language Models (OpenAI’s GPT, LLaMA or other open-source or fine-tuned models) used at scale in a production environment.
Collaborative work in a fast-paced startup environment, contributing to a positive and innovative team culture.
AdTech, real-time bidding, or e-commerce companies.




Why BrightBid:

A fast-paced company with a yearly growth of 400% since its foundation.
We are open in 4 different markets: Stockholm, Copenhagen, Oslo and London.
Wellness allowance.
All the tools you need to succeed in this role, Macbooks, monitors and more if necessary!
Hybrid working place.
Afterworks and kickoffs with the team.
Free breakfast at the office.
A fantastic team with high energy!
Show more

Title: Join Paf´s Quest: Unleash Your Frontend Superpowers!
Description:
Are you searching for a position where you can make a difference? Paf stands out from other gaming companies in the market. They were founded by the Red Cross, Save the Children, Public Health on Åland, and the foundation Dagens Barn. Paf strives for a long-term sustainable business and we care about our employees, customers, and society. Responsible gaming is an essential part of there business, and all profits go to charity. Regarding the position Paf is looking for a frontend developer who is both curious and passionate about development to join our highly skilled frontend team. As their next colleague you should feel confident taking initiatives on your own but be equally comfortable collaborating with others. Being driven and proactive, you won´t hesitate to ask for assistance when needed. The team you´ll be joining is highly experienced, fostering an open-minded atmosphere where everyone´s contribution is valued. Paf care about their employees:


You have flexible working hours to make your everyday life easier.
You have generous terms regarding pensions, wellness, free healthcare etc.
You avoid overtime. You staying with Paf for 10 years is more important than short-term business goals. Paf adjust to where you want to work:
100% at the office
100% remote Or a mix where you´re at the office a few days a week. If you choose to work 100% remote, you will be given money to buy a desk and chair. Paf will buy screens, docking station headset, computer, phone etc. If you choose a mix you will be given a double set of equipment so you have the same conditions at home and at the office. At Paf, you can also choose to work abroad for 3 months a year. The only requirement is that you work approximately the same working hours as your colleagues. What you will do: As frontend developer at Paf you will engage in the entire development process; from requirement specification, story creation, and estimation to development, testing, release and maintenance. The team you will be joining develops and maintains several frontends ranging from casino websites to customer-facing support websites. The team is responsible for the whole stack from Cloudflare, through React applications and API servers (Backend For Frontend), down to the infrastructure in AWS. We are looking for someone who:
Is a frontend developer with at least 3 years of experience with React.
Has working experience with TypeScript. Additional skill sets that will make us even more interested:
Experience with API design with GraphQL and Rest.
Experience with headless CMS, for example Sanity.
Experience with Redis or similar stores or databases.
AWS or other cloud platforms. We focus on personal experiences and knowledge in software development, instead of only formal education and diplomas. Additional Information The recruitment process will include a programming test and interviews. If you want to show projects that you have done earlier, at work or in your spare time, you are very welcome to add that in your application. Start: Immediately, with regards to the period of notice. Scope: Full time, with flexible working hours. Location: Stockholm or Norrköping, but there is flexibility regarding location. If you prefer to live and work elsewhere in Sweden, this can be arranged. We work continuously with the selection and the ad can be closed down before the position is filled if we have decided to continue with selection and interviews.
Show more

Title: Senior Python Developer – Stockholm heltid
Description:
Modernera är ett modernt rekryteringsföretag. www.modernera.se

För en kunds räkning söker vi nu en senior Python utvecklare. Företaget är en digitaliseringspartner för privat och offentlig sektor. Bolaget är ett av IT-konsultbranschens mest framgångsrika bolag.

Du kommer arbeta primärt inhouse och verksamhetsnära med en och samma kund, även om det kan vara olika projekt eller features som varierar över tid. Utvecklingsteamet arbetar med utveckling av komplexa webblösningar för e-tjänsteplattformar, integrationslösningar samt dokument- och ärendehanteringssystem. I rollen kommer du även ha stort mandat att påverka och fatta beslut kring plattformarna samt ha kundkontakt med tidsestimering och kravinsamling.

Du kommer att jobba i trevliga lokaler i centrala Stockholm. Det finns möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån.

Kvalifikationer

Minst 5 års erfarenhet av att arbeta som Python utvecklare

Konsulterfarenhet - proaktivitet och affärsmässighet

Integrationslösningar

Meriterande

Relevant högskoleutbildning

Erfarenhet av roll som lösningsarkitekt och/eller techlead.

Vår kund erbjuder dig möjlighet att jobba i en organisation med en informell kultur och stor frihet att påverka ditt arbete. Du erbjuds bra arbetsvillkor, pension och friskvårdsbidrag.

Du kommer att bli anställd hos vår kund. Heltid. Provanställning som övergår i en tillsvidareanställning efter sex månader. Tillträde: omgående.

Ansök genom att skicka ditt CV och personligt brev till info@modernera.se. Skriv ”Senior Python Developer – Stockholm heltid” i ärenderaden.

Title: Software Engineer to Life Science start-up
Description:
Here you have the opportunity to be part of something special! We're on the lookout for a Software Engineer to join our partner and their passionate team of experts. If you're enthusiastic about breaking new ground and immersing yourself in cutting-edge technology within the research field, this is the opportunity you've been longing for. Seize the chance to be part of something extraordinary!

Apply here!


City :

Stockholm


Job Category :

Technology


Extent :

Full time, office hours


Start date :

As soon as possible


Type of work :

Staffing


Other :

Possibility to work remote


About the role



Our partner has rapidly expanded their business, achieving remarkable success in the field of Life Sciences. Picture yourself contributing to the development of a groundbreaking Life Science product that is set to redefine the industry. The start-up is a passionate organisation of approximately 50 individuals that work together in the development-phase with the mission to launch a cutting-edge Life Science product.




You will be part of a dedicated team composed of four experienced and talanted Software Engineers. Together you will collaborate in the early software development setting up the architecture and designing the the software related to the product and its hardware.





You are offered







A part of an organisation destined for greatness


Projects focused on new technologies and products


A dedicated Consultant Manager that cares about your personal och professional development



Work tasks




Designing and developing software, including hardware control and analysis SW


Participate in code reviews, create unit tests, and engage in various activities to ensure the development of high-quality software


Planning and executing software development projects


Work actively in the code base with Python



We are looking for




A candidate with a MsC in Software Engineering, Information Technology, Computer Science or similar


Work life experience of working with product development and embedded systems


Up-to-date programming skills in Python within Linux environment


Fluent in English both in writing and verbally since it is the language used with colleagues and customers






It is meritorious if you have







Experience of working with product development within the Life Science industry


Skills in DevOps and setting up CI/CD pipelines


Fluent in Swedish both in writing and verbally






To succeed in the role, your personal skills are:






You are communicative and collaborative, and you enjoy working in a goal-oriented environment and on projects with cross-functional teams. You have a proactive, entrepreneurial mindset and have a sense of urgency and have the tools to create and maintain a culture of innovation and excellence. It is important that you have strong teamwork skills and an analytical and pragmatic approach. You are friendly, positive, and fun to work with, and you enjoy working in a fast-paced, changing environment.



Our recruitment process




This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.




Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.


Become a part of Academic Work



When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.

Read more about Academic Work
Do you have questions about this job?



Erik Gund or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on sth4@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15106278

Title: A Frontend Developer who wants to build the future!
Description:
Who are we

At inooLabs, we are elevating the human species using artificial intelligence. We are a dedicated team of engineers, product designers and business developers building the cutting edge AI-platform called Intric. Intric infuses important organizations across Sweden and Europe with the power of AI.


What will you do

As one of our first Frontend Developers, you will very actively contribute to creating a groundbreaking platform, transforming the way AI-assisted work is done. Your responsibilities will span across the full front-end world, including mobile, embeddable web components and ourflagship web app.

These are some of the things you will do:
- Closely work with our highly collaborative team of engineers and business developers.
- Build and maintain a variety of new and existing features, essentially contributing to all user-facing parts of intric.
- Bring design proposals from receiving figma sketches all the way to shipped features.
- Continuously improve the standard of our app’s architecture.
- Develop and maintain accessible UI components for our UI library.
- Improve and maintain the js-based intric API client.
- Implement functionality or tools that improve the developer experience and speed up work for others in the codebase.




Who you are

You are a driven software developer with a few years of experience, ready to take on the next challenge with an exciting, expanding product and modern tech-stack.

About you:
- You have good problem solving skills and a willingness to get stuff done.
- You are a curious person that is not satisfied until you understand each concept you come across.
- You enjoy working in an iterative and fast-paced environment.
- You enjoy learning new concepts and sharing knowledge with the team.

You most likely have:
- Strong knowledge of modern HTML, TypeScript and CSS
- Experience with front-end frameworks such as Svelte or React
- A passion for developing accessible applications
- An eye for detail and a taste for great UI



You will stand out:

If you can demonstrate experience in application architecture and/or solving complex challenges by writing maintainable and performant code, for example by including a personal project or blog post of yours in the application.


Our tech stack

Frontend

- HTML/CSS
- Svelte/Kit

Backend

- Python (key libraries: Asyncio, SQLAlchemy, Pytest)

Infrastructure

- Docker

- Redis
- Vercel

Other Important Tools/Techniques

- Figma
- Penpot
- Git, Jira

Application

In this recruitment process, inooLabs is collaborating with Qarat. The position is a permanent full-time employment based in Stockholm. You are warmly welcome to submit your application via the advertisement. We work with continuous selection and interviews. For more information, you are welcome to contact IT recruitment consultant Eva Karlsdotter at eva@qarat.se, 073 - 248 47 60. Qarat works competence-based to promote objective and non-discriminatory recruitment.

 

About Qarat

Qarat is a comprehensive provider of recruitment, search/headhunting, and digital tools for online education and communication, such as LeadersAPP.

We manage entire recruitment processes, provide advisory services for parts of a process, and conduct confidential search processes. In leadership/team development, we offer Sweden's leading consultants in the field.

HTML:
Who are we

At inooLabs, we are elevating the human species using artificial intelligence. We are a dedicated team of engineers, product designers and business developers building the cutting edge AI-platform called Intric. Intric infuses important organizations across Sweden and Europe with the power of AI.

What will you do

As one of our first Frontend Developers, you will very actively contribute to creating a groundbreaking platform, transforming the way AI-assisted work is done. Your responsibilities will span across the full front-end world, including mobile, embeddable web components and ourflagship web app.

These are some of the things you will do:
- Closely work with our highly collaborative team of engineers and business developers.
- Build and maintain a variety of new and existing features, essentially contributing to all user-facing parts of intric.
- Bring design proposals from receiving figma sketches all the way to shipped features.
- Continuously improve the standard of our app’s architecture.
- Develop and maintain accessible UI components for our UI library.
- Improve and maintain the js-based intric API client.
- Implement functionality or tools that improve the developer experience and speed up work for others in the codebase.


Who you are

You are a driven software developer with a few years of experience, ready to take on the next challenge with an exciting, expanding product and modern tech-stack.

About you:
- You have good problem solving skills and a willingness to get stuff done.
- You are a curious person that is not satisfied until you understand each concept you come across.
- You enjoy working in an iterative and fast-paced environment.
- You enjoy learning new concepts and sharing knowledge with the team.

You most likely have:
- Strong knowledge of modern HTML, TypeScript and CSS
- Experience with front-end frameworks such as Svelte or React
- A passion for developing accessible applications
- An eye for detail and a taste for great UI

You will stand out:

If you can demonstrate experience in application architecture and/or solving complex challenges by writing maintainable and performant code, for example by including a personal project or blog post of yours in the application.

Our tech stack

Frontend

- HTML/CSS
- Svelte/Kit
- Tailwind
- Melt UI
- PNPM

- FastAPI

Title: Senior Software Engineer - Scaling Creator Payouts Across Europe (Django/Python)
Description:
Are you ready to revolutionize the creator economy? Join Gigapay and help us remove friction for people and companies in this rapidly growing space!




At Gigapay, we're building a platform that enables real-time, compliant payouts to influencers and creators across Europe. Our mission? To simplify administration, currency conversion, tax reporting, and KYC for platforms and brands, allowing them to consolidate thousands of invoices into one and process payments within seconds instead of months.




We're seeking a Senior Software Engineer to join our team and tackle exciting challenges as we scale our platform across Europe. You'll be at the forefront of orchestrating payment service providers, implementing robust currency conversion systems, enhancing information security, ensuring compliance, and automating manual processes.




What you'll be working on:

Designing and implementing scalable solutions using Django and Python
Orchestrating payment service providers across multiple European countries
Developing robust currency conversion systems
Enhancing information security and compliance measures
Automating manual processes to increase efficiency




Our tech stack:

Backend: Django, Django Rest Framework, Python
Frontend: React, TypeScript, NextJS
Infrastructure: Docker, Redis, Celery, PostgreSQL
AI tools: Langchain, Haystack




What we offer:

Competitive salary
Stock options: Be a part of our growth story
Flexible work arrangement: WFH options on Tuesdays and Thursdays
Work-life balance: We average 40 hours/week
Vibrant startup culture in the heart of Stockholm (Gamla Stan)
Roof terrace perfect for grilling and after-work gatherings
Open-minded and humble team




Our approach:

Pragmatic programming
Quarterly OKRs and weekly cycles using Linear
AI-enhanced development and review processes
Continuous learning and optimization of our dev workflow
Flat organization where everyone is empowered to take ownership




You'll be a great fit if you:

Have experience with Django, Python, and event-driven architectures
Are problem-oriented and a good communicator
Can design and implement well-tested, robust architectures
Have a security mindset
Data engineering experience (plus)
Container orchestration (plus)
Bring knowledge of banking, accounting, or compliance (plus)




The hiring process:

Initial video call to discuss your experience and our expectations
Technical assessment: A take-home project or pair programming session
On-site interview with the team to discuss your approach and cultural fit
Final discussion and offer




Ready to scale creator payouts across Europe? Apply now, either here, or by sending your resume to jobs@gigapay.co. No cover letter is required – we're more interested in your skills and passion! Have questions? Reach out to our CTO, Gustav Malmqvist.




Join us in building something great while having a lot of fun doing it!

Show more

Title: Senior Full-Stack Developer (Python/React)
Description:
Senior Full-Stack Developer – Stockholm, Hybrid

Are you passionate about building innovative software solutions for the energy sector in a consultancy environment? Want to play a key role in developing cutting-edge applications for a diverse client base, where you'll tackle complex data optimisation challenges and create impactful products across the full stack?




What's in it for you?

You'll join a dynamic team of software engineers and data scientists, specialising in custom product development for the energy industry. Your role will span both backend and frontend development (split about 80/20 towards the backend), allowing you to contribute across the entire stack.




Enjoy a flexible hybrid work model, balancing office time in Stockholm with remote work. You'll engage in projects of various scales, collaborating with cross-functional teams and interfacing directly with clients to deliver tailored solutions.




You’ll get a competitive salary offering up to 70,000 SEK per month (depending on your experience).They are committed to professional growth, with plans to offer clear paths to leadership roles as the company expands. With ambitious growth plans, there's potential for advancement to senior technical positions in the future. On top of this you’ll get 30 days vacation, a health and wellness allowance (friskvård) and private pension contribution.




What you'd be doing?

You'll typically work in agile teams of 5-6 people, sometimes scaling up for larger projects. You might spearhead new initiatives, assessing client needs and building your team from within the company.




Your work will involve developing sophisticated data infrastructure, implementing machine learning components, and creating robust APIs. You'll use a modern tech stack including cloud services, containerisation, and message brokers.




On the frontend, you'll craft user interfaces ranging from analytical dashboards to complex 3D visualisations, using cutting-edge web technologies to create responsive and data-rich applications.




About you?

You have at least 5 years of experience in full-stack development, with a strong backend focus, preferably in Python including frameworks such as FastAPI, Django, RabbitMQ & Kafka. On the frontend, they work with modern JavaScript frameworks such as React, so experience here would also be essential.




You're passionate about clean, efficient code and stay current with emerging technologies. Adaptability is key, as you'll work across various domains and tech stacks.

Experience with DevOps practices, cloud platforms and familiarity with data processing and machine learning tools is a plus.




Consultant-style experience is beneficial, as client interaction is a significant part of the role and fluency in both Swedish and English is a must for effective client communication.




A bit about them?

A growing tech consultancy in Stockholm, specialising in software solutions for the energy sector. They partner with both established industry leaders and innovative startups, focusing on data-driven applications that promote sustainability.




The company culture emphasises collaboration, continuous learning, and making a positive impact in the green tech space. They're seeking motivated individuals who can drive technical discussions and align with their mission to create meaningful solutions in the energy sector.




With a current team of about 45 and plans for significant growth, this role offers an exciting opportunity to be at the forefront of energy tech innovation in a rapidly expanding organization.







Don't worry if your CV isn't up to date - just send me a message on LinkedIn or an email over to will@zebrapeople.com and we can go from there.







3 stage Interview Process

Initial Chat
Technical Discussion
Final with CEO

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
Would you like to join a business that enables Cybersecurity teams to improve the quality of their work? While reducing response rates.




Well, if you are a Fullstack engineer that is interested in working in a product focused engineering team then this could be for you.




As a developer in the team, you’ll be responsible for the quality of the code, is running on production with appropriate monitoring and metrics. The team as a whole owns the responsibility for the delivery of the products.




Development is centred around .net & JavaScript (Angular & React), we are on the lookout for engineers, who will embrace the challenge of using other tools & languages outside the ones mentioned above.




So, if this does sound interesting send over an application and we can have a chat.




Salary 40K-60K SEK.
