Title: Senior Python Developer
Description:
About The Company

The company specializes in software development for energy companies and startups, focusing on product development, data engineering, and cloud infrastructure. The team leverages tools like Kubernetes, Airflow, and PostgreSQL, integrates machine learning with Spark and PyTorch, and develops UIs using React and ThreeJS.

About The Candidate

The ideal candidate is a backend developer with a passion for coding and technology, proficient in Python, and familiar with front-end technologies. They excel at problem-solving, making pragmatic decisions, and collaborating with the team to deliver scalable and maintainable solutions.

Role Overview

The candidate will focus on backend development, working on projects that may occasionally require front-end support. Key responsibilities include mentoring, planning and executing backend projects, conducting code reviews, and leading development teams.

Qualifications


5+ years of experience with Python
Strong understanding of backend development principles
Experience with AWS and/or Azure deployments
Proficiency in Docker, Git, and performance optimisation
Leadership experience and strong communication skills
Ability to manage and optimize large-scale applications
Experience with integrating external APIs

Title: Data Scientist - Go-to-Market (GTM) Applied AI team
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our vision is to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. We are well on our way — but there’s still an exciting journey ahead. Join us at the heart of trust.

From reviews to user behaviors to internal systems, at Trustpilot, we truly have big data. Every month, more than half a million new reviews are posted on Trustpilot for thousands of businesses. We have now reached 267 million reviews - and that is growing! - from consumers around the world. Our Data Scientists in the GTM Applied AI team leverage this data to build AI/ML models that improve our go-to-market (GTM) efficiency and enhance our pricing and revenue management strategy.

We are seeking a skilled Data Scientist to join our GTM Applied AI team to develop, deploy, and maintain our GTM and Pricing models. You will collaborate closely with our pricing and monetization squad and team of software developers, data analytics and ML engineers to develop, deploy, and maintain innovative AI/ML models at scale. You will be part of a unique journey where data, AI, and ML are at the heart of our product and company strategy. This role offers the opportunity to collaborate broadly across the business, including with our Commercial, Digital Sales, and Applied AI teams, in both B2B and B2C contexts.

To succeed in this role, you should have proven experience in developing and deploying AI/ML models to enhance commercial practices. You have a solid technical background, with hands-on ability in all stages of data preparation, exploration, and modeling. You must have an adaptable commercial mindset and knowledge of the interface between data science and engineering. The ability to develop AI/ML solutions, engage stakeholders, and clearly articulate the impact of your work is necessary for this role. Experience putting solutions into production within an interdisciplinary team is a big plus, and it will be ideal if you also have experience using AI and ML to solve pricing and revenue management problems.

What You’ll Be Doing


You will be involved in delivering some of our most exciting Data Science projects aimed at improving our GTM efficiency and pricing practices: from prediction to ranking, segmentation to NLP, and recommendation systems to content generation.
This is a great opportunity to make a real business impact by applying the state of the art in AI and ML.
You will deliver the Data Science component of key strategic initiatives including owning, maintaining, and deploying production-ready ML/AI models, and analysing data to establish the scope and impact of your work.
You will identify new pricing and monetization opportunities based on data, interpreting model outcomes, and share insights to drive the direction of our business goals.
You will engage with both technical and non-technical stakeholders & will translate business requirements into Data Science deliverables.
The opportunity to work with leading data engineering technologies including Google Vertex AI tools, Google BigQuery, and AWS, and with leading Data Science tools and emerging technologies for model building and deployment.
Opportunities to develop your career in a friendly, diverse, innovative, international team and workplace.


Who You Are


Experience with analytical and quantitative problem solving using advanced statistical techniques and machine learning methods, e.g. Attribution, Segmentation, Churn, Upgrade, Upsell, and Pricing & Packaging.
Experience in building and deploying production-ready ML models, and solid data engineering skills (e.g. experience with cloud technologies - we use GCP but experience with AWS will also be fine).
Ability in Python and SQL for data manipulation, modeling, and scripting.
You have experience of working with large datasets. Knowledge of the data generated by websites or in the eCommerce sector, behavioral analytics, and experience working with data from commercial systems (e.g. Salesforce) is advantageous.
Knowledge of data pipelining and prior experience of cloud-based ML model deployments is beneficial.
Great communication skills - both with technical colleagues and with business stakeholders.
Proven technical experience in a Data Science role, particularly in the technology sector or in a technical consultancy.


What’s In It For You


A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning, and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Newly renovated central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops
Tax-Free Travel (DSB)


Still not sure?

We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. We’re excited to hear about your experiences as well as how you will contribute to our working culture. So, even if you don’t feel you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

About Us

Trustpilot began in 2007 with a simple yet powerful idea that is more relevant today than ever — to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. Trustpilot is open, independent, and impartial — we help consumers make the right choices and businesses to build trust, grow and improve.

Today, we have more than 260 million reviews and 57 million monthly active users across the globe, with 117 billion annual Trustpilot brand impressions, and the numbers keep growing. We have more than 900 employees and we’re headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.

We’re driven by connection. It’s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh –– it’s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we’re proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We’re a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you –– we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you’re ready to grow, let’s go.

Join us at the heart of trust.
Show more

  • A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
  • Competitive compensation package + bonus
  • 25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
  • Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
  • Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning, and Blinkist
  • Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
  • Paid parental leave
  • Newly renovated central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
  • Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
  • Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
  • Employee discounts to restaurants and shops
  • Tax-Free Travel (DSB)

Still not sure?

We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. We’re excited to hear about your experiences as well as how you will contribute to our working culture. So, even if you don’t feel you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

About Us

Trustpilot began in 2007 with a simple yet powerful idea that is more relevant today than ever — to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. Trustpilot is open, independent, and impartial — we help consumers make the right choices and businesses to build trust, grow and improve.

Today, we have more than 260 million reviews and 57 million monthly active users across the globe, with 117 billion annual Trustpilot brand impressions, and the numbers keep growing. We have more than 900 employees and we’re headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.

We’re driven by connection. It’s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh –– it’s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we’re proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We’re a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you –– we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you’re ready to grow, let’s go.

Join us at the heart of trust.

Title: Data Scientist - 12 month FTC
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about data and analytics, and eager to drive business value through actionable insights? Do you thrive in dynamic environments and love turning complex data into clear, impactful solutions?

We're looking for an exceptional Data Scientist to join the team in Copenhagen for a 12 month period. You will play a pivotal role in our Customer Insights initiatives, helping us understand customer behaviors and enhance decision-making across the organization.

Would you like to…


Lead and steer data tracks of projects, conducting exploratory data analysis (EDA) to uncover trends and insights within large datasets
Develop and maintain AI-driven codebases, including predictive models, classification algorithms, and clustering techniques
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to seamlessly integrate AI and data science solutions into business operations
Provide BI expertise by creating and maintaining dashboards using tools like PowerBI
Translate complex data findings into clear, concise, and actionable insights for stakeholders at all levels of the organization
Develop and implement data models to support business intelligence and reporting initiatives


We would like you to be…


Highly proficient in SQL and PySpark, with experience in data modeling for business intelligence
Experienced in traditional Machine Learning projects, including predictive modeling, classification, and clustering
Skilled in Python for data analytics, with the ability to implement and optimize models
Hands-on with Databricks or Dremio for large-scale data processing and analysis
Strong in data visualization, particularly with PowerBI or similar dashboarding tools
Familiar with Natural Language Processing (NLP) concepts and their application in customer insights (a plus)


Would you like to join…


A team that values creativity, collaboration, and continuous learning
An environment where your insights directly impact business decisions and customer satisfaction
A culture that encourages innovation and the sharing of ideas


Please note Designit can only consider applicants with the right to work in Denmark.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer Lead - LLM/Python/GenAI
Description:
Opportunity: Full Time, 8 hours India time

Contract length: 6-12 Months

Must-Have

Total Years Of exp- 7+ years experience mandatory

Mandatory Skills: Python- 7 years, Machine Learning - 3 years, LLM - 3 years.

Solid understanding of cloud services, including Azure, GCP, or AWS

Introduction

We are seeking experienced professionals with expertise in Large Language Models (LLM) to join a dynamic team working on next-generation products. In this role, you will collaborate with other engineers across various skill sets, driving innovative solutions for our clients.

Required Skills


7+ years of professional experience in building Machine Learning models & systems
1+ years of hands-on experience with LLMs and Generative AI, particularly prompt engineering, RAG, and agents
Expertise in business analysis, requirement gathering, and solution workflow design for GenAI/ML projects
Proven ability to drive client engagement and align development teams toward a technical roadmap
Proficient in programming with Python, Langchain, and SQL
Solid understanding of cloud services, including Azure, GCP, or AWS
Excellent communication skills for effective collaboration with business SMEs

Title: Graduate Data Scientist
Place: Vester Hassing, North Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
The Company

Veovo is a market leader in Airport Smart Technology. With a global footprint of customers and capabilities that cover Airport Operations, Revenue management and Passenger Flow. Some of the world’s largest airports rely on Veovo.  Focused on driving airport performance, our solutions enable airports to handle more aircraft and more passengers, with less delays and less queues. Our platforms are built on a modern tech stack, often delivered from the cloud as SaaS and leveraging intelligence to enable our customer to “go brilliantly”.

Our clients span continents, but all share one thing in common~ they’re big names in airport excellence, with even bigger digital goals. With offices in the UK, Poland, Denmark, New Zealand and the US, Veovo offers a world of opportunity

At Veovo we strive to deliver predictable collaborative solutions that are the platform of great airports. At Veovo we strive to deliver predictable collaborative solutions that are the platform of great airports.

The Opportunity

We focus on solutions in the analysis of queue and movement patterns as well as capacity forecasts. Our product, is cloud-based system that collects and analyzes data via proprietary (Bluetooth / WiFi) sensors, as well as third-party data sources such as camera, radar, infrared counters, coils, boarding cards, calendars, etc.

The solution primarily helps airports to forecast passenger appearance, optimize staff resources, reduce queue and travel times, and improve the experience for the passengers. In addition, we also create solutions for road traffic, railway stations, ports, ski resorts and amusement parks, with similar work and end-results.

Are you ready to be part of the team that brings our brilliant solutions "live" around the world?

The size of our installations are growing rapidly, and we are therefore seeking a skilled analytical person, who can help implement our solutions to help airports predict passenger arrival and flow. The implementation covers requirements, design, and calibration of the system. The calibration is carried out in-house via the setup of our filtering engine.

The Specifics


Identify valuable data sources and automate collection processes
Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
Analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns
Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms
Combine models through ensemble modeling
Present information using data visualization techniques
Propose solutions and strategies to business challenges
Collaborate with engineering and product development teams


What We Are Looking For


Knowledge of R, SQL and Python; familiarity with Scala, Java or C++ is an asset
BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field
Analytical mind and business acumen
Experience in data mining
Problem-solving aptitude
Excellent communication and presentation skills


What We Offer In Return


A job in a growing industry.
Employment immediately or by agreement.
An exciting position in a company with good working conditions with an open, direct and informal tone
A company where ideas are accelerated into action, and everyone can play a part in the development.
Excellent opportunities for personal and professional development through independent work assignments.
Workplace~ Hækken 2, Vester Hassing, 9310 Vodskov
37 hours working week


Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Copenhagen, Denmark

Data Scientist for Marketing at Saxo Bank 

Are you passionate about leveraging data to drive impactful marketing strategies? Saxo Bank is on an exhilarating journey to become a data-driven organization, and we are seeking a dynamic Data Scientist to take the lead of the development of our predictive models focused on marketing. If you are eager to make a significant impact and grow with us, this is the perfect opportunity for you. 

Predictive Modelling and AI 

As our new Data Scientist, you will be an integral part of our Predictive Modelling and AI team. You will collaborate closely with our Marketing and Digital Analytics teams, as well as other data scientists and data engineers. Your role will involve building data pipelines using Airflow and Databricks, publishing data to Kafka and Data Lake, and deploying machine learning APIs to Kubernetes, primarily using Python. 

The Job

Below are examples of what you can be responsible for:


Evaluate marketing performance (return on marketing spend) by combining Saxo data with 3rd party data.
Further develop our lead value score models. The models are used both by sales and marketing to maximize business outcomes.
Assist in the development of marketing data foundation and establish data flows from marketing engines
Develop an attribution model (MMM) for marketing and the rest of the organization to assist optimizing spend across markets and channels.
Correlation and causality analysis on channels and campaigns.


YOUR PROFILE

Your colleagues and friends describe you as methodical, curious, self-motivated and with a logical mindset.

We expect you to be proficient in python or R and further recognize yourself in the below bullets:


Relevant education or professional experience in Science, Technology, Economics, or Mathematics.
Experience with time series analysis and state space modelling.
Prior experience working with Marketing.
Knowledge of database systems: Efficient in SQL (knowledge of Azure Data Lake, Databricks Delta Lake is a plus).
ETL skills (knowledge of Apache Airflow, Spark/Databricks, and Kafka).
Experience with Git.
Ability to present data in an understandable way (knowledge of PowerBI or similar is a plus).
Verbal and written English.


Kindly note this position is located in our HQ in Denmark.

We get curious people invested in the world

When you work at Saxo, you become a Saxonian and part of a purpose-driven organisation, where good ideas are always taken seriously, and where you can make a true impact. We are invested in your development, and you can expect a robust career from day one when you join Saxo – no matter which role you take on.

You will join 2,500 other ambitious colleagues across 15 countries and become part of an international organisation. Working in Saxo, you will get to meet colleagues from many different cultures and backgrounds, and you should know that we value diversity and inclusion and see it as a genuine source of strength to drive growth, foster innovation and position us for long-term success.

We encourage an open feedback culture and supportive team environments enabling employees to grow and fulfil their career aspirations.

When you bring passion, curiosity, drive and team spirit, your learning journey will be dynamic and your career opportunities in Saxo will be immense.

At Saxo we don’t just offer a job – we offer an opportunity to invest in your future!

How To Apply

Click here to create an account and upload your resume and a short motivation. We look forward to getting to know you better!
Show more

Title: AI ML Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in.

To start a career that is out of the ordinary, please apply...

Job Details

What do you need to know about this job?

Kantar is the world’s leading data, insights, and consulting company; we shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere.

Our Insights colleagues are the masters of using data to resolve challenges. They help brands define what they should stand for, how to reinvent and renew their offer, how to better reach audiences, and how to win with consumers and customers. By collecting substantial data from across the world, they blend human expertise with technology, making sure we can deliver innovative insights to brands everywhere.

We are currently seeking a highly skilled and motivated AI/ML Engineer to join our Global Data Science and Innovation team at Kantar. As a member of our team, you will have the unique opportunity to work on exciting and challenging AI-led projects within our organization. This fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment will allow you to contribute to the development of world-class AI solutions using the latest advancements in AI/ML.

Responsibilities


Develop new features in our Bayesian framework to enable enhanced functionality for both internal and external users.
Champion good software development practices within the AI team.
Write tests and documentation to ensure the quality and maintainability of our codebase.
Integrate machine learning models with other systems to facilitate seamless data flow and analysis.
Build and maintain scalable and efficient AI pipelines and infrastructure for deployment.
Deploy AI models and solutions into production environments, ensuring stability and optimal performance.
Implement robust version control and model management practices to track changes and updates.
Collaborate closely with the broader engineering team to align with the organization's goals and objectives.
Engage in cross-team information exchange, sharing insights and innovative solutions within the AI/ML domain.
Collaborate with teams by using models and their output to enhance decision-making effectiveness.


Requirements


Degree from a prestigious technical institute in software engineering, data science or a related field.
3 to 8 years as a similar role (ML engineer, software engineer, data scientist)
Strong software engineering background in R, Python or other language
Docker Experience
DevOps experience (automation and continuous integration).


Desired Skills That Would Be a Distinct Advantage


Prior experience with developing, maintaining and deploying ML models, especially involving Bayesian statistics
Experience in developing and maintaining live deployments.
Previous involvement in larger software projects, writing code for others to read and use.
Working knowledge of R and R Shiny.
Comfortable working in global setups with diverse cross-geography teams and cultures.
Seeking individuals who bring a high level of enthusiasm, motivation, and a natural inclination to explore and take initiative.
Strong English language proficiency, encompassing both technical and business-related communication skills.
Meticulous attention to detail and the ability to balance the big picture with fine details.


Other Valued Skills


Familiarity with cloud platforms like Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud.
Experience with containerization tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes), databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL), and deployment tools (e.g., Azure DevOps).
Strong familiarity with Linux operating systems, including system administration, shell scripting, and problem-solving.
Ability to develop and integrate APIs, with experience in RESTful services.
Knowledge of Agile working methodologies for product development.
Familiarity with optimization problems.


This position offers an exceptional opportunity to work in a world-class organization like Kantar. We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applicants from all backgrounds to apply. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations/adjustments to individuals with disabilities during the application and interview process. If you require assistance, please let us know in your application.

We look forward to receiving your application and having you join our collaborative and innovative team at Kantar.

This is a role to be based in our offices in Copenhagen OR in Porto.

Location

Copenhagen, RaadhuspladsenDenmark

Kantar Rewards Statement

At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and also to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.

We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career that’s out of the ordinary and join us.

We want to create an equality of opportunity in a fair and supportive working environment where people feel included, accepted and are allowed to flourish in a space where their mental health and well being is taken into consideration.

We want to create a more diverse community to expand our talent pool, be locally representative, drive diversity of thinking and better commercial outcomes.

Kantar is the world’s leading data, insights and consulting company. We understand more about how people think, feel, shop, share, vote and view than anyone else. Combining our expertise in human understanding with advanced technologies, Kantar’s 30,000 people help the world’s leading organisations succeed and grow.

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Vejle, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you love building Machine Learning products that makes a real business impact? Do you want to get closer to the actual end-product and have a huge say where we need to go next?

We're on the hunt for a colleague to join our dynamic squad based and our HQ in Vejle, Denmark, and play a pivotal role in shaping the future of European Car Trading through groundbreaking technology solutions.

At AUTOproff, we're all about turning challenges into adventures! Our squads are meticulously organized into problem spaces, each dedicated to addressing real-life challenges. As a part of the Seller Problem Space squad, your role is pivotal in simplifying the vehicle selling process and empowering our clients to excel in sales. Join our dynamic squad, specializing in pricing trade-in and in-stock cars, where your expertise will make a tangible impact!

As our new Data Scientist at AUTOproff you will have the opportunity to build advanced models on top of our unique market data within the used car industry. Y

Let's Dive Into Your Key Responsibilities


Developing and productionizing machine learning models
Interpreting and delivering the results of findings to stakeholders within the business
Own and maintain your solutions, taking pride in their performance and scalability


Your mission is developing your own ML models, whilst continually improving our current suite of AI solutions. You will do this by optimizing the performance of our ML models and performing hypothesis driven ML experimentation. We only implement models for production-use and have a short process from prototype to business impact. As we scale, our range of ML use-cases also increase, so you will work with various ML areas from regression to image classification.

The Need-to-have Skills


MSc degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or equivalent quantitative discipline
+2 years of professional experience and proven track record in developing machine learning models
Expert using Python, Pandas, NumPy, etc.
Experience in SQL
Strong understanding of both traditional statistical modelling and machine learning
Excellent proficiency in English, both verbally and written


The Nice-to-have Skills


Familiarity with software development tools such as git, Docker and agile processes
Experience in Neural Networks, Deep Learning, and Tree-Based learners
Experience with ML Ops and productionizing processes
Experience working with data lakes in S3


You will thrive in this role if you


Have a curious mindset and always want to get hands-on experience with the newest technologies
Can work independently and structure your tasks in an efficient way
Have a strong sense of ownership for the solutions you develop


Your Colleagues Say About You


You are a team player, who loves to share their knowledge with colleagues and like-minded enthusiast
Are curious and entrepreneurial by nature, and loves to take initiative
Fun to be around


If you think we could be a match, we can’t wait to hear from you. Hurry up and apply!

If this role doesn’t fit your profile – don’t hesitate to reach out if you want to join a fun and fast-growing SaaS company on a mission! We are constantly on the lookout for new and awesome colleagues.

About AUTOproff

AUTOproff is a fully transparent digital B2B vehicle platform where professionals can seamlessly and securely sell and buy vehicles directly via AUTOproff’s online auction, with a unique range of integrated on-demand trading services (including on-site car appraisal, wholesale price guidance, guaranteed minimum pricing, secure escrow-based trading, and car transportation) or sell cars via AUTOproff’s fully managed, end-to-end selling service.

AUTOproff also provides C2B web solutions for dealerships, internal digital trading solutions for larger dealership groups and their ecosystems, as well as dedicated enterprise solutions for leasing, rental and insurance firms. More information on www.autoproff.com

We employ 100 enthusiastic professionals across our offices. In 2021, we posted revenues of more than DKK 750 million and we have been profitable since our inception.

In August 2022, AutoScout24, the leading specialized pan-European online car marketplace, acquired the majority stake in AUTOproff. The partnership supports a rapid expansion of AUTOproff’s solutions across Europe and enable the creation of Europe’s first fully integrated C2B-B2B-B2C used car trading solution. More information on www.autoscout24.de .

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
My client is a leader in the maritime industry.




Role: Data Scientist




Location: Remote (Must have eligibility to work in Denmark)




Overview




You will be working in a dynamic team with other data scientists in driving impactful insights and solutions through advanced analytics and machine learning techniques. You will play a pivotal role in shaping the direction of our data science initiatives and driving innovation.




Education




Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field




Ideal candidate

Strong understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, and libraries.
Ideally also AI LLM experience
3 years experience in machine learning and statistical modeling.
2 years work or research experience in discrete optimization / operation research.
Experience with production systems (not pure research)
Experience in the role of team lead building successful (web) applications in an agile environment.
Have a solid background in Data/Computer Science and/or Statistics/ Econometrics/ Mathematics .
Proficient in programming languages such as Python and SQL. Experience with Pandas and FastApi
Strong understanding of machine learning techniques, algorithms
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib.




Advantage

Maritime or SAS experience preferred, other industries considered




*** Only successful candidate will be contacted ***

Title: Machine Learning / AI Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION




Grazper is seeking a Machine Learning / AI Scientist to join their team of highly talented engineers and developers, located in the heart of Copenhagen. You will join a market leader in human pose estimation and behavioral analysis and help shape Grazper’s evolving machine learning and data pipeline.




Grazper’s AI solution is a camera-based AI that can accurately track people’s behavior in large physical environments. Their main office is located just next to The Marble Church in central Copenhagen and their innovative development lab is located at Refshaleøen. Grazper is part of the Yokogawa family and operates under the umbrella of a Japanese company that holds a great position in the Nikkei Stock index. This ownership structure gives Grazper opportunities to work deeply with product development and innovation.




The Grazper dataset is a unique and growing source of human pose data captured with bespoke technology in their development and recording facility at Refshaleøen. In addition to proprietary data, Grazper systematically investigates complementary data sources, algorithmic and network-based applications of pose data, and behavioral analysis. You will be responsible for basic and applied research in machine learning, image analysis, and network training as well as its application to engineering and product delivery. It is a plus, but not a requirement, if you are comfortable working with the technologies used in the current Grazper stack: C++ / Python / Typescript.




Your primary tasks and areas of responsibility:




Conduct basic and applied research in machine learning and image analysis.
Explore and analyze complementary data sources to enhance the understanding and utilization of human pose data.
Develop and implement algorithms and methodologies for processing and analyzing human pose data.
Design and implement experiments to evaluate the performance of machine learning models and algorithms.
Contribute to the development of a modern MLOps pipeline to streamline model deployment, versioning, monitoring, and retraining.
Stay updated with the latest advancements in machine learning and related fields and apply them to improve Grazper's technology and products.
Communicate research findings, methodologies, and insights effectively to stakeholders within the organization.




REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE




The ideal candidate is expected to have a PhD in math / physics / CS / ML or another relevant STEM subject. Alternative, an MSc in either of these subjects combined with relevant experience.

Furthermore, Grazper prefers candidates who have:




worked with computer vision and image analysis.
industry experience or done applied work in academia.
software development experience and / or skills.
hands-on network training.
experience communicating complex technical ideas to peers and laypeople alike.
experience translating machine learning technologies into industry and consumer products.




Grazper has an informal yet ambitious working environment of highly qualified employees. With employees from different countries and nationalities in the main office, they have an international environment where English is the primary language.




COMPANY DESCRIPTION




The founders of Grazper have impressive track records and several successful commercial products behind them. Among other things, they co-created the original BAFTA-nominated Hitman game series and were members of the core development team of the Emmy-winning Havok physics engine. After a few years redefining how to deal with virtual worlds, plus a few machine learning escapades, they decided to move on to handling the real world – using AI.




They are a team of experts within Deep Learning, Computer Vision and 3D real-time graphics as well as experienced hardware and software implementation engineers. They all have the shared vision, to use AI to understand and model our world in a way that makes information understandable and accessible.




Grazper is owned by the Japanese company Yokogawa and their office is located centrally in Copenhagen. The office houses around 10 dedicated employees.




ADDITIONAL INFORMATION




Reporting to: CTO

Languages: English

Compensation package: Attractive compensation package according to qualifications

Starting date: As soon as possible

Location: Central Copenhagen




APPLICATION




GlobeSearch is responsible for the recruitment process on behalf of Grazper. To apply for this position please follow the process through the job posting on our website.

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Become a key member of our Data Science team! Explore automated solutions, create results and move technology from the lab to the market




Who are we?

ChemoMetec is a worldwide leading manufacturer of cell counting and analysis equipment. We specialize in developing and producing high-precision instrumentation, delivering consistent data for thousands of customers across biotech, pharma, and academic segments.




During this exciting growth, we are looking for talented individuals to join us. We are looking for an individual who has drive and motivation, which is more important to us than the exact background and work experience. We want people on board to make a career with us, stay with us for a long time, and grow. Here you will experience being part of developing and shaping ChemoMetec's ongoing growth journey.




We offer freedom with responsibility and consider the ability to think outside the box a clear strength. We never do something merely because others do it. We do things because it is the best solution for ChemoMetec. We cherish our culture, which is based on being agile and solution orientated. You will find excellent colleagues, an informal and relaxed atmosphere, and we always prioritize hosting cross-organizational events to strengthen the team spirit.

 

What you will experience as a Data Scientist with ChemoMetec:

Opportunity to develop and explore new automated solutions for our products
You will be part of our highly skilled and enthusiastic Data Science team who thrive on taking initiative and creating results together
On a daily basis, you will work closely with all the other teams in R&D with plenty of opportunities for sparring and development
You will be part of a supportive and informal work environment

 

Main responsibilities:

Developing applications and methods for robust and rapid identification, segmentation and classification of a wide variety of cell types
Developing algorithms that enable high-through-put and automated interpretation and information extraction from images using image analysis and deep learning
Develop and maintain pipelines for constructing image datasets, training and validating deep learning vision models
Investigate and implement promising deep learning vision methods relevant for our automated cell counters and cell analysers
Solve ad hoc tasks, such as image analysis problems, data management related tasks, and miscellaneous data analyses

 

The ideal candidate:

We are looking for an ambitious and curious individual with a strong analytical mindset. You demonstrate patience and persistence when faced with complex challenges and thrive on problem solving. You are motivated to move technology from the lab to the market and thrive in a fast-paced environment. A passion for inventing and developing new integrated solutions in life science research is an advantage.




Experience and qualifications:

Master or Ph.D. degree in computer/data science or another related field. Ph.D. degree is a plus
A documented background within data engineering, computer vision and machine learning
Experience with solving deep learning tasks using TensorFlow or PyTorch
Fluency in Python or C++ and the ability to quickly learn new programming languages
Experience in development, implementation and validation of image analysis algorithms in biological disciplines is an advantage

 

Practical information

You will report to our Head of Data Science R&D.  




Salary is based on a range of factors that include relevant experience, knowledge, skills, and other job-related qualifications.




The application deadline is September 1, 2024, after which we will call candidates in for an interview.




If you have any questions about the position, you are welcome to reach out to Head of Data Science, Cecilia Klyver, cek@chemometec.com or to our HR specialist, Stine Kirkegaard, slk@chemometec.com.




We urge everyone to apply as we believe in encouraging inclusion, acceptance, and understanding by employing individuals who bring unique perspectives to the company.

 

Please submit your application with a cover letter.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Join BESTSELLER TECH, an innovative and forward-thinking division of one of the world’s leading fashion companies. Our mission is to blend cutting-edge technology with the world of fashion, creating ground-breaking solutions that drive our business forward.

We are currently embarking on an ambitious project to revolutionize fashion forecasting and planning through advanced AI technologies and therefore we are seeking an experienced Data Scientist to join our new AI Fashion Planning team.

YOUR TEAM

Our new AI Fashion Planning team is at the forefront of developing state-of-the-art AI solutions for some of BESTSELLER’s most strategically important projects. Our goal is ambitious: to ensure we have the right products on stock at the right time and at the right location all year long.

YOUR JOB


Develop and implement advanced machine learning models for fashion demand forecasting.
Analyse large datasets to extract meaningful insights and inform forecasting strategies.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and deliver effective AI solutions.
Continuously research and stay updated on the latest AI and machine learning technologies relevant to fashion forecasting.
Present complex data and forecasts in a clear and understandable manner to stakeholders.


Your Benefits


This is a chance to be at the forefront of developing AI products and drive the data discipline in the next phase of our AI journey
In BESTSELLER TECH we care about you and your work-life balance – and therefore working remote is a part of our culture
You will experience an organisation that is on the forefront of working agile to drive innovation and deliver high-quality solutions efficiently
You will experience a manager who has great confidence and trust in you and your abilities and who gives you the opportunity to develop.


YOUR PROFILE

If you’re passionate about creating value from machine learning applications, we’d love to hear from you. Other qualifications to succeed in the role is:


A Master's degree or Ph.D. in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics or a related field.
2-4 years of experience as a Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer.
Proven experience in machine learning, predictive modelling, and data analysis.
Strong programming skills in Python or R.
Strong experience in Databricks.
Experience with time-series analysis and forecasting methods.
Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written.


CURIOUS FOR MORE?

Get a glimpse of what life is like in BESTSELLER TECH by following #bestsellertech on LinkedIn.

WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU

If you have questions about the position, you are welcome to reach out to Jakob Blaavand on +45 21 68 49 41. Otherwise, please send us your application as soon as possible and no later than 9 September 2024.

We review applications on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to take down the ad when we find the right candidate.

About Bestseller Tech

We are more than 300 people strong, located in Denmark and in Spain. We are excited about what we do, but there’s more to us than our tech stack. We are young at heart and thrive in a flat organization. Our teams are agile and empowered with end-to-end responsibility. We want to be at the forefront of the newest technologies, and we move forward together. Every day. If you want to play a significant part in empowering our business, then welcome to BESTSELLER TECH. BESTSELLER TECH is part of the worldwide fashion company BESTSELLER. For more information, please go to www.bestseller.com.

Title: Natural Language Processing (NLP) Researcher
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to impact a highly-skilled team that uses cutting edge techniques in Natural Language Processing and Algorithmic Trading? We are looking for an NLP Researcher that will help us greatly improve the text-processing behind our models.

At Alipes Capital, we have been the market leader in automating the financial markets since we started back in 2008, shaping a fully automatic natural language processing system for reading and interpreting financial news.

Your work

Your work will support turning massive data sets of unstructured financial information into structured datasets and mathematical models that accurately predict movements in the equity markets. In doing so, you will:

Redesign and introduce new text-processing techniques to extract additional and more accurate entities from the text-sources that underlie our trading algorithms

Maintain and curate new and existing text data sources for our analyses

Automate monitoring and benchmarking of the trading strategies

You will enjoy a wide degree of autonomy and responsibility to optimize our machine-learning pipelines, from data-ingestion to live-model performance. There is no red tape, no sales people to consult and there is ample room for creativity.

The team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with fourteen passionate quantitative researchers covering six nationalities – eleven PhD’s and three MSc’s- with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning (seven of us working directly on the text-based equity models).

We enjoy collaboration, lending a helping hand and discussing the business cases built upon our data-sets. You will be working alongside a team of software developers and a team of traders who implement and conceive the trading models with us. All team members write code and are not afraid to discuss technical details.

Need to have

Skilled in extracting signals from texts using embeddings to enhance prediction model

Proficient in entity-extraction from text, e.g. using modern Transformer-based Large-Language Models

Solid understanding of machine learning techniques and their practical applications

Aptitude for programming in a numerical scripting language (we primarily use Python)

A meticulous and detail-oriented mind

Nice to have

Experience using RAGs (Retrieval-Augmentation-Generation)

Working with financial/trading data

Experience with C#, C/C++ or Java

Familiarity with software engineering (version control, unit testing, object oriented-design)

Degree in Computer Science / Engineering




What we can offer you

Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy

Exciting problems to solve

Collaborative team made up of really smart and curious people

Nice office in central Copenhagen with a hybrid work model

Pension, Health Insurance and 30 days of vacation

Practicalities

To apply, please send us your CV and a cover letter telling us why you think this role is a great fit for you. If your profile looks like a good match, we will get in touch to coordinate an online technical test as a first step in the interview process.

HTML:
Do you want to impact a highly-skilled team that uses cutting edge techniques in Natural Language Processing and Algorithmic Trading? We are looking for an NLP Researcher that will help us greatly improve the text-processing behind our models.

At Alipes Capital, we have been the market leader in automating the financial markets since we started back in 2008, shaping a fully automatic natural language processing system for reading and interpreting financial news.

Your work

Your work will support turning massive data sets of unstructured financial information into structured datasets and mathematical models that accurately predict movements in the equity markets. In doing so, you will:

  • Redesign and introduce new text-processing techniques to extract additional and more accurate entities from the text-sources that underlie our trading algorithms

  • Maintain and curate new and existing text data sources for our analyses

  • Automate monitoring and benchmarking of the trading strategies

You will enjoy a wide degree of autonomy and responsibility to optimize our machine-learning pipelines, from data-ingestion to live-model performance. There is no red tape, no sales people to consult and there is ample room for creativity.

The team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with fourteen passionate quantitative researchers covering six nationalities – eleven PhD’s and three MSc’s- with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning (seven of us working directly on the text-based equity models).

We enjoy collaboration, lending a helping hand and discussing the business cases built upon our data-sets. You will be working alongside a team of software developers and a team of traders who implement and conceive the trading models with us. All team members write code and are not afraid to discuss technical details.

Need to have

  • Skilled in extracting signals from texts using embeddings to enhance prediction model

  • Proficient in entity-extraction from text, e.g. using modern Transformer-based Large-Language Models

  • Solid understanding of machine learning techniques and their practical applications

  • Aptitude for programming in a numerical scripting language (we primarily use Python)

  • A meticulous and detail-oriented mind

Nice to have

  • Experience using RAGs (Retrieval-Augmentation-Generation)

  • Working with financial/trading data

  • Experience with C#, C/C++ or Java

  • Familiarity with software engineering (version control, unit testing, object oriented-design)

  • Degree in Computer Science / Engineering

  • Exciting problems to solve

  • Nice office in central Copenhagen with a hybrid work model

Contract Duration: 6 Months

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours, Overlap Required: 5 hours Pst

Total Years Of exp- 2+ years

Mandatory Skills- Python min 2+ years. Technical Writing - min 2 yrs.

Job Description

We are actively seeking talented Senior Python Developers to join our ambitious team dedicated to pushing the frontiers of AI technology. This opportunity is tailored for professionals who thrive on developing innovative solutions and who aspire to be at the forefront of AI advancements. You will work with different companies in the US who are looking to develop both commercial and research AI solutions.

Required Skills


Write effective Python code to tackle complex issues
Use business sense and analytical abilities to glean valuable insights from public databases
Clearly express the reasoning and logic when writing code in Jupyter notebooks or other suitable mediums
Extensive experience working with Python
Proficiency with the language's syntax and conventions
Previous experience tackling algorithmic problems
Nice to have some prior Software Quality Assurance and Test Planning experience
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills


Required Skills For TWA

The ideal candidates should be able to


Clearly explain their strategies for problem-solving.
Design practical solutions in code.
Develop test cases to validate their solutions.
Debug and refine their solutions for improvement.

Title: Machine Learning Weather Researcher
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Imagine working with cutting-edge machine learning models, crunching high frequency data sets and sparring with exceptional and fun colleagues, all while taking part in scaling our business even further. Does this sound highly appealing to you?

Then you might be our new Machine Learning (ML) Weather Researcher at Alipes Capital.




About the Role

Alipes began trading in the Energy sector in 2022. We use machine learning technology for reading and interpreting fundamental and market data and execute our trading strategies based on this data. Since our inception in 2008, we have continuously grown and diversified into new business areas driven by our technology. Alipes aims to support liquid power markets and free flow of energy, which are crucial to facilitate the transition from fossil fuels to renewable energy sources, thereby promoting a sustainable future.




Forecasting power generation from renewables is crucial for price discovery, risk management and for balancing the power grid. Recent advances in ML/AI/Neural based weather modeling promise models which are orders of magnitude faster to run than traditional physics-based numerical weather models.




Your work as our new ML Weather Researcher will involve turning massive data sets of weather data into machine learning models that accurately predict short-term weather patterns and power production from renewables.




You will get instant validation of your work and experience short feedback cycles, where going from inception to deployment can be a matter of hours. There will be no red tape to cut and no sales people to consult. We are centrally located in Copenhagen and have 55 bright and ambitious team members.




About the Team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued, and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with passionate quantitative analysts covering 6 nationalities – a combination of PhD’s and MSc’s with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning. We enjoy collaboration and are always willing to lend a helping hand. We are working alongside two other teams of software developers and economists that implement and conceive the mathematical models together with us. What makes this constellation work great is that all of the individual team members write code and understand that a seemingly trivial change can actually require a lot of work, and vice versa.




About You

Experience with ML/AI/Neural-based weather forecasting (GraphCast etc)
Experience with Deep Learning and Neural Networks
PhD or MSc degree in engineering, physics, computer science or relevant field
Familiar with terms like ECMWF IFS, HRRR, GFS, GOES etc.
Proficiency within computer science fundamentals, mathematics and statistics
Programming experience with Python, in particular data-wrangling and numerical programming
A scientific and inquisitive mind




What we can Offer You

Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy
Exciting problems to solve
Collaborative team made up of really smart and curious people
Nice office in central Copenhagen with a hybrid work model
Pension, Health Insurance and 30 days of vacation




Practicalities

To apply, please send us your CV and a cover letter telling us why you think this role is a great fit for you. If your profile looks like a good match, we will get in touch to coordinate an online technical test as a first step in the interview process.

Title: Vision Engineer
Place: Odense Kommune, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Bachelor or Master of Engineering in Robot Systems/Vision Engineer.




Do you want to help secure the quality of food products around the globe, and do you have what it takes to continuously deliver the best vision technology solutions and work at the forefront of technological development?  

Then join us at TriVision 




Job description 

As our new vision engineer and developer, you will become part of a core function in joining the development and project team in Odense. 

Your primary focus will be application development as well as application customization and configuration, all in cooperation with the sales team to ensure that customer requirements are being formally specified and worked into the execution plan. 

As a vision engineer and software developer, you will be involved in the projects from start to finish, including software and system design in the beginning and running-in at the end of the projects.  

  

The job and areas of responsibility: 

·      Develop and customize applications

·      Evaluate customer requirements in order to customize and configure software applications and turnkey solutions to meet the agreed specifications 

·      Make sure that solutions are tested thoroughly before being installed or deployed 

·      Conduct programming, technical setup, troubleshooting and testing during installation to ensure that our products function optimally in in our customers’ existing systems and production lines 

·      Manage, monitor and track technical issues, risks and/or tasks during installation to ensure that all solution requirements are met before handover 

·      Test, validate and assure quality to ensure the solution is fully integrated and operational 

·      Assist remotely when colleagues or partners install our solutions 

·      Assist on keeping projects on track and evaluate project performance with the rest of the operations and support team 

 

  

Your experiences 

·      Bachelor of Engineering in Robot Systems, MSc in Engineering or other relevant background 

·      Vision Application experience 

·      Visual C++ knowledge  

·      Hands-on experience with software design 

·      Preferably an image analysis background or experience 

·      General knowledge and competencies with respect to software design, applications development, project execution and test procedures 

·      Have graduated recently with the right mindset

  

You: 

·      Have a strong interest in vision applications and software programming 

·      A profound desire to develop yourself and your engineering/programming skills 

·      Take professional pride in delivering high quality software 

·      Have an analytical mindset 

·      Are helpful, structured, focused, calm and a trustworthy team player, that can also work independently 

·      Demonstrate good attention to detail 

·      Are used to work with and meet tight deadlines 

·      Approach every task in a structured manner to ensure task completion and to deliver relevant knowledge-sharing, e.g. through installation reports and documentation 

·      Focus on delivering according to URS and on time, and establish a personal and basic understanding of TriVision, the products, solutions and customers 

·      Have good communication skills and are fluent in both spoken and written English 

·      Might speak Danish, German, Spanish or another European language 

·      Either live in Denmark or have a valid work & resident permit for Denmark




Working at TriVision 

TriVision offers you a challenging and exciting job in the automation industry. You will become part of an ambitious team that strives to push the boundaries of vision technology to deliver the best quality control systems. 

You will be part of a highly engaged, skilled and specialized team of C++ developers and vision engineers, that together develop the future of quality control for the food industry. 

Attractive compensation package is offered 




About TriVision 

TriVision delivers automation of quality control using vision technology solutions for the production industry to help companies gain a higher efficiency and secure the quality of their products. Since the company was founded in 1999, TriVision has won several awards for its user-friendly systems, and today the company’s systems inspect more than 1 million items each day. 

TriVision made it their VISION to Reduce Food Waste and to Increase Food Safety. The MISSION is to realise this vision by pushing the boundaries of vision technology 

See more at www.trivision.dk 

 

Interested 

If you have any questions about the position or TriVision, please get in touch with Torben Poulsen tp@trivision.dk or +45 27795898




Show more

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
This role offers a diverse and challenging role, tackling various tasks for different companies using multiple technologies. You will build data pipelines and deploy machine learning solutions, collaborating closely with data scientists and solution managers.

Key Responsibilities

Develop and maintain APIs
Manage cloud setups and DevOps
Analyze customer IT systems for ML solution integration
Create ML pipelines to integrate ML services into IT systems

Required Qualifications

Experience deploying machine learning models
Proficiency in Python
Professional proficiency in Danish

Preferred Qualifications

Experience with various database types (relational, graph, NoSQL, document)
Familiarity with cloud environments (AWS, Azure)
Background in software development or data engineering

Personal Attributes

Strong communication skills with customers and stakeholders
Independent and quick to learn new technologies and solve problems
Business-oriented with an interest in the interaction between software and business value
Team player who values cooperation and knowledge sharing

Please send over your CV and this will be reviewed immediately


Darwin Recruitment is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

Title: Python Software Engineer (Data Science Team)
Description:
This role can be full-remote from within the EU.

We are a remote-first, international SaaS company dedicated to helping businesses find and target the right accounts primed for conversion. By merging Leadfeeder and Echobot, we've brought together two leading companies to create a powerful sales intelligence and web visitor identification platform that gives sales and marketing teams the real time data, insights, and tools they need to win more deals.

What makes us unique? Originating in Finland and Germany, the country with the highest privacy standards in Europe, Dealfront is built on a foundation of compliance and transparency. Our platform ensures users know exactly where the data comes from, maintaining integrity while enhancing profitability.

Join our diverse and dynamic team of over 270 Dealfronters spread across 40 countries. Together, let's redefine success for B2B companies across Europe and beyond. Join us and be a part of our journey to transform the way businesses win more deals!

Position Overview

We are looking for an experienced Python Software Engineer to join the Data Science team. In this role, you help to bridge the gap between data science models and production environments while ensuring reliability, performance, and scalability of our solutions.

Being part of the Data Science team, you play an active role in shaping, discussing, learning and experiencing developments in an exciting field, while you always advocate software quality. You become part of a nice, motivated and skilled team in which everyone pulls together.

What You'll Work On


Design and implementation of efficient processing pipelines, mainly in Python
Implement model APIs and integrate models into existing software systems
Support the translation of data science models from prototypes to production-ready code
Ensure robust CI/CD pipelines for smooth deployment and version control
Collaborate with data scientists to design software solutions that align with data science workflows
Implement data quality controls, logging, and monitoring systems
Document code, processes, and best practices for maintainability
Share insights and mentor other team members on software engineering principles



Requirements


At least 3 years of software development experience, mostly in Python
Interest in working with data-centric applications
Good understanding of GIT workflows, CI/CD + working with Unit Tests
Solid experience in interacting with technologies such as SQL (especially PostgreSQL), Kafka, Redis, Solr/Opensearch
Ability to help and improve the work of your colleagues through your teamwork and communication skills
Desired: Experience with a K8s environment and Docker
Be physically located within European timezones



Benefits


In this role, your contributions will directly influence the future direction and success of our products, shaping their growth and ensuring they meet the evolving needs of our customers
The chance to work with a very knowledgeable, high-achieving and fun team
An international, diverse, dynamic and committed work environment
The opportunity to work remotely, with a flexible work schedule
Mental Health support with Auntie
Annual company retreats in sunny locations and team off-sites :)


We encourage all interested candidates to apply, even if you don't meet all of the criteria listed.

We value diversity and inclusion in our workplace and welcome applications from candidates across all backgrounds and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability or any other protected characteristics.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our highly-skilled development team in Copenhagen is seeking a versatile Senior Data Scientist with a passion for formalism, heuristics and algorithms as well as an understanding of software engineering. As a Senior Data Scientist, you will be a key player in a challenging and dynamic developmental story. We are passionate about new solutions, technologies and algorithms, but pragmatic in our choice of solutions. LiveIntent Copenhagen is responsible for the development and deployment of the company's next generation technology in close collaboration with the company's other departments in New York and Berlin.

Our team in Copenhagen consists of a couple of hand picked veterans from the start-up environment as well as 30 handpicked highly competent and focused colleagues who have joined since the end of 2016. Both the level of competence and focus is therefore very high and for that reason, many exciting tasks are constantly flowing from the rest of the organization to Copenhagen. We want to expand the team with more skilled and innovative talents and we are looking for both Data Scientists and Data Engineers, but prefer people with an interest in both areas of work.

About The Job

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist for LiveIntent Copenhagen, who can analyze issues based on data, and design, develop and maintain algorithms, reports and software solutions for LiveIntent. This person will largely be able to plan, choose and organize their own tasks, but will also be expected to work closely with the other team developers and stakeholders in the company's international product division. The Senior Data Scientist will be part of all stages of development, from initial sparring and exchange of ideas to prototyping, development, testing, deployment, maintenance / improvement and reporting, but with the expected focus on the first three parts. We believe in flexibility under responsibility, and our development process is therefore a loosely defined hybrid of agile methods and rapid prototyping. Our Ideal Candidate:


Has experience with data analysis and software development from other positions.
Is interested in translating real world issues into mathematical models, mathematical statistics and algorithms.
Ideally also has an interest in programming (in several languages), in machine learning and / or adtech technology.
Has one of the heavier mathematical educations such as computer science, mathematics or physics.
Has several years of practical experience with real programming, practical and / or deep theoretical understanding of some of the following: Classical statistics (hypothesis tests, confidence intervals), Data mining, ETL processing, machine Learning, Probabilistic graphical models (eg Markov logic networks or Bayesian networks), Data Processing in MapReduce using Hadoop / Cascading / Scalding, Programming in Scala, Python programming, Data reporting and ad hoc analysis in Athena, Google BigQuery or the "PyLab" suite.
Has experience mentoring and guiding other team members in a previous role.


Our ideal candidate attacks problems analytically and solutions pragmatically. This person is full of good ideas, able to see opportunities in other people's ideas, and can find out about ideas in a distanced and constructive way. They love thinking about many issues and connecting them with data. Our ideal Senior Data Scientist candidate understands that finding new facets of data is more important than adjusting meta parameters to algorithms. They are happy to implement and optimize and are curious about new tasks.

We're looking for someone who will be excited to understand and involve themselves in the company's problem areas and can communicate in English with management and colleagues at the other LiveIntent offices. This person will be immersed in a dynamic environment where overall priorities and definitions will change over time, and therefore tasks will not always be prioritized. This person will work independently and take initiative.

The Company

LiveIntent, one of the world’s largest people-based marketing platforms, connects 2,500 publishing and advertising brands with over 250 MM verified people every month across all types of media. With the anonymized email address at the center of its industry-leading identity graph, LiveIntent provides brands with solutions that help them monetize, acquire, and retain real people, even where cookies don’t work. LiveIntent enriches a brands’ data, making it possible for them to deepen their understanding of their audiences, and more effectively market to people wherever they are present and paying attention. LiveIntent is home to over 180 people worldwide with offices in New York, Chicago, Berlin, and Copenhagen.

LiveIntent Copenhagen started as a Danish startup company in 2013 and was acquired by LiveIntent in November 2015. We develop and operate both an online, real-time service that receives billions of requests from all over the world and from other LiveIntent components, and an offline, batch-oriented analytical data processing pipeline that prepares data for the online service by processing billions of data points.

We Offer

You can look forward to being a key player in a challenging and dynamic developmental story where you will be part of a team with some of the industry's hottest talents. There will be rich opportunities to both learn from and mentor others, and you will have the flexibility to dive into experiments on your own. We are passionate about new solutions, technologies and algorithms, but pragmatic in our choice of solutions.

We believe in freedom and flexibility under responsibility so that office hours can be adapted to your life as long as meetings are covered. If you need to work from home one day, it is completely fine, as long as you live up to what is expected. We are an international company, so while this position is located in our Copenagen office, there is frequent collaboration between the teams in Berlin and New York City.

Does that sound exciting? If so, send us an application! We are a small office with a social atmosphere so your personal profile is just as valuable to us as your technical skills. A cover letter will therefore be greatly appreciated.


Show more
HTML:
Our highly-skilled development team in Copenhagen is seeking a versatile Senior Data Scientist with a passion for formalism, heuristics and algorithms as well as an understanding of software engineering. As a Senior Data Scientist, you will be a key player in a challenging and dynamic developmental story. We are passionate about new solutions, technologies and algorithms, but pragmatic in our choice of solutions. LiveIntent Copenhagen is responsible for the development and deployment of the company's next generation technology in close collaboration with the company's other departments in New York and Berlin.

Our team in Copenhagen consists of a couple of hand picked veterans from the start-up environment as well as 30 handpicked highly competent and focused colleagues who have joined since the end of 2016. Both the level of competence and focus is therefore very high and for that reason, many exciting tasks are constantly flowing from the rest of the organization to Copenhagen. We want to expand the team with more skilled and innovative talents and we are looking for both Data Scientists and Data Engineers, but prefer people with an interest in both areas of work.
