Title: Research Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you ready for a new beginning?

We need your talent, knowledge and dedication to better our world with biology.

Our purpose points the way

In Novonesis, we know that solutions rooted in biology can help solve humanity’s biggest challenges. Since we began more than a century ago, this has been our guide. It’s how we've gotten so far. And it’s how we'll impact the future. Now, more than ever, the world needs change. And with biosolutions, the possibilities for transformation are endless.

We’re here to better our world with biology.

Join us as our new Molecular Discovery research scientist.

Molecular Discovery drives early innovation through natural and engineered enzyme and protein diversity. At our site in Lyngby we are organized into two wet labs, covering approximately 50 scientists and technicians, and are complemented by a bioinformatics and design department. As part of Molecular Discovery, you will play a central role in developing state-of-the-art enzyme/protein solutions in close collaboration with our industry partners across a broad range of applications. This includes contributions to sustainable practices such as low-temperature laundering, energy-efficient manufacturing, renewable energy sources, and enhancing the sensory experience of food products.

As Part Of This Role, We Offer


Exceptional opportunities for professional growth
A friendly, transparent and supportive work environment
A team-oriented structure that values empowerment and collaboration


Molecular Discovery is an integral part of the Enzyme, Protein & Strain Engineering Research area within R&D.

To Succeed In This Role, You Must


Possess a degree in biotechnology, molecular biology, biochemistry or related field (PhD or equivalent experience).
Exhibit proficiency in molecular biology & DNA modification; experience with enzyme and protein expression in Aspergillus/Bacillus systems is a plus.
Have a good enzyme-substrate understanding with the ability to apply this to select the right enzyme activity (protein) and develop assays for effective screening
Have experience with protein engineering and understanding of structure-function relationships.
Ideally have a keen interest in data analysis and programming (e.g. Python, Jupiter notebooks etc.).
Embody the spirit of a team player, committed to continuous learning and leading initiatives that drive team success.
Thrive in a multi-cultural environment, communicating effectively in English to unite diverse perspectives.


Application deadline: August 26th 2024

Contact details: Senior Department Manager Lars Giger (lgi@novonesis.com) or Senior Department Manager Katrine Pontoppidan (kpon@novonesis.com)

Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

At Novonesis we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. We recommend you not to attach a cover letter to your application. Instead, please include a few sentences in your resume/CV about why you are applying. To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your resume/CV.

Novonesis is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, disability, or veteran status.

Want to learn more?

Learn more about Novonesis, our purpose, and your career opportunities at novonesis.com

Not the right fit for you?

Even if this job isn't the right fit for you, perhaps you know someone who might find it interesting. If so, please feel free to share the job link and encourage them to apply. Thank you for your referral! Please check out our other open positions. The right fit for you could just be a few clicks away.

Title: Data scientist med fokus på dataanalyse og sensorteknologi
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Har du lyst til at arbejde med avanceret dataanalyse og sensorteknologi? Hos Teknologisk Institut i Taastrup får du muligheden for at sætte dit aftryk på den teknologiske udvikling inden for fødevareindustrien med deltagelse i udviklingsprojekter fra idé til implementering.

Du bliver en del af Dataanvendelse, hvor vi bruger data til at fremme den grønne agenda i fødevaresektoren ved at optimere råvareudnyttelsen og produktionsprocesserne. Vi udvikler algoritmer bl.a. baseret på ny måleteknologi inden for 2D og 3D vision, video, ultralyd og røntgen CT. Vores løsninger implementeres online i virksomhedernes IT-systemer og understøtter effektivitet, fødevaresikkerhed og sporbarhed. Datakilderne er både egenudviklede avancerede målesystemer samt et bredt udvalg af sensorer og databaser fra virksomhederne.

Dine arbejdsopgaver vil bl.a. bestå af:



Deltagelse i udviklingsprojekter fra analyse-idé til implementering, test og validering
Udvikling af algoritmer og den bagvedliggende pipeline
Projektledelse af mindre projekter
Bidrage med ny viden inden for machine- og deep learning-feltet.



Derudover kommer du til at arbejde med udviklingsprojekter sammen med store kunder inden for fødevareindustrien.

Jobbet indebærer mindre rejseaktivitet i forbindelse med besøg hos kunder i ind- og udland.

Kendskab til machine learning og computer-vision

Du har en videregående uddannelse inden for det naturvidenskabelige område f.eks. civilingeniør, cand.scient. i fysik, matematik, statistik, IT eller datalogi, eller anden ingeniørvidenskabelig baggrund.

Du har den nyeste teori på plads og har et godt kendskab til flere programmeringssprog f.eks. Python, C# og C++. Du kan lide at arbejde med alt fra klassisk statistik, billede/video-behandling til Deep learning, og du har en interesse for samspillet mellem sensorteknologi og den efterfølgende dataanalyse. Som person er du detalje- og resultatorienteret.

Derudover er du velformuleret på dansk og engelsk, både mundtligt og skriftligt.

Vi tilbyder dig en alsidig hverdag med højt til loftet, hvor der er fokus på både den faglige og personlige udvikling. Som data scientist får du et fagligt udfordrende job, hvor du arbejder tæt sammen med højt kvalificerede og erfarne kolleger i centret.

Du bliver en del af Teknologisk Institut

Til dagligt vil du være tilknyttet sektionen Dataanvendelse, som er en del af centret Bæredygtighed og Digitalisering, hvor vi er 30 medarbejdere. I centret arbejder vi med at få udviklet og implementeret algoritmer i produktion, hvor vi anvender de nyeste teorier inden for kunstig intelligens og tager de nyeste teknologier i brug. Hos os vil du opleve mange forskelligartede udfordringer, hvor du både skal trække på dine teknisk faglige, analytiske og kommunikative kompetencer.

Kontakt

Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, er du velkommen til at kontakte centerchef Dennis Brandborg Nielsen på tlf. nr.: 7220 1904.

Vi inviterer løbende til samtaler og ansætter, når den rette kandidat er fundet, så vi ser frem til at modtage din ansøgning hurtigst muligt og senest d. 4. september 2024.

Title: Data Science & AI Lead
Description:
Join Bunker Holding as our Data Science & AI Lead to drive innovation and shape the future of bunker trading. Lead the design of groundbreaking AI solutions, inspire a diverse team, and turn business ideas into impactful results. Work in a dynamic environment where your expertise will thrive and make a significant impact.







About Us

Bunker Holding is one of the world’s leading companies in bunker trading. Our history as one of the pioneers in bunkering inspires us to be ever forward-looking and goal oriented. Family ownership allows us to remain grounded in our values, and to stay the course in our vision of sustainable development.

We are dedicated to leveraging data and AI to enhance our operational efficiency and drive innovation. Our team thrives on diversity and inclusivity, believing that a wide range of perspectives leads to groundbreaking solutions and a stronger organization.







Position Overview

We are seeking a visionary Data Science & AI Lead to accelerate our efforts in harnessing data to create value across our business. In this role, you will be spending time in our business and ensuring that business ideas are transformed into practical, impactful solutions. Together with our Director of Architecture and Intelligence, you’ll build and drive a new established function: Data Science & AI Center of Excellence (CoE) - which aims to drive innovation and integrate AI technologies by aligning initiatives with business goals, fostering cross-departmental collaboration, and ensuring scalable and sustainable practices. This approach will enhance organizational performance and maintain a competitive edge.”

You’ll collaborate with dynamic cross-functional teams to uncover key data-driven opportunities in the bunkering industry and bridge the gap between business stakeholders and technical teams for seamless communication and alignment.

Additionally, you’ll lead the design and implementation of innovative AI models and data analytics that tackle industry challenges, optimizing fuel logistics, pricing, and customer satisfaction. Inspire a culture of continuous improvement and excellence within the data science team, staying ahead with emerging technologies. Your hands-on expertise in data analysis, modeling, and coding will be invaluable in guiding and mentoring team members.




Your key responsibilities will thus include:

Drive AI strategies to achieve ambitious goals
Align business and IT for seamless communication
Design innovative and scalable AI solutions
Inspire continuous improvement and excellence
Promote diversity and inclusion within the team







What do you bring?

Bring your passion and expertise to our team with a degree in Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field, and 5-7 years of experience in data science or AI. If you have experience in the maritime or bunkering industry, that's an advantage!

Showcase your technical prowess in programming and machine learning frameworks, and use your industry knowledge to turn business needs into innovative solutions.

Inspire and lead your team with your exceptional communication and problem-solving skills. Embrace our dynamic environment with enthusiasm, ready to learn and adapt to new technologies.




Specifically, we expect you to have:

Bachelor's or Master's in Data Science or related field; Ph.D. is a plus
5-7 years of experience in data science or AI
Proficiency in Python, R, SQL, and machine learning frameworks
Strong business acumen in the bunkering industry
Excellent leadership and problem-solving skills
Adaptability to fast-paced, dynamic environments







Why Join Us?

Join our team and help shape the future of the bunkering industry with innovative, data-driven solutions. Work in a collaborative and forward-thinking environment where your ideas are celebrated and encouraged. Experience ample opportunities for professional growth and career advancement within a leading company. Become part of a diverse and inclusive team dedicated to creating a supportive environment where everyone thrives.

The position is in Middelfart or Aarhus, and travels to our location in Middelfart on weekly basis is to be expected.







How to apply

Note that applications are handled on an ongoing basis. So please send your application and CV as soon as possible by filling in the form below.

In case you have any questions about the position, please contact Director of Architecture and Intelligence, Anders Butzbach Christensen on +45 88 81 17 64.

We are already looking forward to hearing from you!

Please be advised that response times for applications may be extended due to the summer holiday period.







Bunker Holding is the global leader in purchasing, selling, and supplying marine fuel and lube oil as well as providing risk management and other vital services for the shipping industry. The company operates via more than 1,660 ports worldwide and is present in 32 countries with 62 offices and more than 1,500 skilled employees.

The group has a long history but remains forward-looking and focused on answering the needs and challenges of an ever-changing industry.

Bunker Holding is the largest company in the USTC Group, a family-owned company based in Denmark. USTC holds activities in oil & energy, ship owning, shipping & door-to-door logistics, risk management, car activities, IT, sustainable energy, and environment & recycling. The USTC Group is currently present with more than 160 offices in 40 countries and employs more than 4,300 people worldwide.

Read more at https://www.bunker-holding.com/

Title: Experienced Data Scientist
Description:
Be a key player in the success of our cutting-edge product, SitaWare Insight.

AI is rapidly changing how complex raw data is turned into useful information, and information is what fuels the military intelligence process. For us, utilizing advanced algorithms on text, images, audio, video, and real-time geo-positional data gives our customers an advantage on the battlefield. This is what saves lives and helps win the battle.

SitaWare Insight is a decision support tool that uses AI to convert data into invaluable military intelligence. This involves transforming data into information, providing commanders with advanced data capture and analysis capabilities, and leveraging technologies such as machine learning.

The team
You will become part of a Scrum team of 11 highly skilled and competent colleagues in Denmark. From day one, you will be met with a collaborative and dynamic environment where you can develop your competencies.

Our mission for the team is to advance toward an operational AI platform. Currently, we service AI models such as LLM for text and audio, the latest deep learning models for images and videos and custom models for time series. Still, we aspire to elevate these models to the next level of maturity through improved generalization, scalability, and efficiency of our platform.

In short, you can look forward to:


Developing high-quality machine learning models to enhance decision support
Collaborating with MLOps for the seamless integration of models
Contributing to the growth, improvement, and maintenance of SitaWare Insight



Experienced Data Scientist
We are looking for an experienced data scientist to work on a broad spectrum of data science tasks, including model development and model deployment. We expect that you are passionate about transforming data into actionable insights and that you bring:


Proven product development experience as a Data Scientist with knowledge and experience with LLM and NLP methods
Minimum of a Master's or Ph.D. in a relevant field (e.g., Cognitive Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science).
Demonstrated expertise in developing and implementing machine learning models
Strong programming skills in Python and popular ML frameworks such as PyTorch, Transformers, Tensorflow
Proficiency in data preprocessing and feature engineering
Computer science skills supporting the overall development of the data science service
Solid understanding of data handling, model evaluation, visualization of data-driven solutions and development of best-practices
Appreciate teamwork and sparring with colleagues
Great communication skills
Proficient in English



Please note that you must be able to present a clean criminal record and have lived in a NATO/EU country for the past seven years as we work with security-classified projects. Read more here.

Never stop developing
Systematic is truly international, proudly Danish and uniquely people-centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. It is not just a place to work but a place to belong.

You can look forward to joining our Employees Club, which offers almost 100 events of both social and professional character a year – plenty to choose from. Our colleagues also highlight our canteen, which serves various delicious and healthy dishes daily. In addition, we offer several employee benefits such as paid Home Internet, health insurance and a company pension scheme. Finally, we are always up for a friendly game of padel at our new padel court in Aarhus!

Start your development here
We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis as we wish to welcome our new colleague as soon as possible, so click Apply Now and send us your CV today. If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Preben Schmidt Nielsen, Senior Project Manager.

Get in touch

Mette Mørch Rasmussen

Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant


Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer in Intraday power team
Description:
Join the team as MFT Energy's new Machine Learning Engineer in Intraday power team

In MFT Energy, we trade energy to make markets efficient and to facilitate the green transition. We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join our ambitious Intraday power team with experienced colleagues, who strive to be the best every day.




The job as Machine Learning Engineer

You will be a part of our great Intraday power team and as a Machine Learning Engineer, you will be one of the driving forces behind designing and maintaining a robust machine learning setup encompassing over 100 models. Your role is pivotal in bringing our ML setup to the next maturity stage, significantly expanding our model portfolio. You will collaborate closely with data scientists, platform engineers, quants, and traders to achieve these goals.




Your key responsibilities

Design, implement, and maintain a scalable ML infrastructure.
Support, manage and optimize a portfolio of 100+ ML models.
Work with cross-functional teams to integrate ML models into trading systems.
Enhance the maturity and scalability of our ML setup.




Your core skills

Proficiency in Python.
Hands-on experience with Docker for containerization.
Experience with public cloud services (Azure, AWS, GCP).
Experience with Git for version control.
Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines.
Familiarity with Bash and Linux environments.
Strong analytical skills and an eye for detail.




Beneficial skills

Proficiency in core ML frameworks/tools is a plus: MLFlow, Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch.
Strong SQL skills or similar database tools.
Familiarity with workflow orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow, Prefect).




Your qualifications

Minimum of 2 years of relevant experience.
MSc or Ph.D. in a quantitative field (e.g., Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, Business Intelligence, Economics, or similar).




Working in MFT Energy

You will be part of a young, global, and vibrant working environment in the heart of Aarhus. MFT Energy is a transparent and flat organization with entrepreneurship at heart. We are 163 employees working out of our headquarters in Scandinavian Center in Aarhus C and from our international offices in Turkey, Australia, Austin, Singapore, and several remote colleagues working from all over the world. Our mission is to empower entrepreneurs to become the best and our work culture is based on collaboration, transparency, and a proactive mindset.




We offer:

A competitive and entrepreneurial work environment.
Professional and committed colleagues with great ambitions.
Great employee benefits and a people-centered leadership approach.
A celebrative work environment, a modern workplace, and an entrepreneurial, professional culture.




Make the Most of Your Talent! Join us!

If you think there is a match between our values and your aspirations, we will be looking forward to receiving your application with a short cover letter and CV. For questions, please contact career@mft-energy.com.




Start date: As soon as possible.




We will be screening and interviewing candidates on an ongoing basis.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Place: Hedehusene, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for a (Senior) ML Engineer to join our Data Science Team in ROCKWOOL HQ in Hedehusene. In this job, you can expect to travel about 10% of the time in support of global projects.

Ready to help build a better future for generations to come?

In an ever-changing, fast paced world, we owe it to ourselves and our future generations to live life responsibly. At ROCKWOOL, we work relentlessly to enrich modern living through our innovative stone wool solutions.

Your future team

We have recently started a journey towards using more digitalization and automation and better use of data – and this is where your abilities come into play. You will join our Data Science team and work at the forefront of machine learning and artificial intelligence.

What You Will Be Doing

As our new Senior ML Engineer with expertise in ML Ops and DevOps in general, you will be responsible for designing, implementing and managing advanced Machine Learning pipelines related to GenAI, computer vision and manufacturing sensor data applications. You will collaborate with data scientists, data engineers and platform engineers to develop and deploy models in both manufacturing and commercial side of business.

More specific responsibilities include :

Model deployment & monitoring


Design, develop and implement advanced Machine Learning pipelines in both cloud, on-prem and edge devices.
Implement and support model monitoring and alerting systems.
Implement efficient algorithms for real-time processing of sensor data.
Deploy models on edge computing devices such as Nvidia Jetson.
Use Azure OpenAI, vector databases, Langchain and several other services and packages to deploy custom GenAI applications
Implement continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD) practices to streamline model development and deployment.



Follow Machine Learning Best Practices & ensure collaboration


Implement Machine Learning Ops practices to streamline the development, deployment, and maintenance of models in production
Collaboration with the team in identifying areas for improvement and recommend strategies to enhance the data science function in our organization
Collaborate with Infrastructure & Platform team to ensure development of robust ML pipelines
Collaborate with Data engineers to identify data sources and develop efficient data pipeline strategies



Stay up to date with latest technologies in AI/ML domain


Ensure continuous learning and development
Stay up to date with the latest developments in Data Science to ensure that our practices are cutting-edge



What You Bring


A master's degree in computer science, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or related field
5+ years of experience in Data Science and it would be great if you have experience with either the manufacturing industry or with GenAI
Excellent skills within Python, R, SQL, and cloud computing technologies
Hands on experience in deploying models and algorithms into production systems is desirable
Experience with Orchestration, Containerization, DevOps & ML Ops tools and frameworks such as Docker, Kubernetes, Kubeflow, MLflow, Azure DevOps etc.
Common Cloud & Machine Learning platforms such as Azure, Snowflake, Databricks and more
Experience with developing Infrastructure as Code solutions and using for example Bicep
Cloud computing platforms such as Amazon Web Services, Azure, or Google Cloud.
In depth knowledge of DevOps practices and tools such as Git, Jenkins, and Ansible.
Familiarity with Agile development as applied to Data Science
Professional in English language



As a person you are curious and solution oriented. You can easily communicate complex content across functions and to non-technical colleagues. And you have a structured way of working forward and take pride in delivering high quality output.

We are flexible on the level of seniority for this role and encourage both Senior ML Engineers and ML Engineers to apply. If you have a passion for machine learning and meet the qualifications, we would love to hear from you.

ROCKWOOL are keen to nurture employees develop their talents and move forward in their careers. You can expect to be supported in your professional ambitions through our programs, to help you reach your professional goals.

Ready to apply?

If you want to know more, please contact Data Science Team Lead Shabab Akhter, shabab.akhter@rockwool.com. Please submit your CV and motivational latest Sunday 15th of September 2024.

Who We Are

We are the world leader in stone wool solutions. Founded in 1937 in Denmark, we transform volcanic rock into safe, sustainable products that help people and communities thrive. We are a global company with more than 12,000 employees, located in 40+ countries with 51 manufacturing facilities, all focused on one common purpose – to release the natural power of stone to enrich modern living.

Sustainability is central to our business strategy. ROCKWOOL was one of the first companies to commit to actively contributing to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDG’s) framework and are actively committed to 11 SDGs, including SDG 14, Life Below Water. Through our partnership with the One Ocean Foundation and in connection with our sponsorship of the Denmark SailGP team, we will help raise awareness around ocean health challenges in an effort to accelerate solutions to protect it.

Diverse and Inclusive Culture

We want all our people to feel valued, respected, included and heard. We employ 79 different nationalities worldwide and are committed to providing equal opportunities to all employees, promote diversity, and work against all forms of discrimination among ROCKWOOL employees.

Title: Senior React Native Software Engineer
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Would you like to join an exciting digital transformation journey and contribute to a cutting-edge platform that is shaping the future of banking in the Nordics?




Help us at Digital Banking, build, develop and maintain our NEoS (New E-bank and Sales Platform) banking app, used by more than 2 million end-customers across Denmark, Sweden, Norway and the Faroe Islands.




SDC’s “golden platform”

The future of SDC is our “New E-bank and Sales Platform” – better known as NEoS. Our award-winning platform provides Scandinavian banks and their end-customers with a modern, flexible, and open digital self-service solution tailored to the needs of the individual bank. NEoS aims to revolutionize the banking experience for both individual and business customers across web and app.




How is it to work at NEoS App Product Stream?

As part of SDC’s Digital Banking department, the “App Product Stream” offers an excellent opportunity to become part of a flat and agile department that will, no doubt, both challenge and sometimes frustrate the seasoned developer.

In our collaborative environment, your voice will be heard (and is expected to be expressed), and you'll collaborate with level-headed colleagues. Our teams are dedicated to self-development and continuous learning, always striving to improve and challenge the status quo. We embrace modern technologies and love experimenting with new innovations, all whilst sharing our knowledge with others.

You'll have the chance to hone and expand your skills alongside a team deeply focused on React Native. Day-to-day, you’ll engage with your colleagues, developing new features and closely partnering with your team on design, estimation, and implementation of features.

Working in SDC’s “App Product Stream” will offer you an opportunity to wield significant influence while collaborating cross-functionally with a talented international team of experienced engineers.




By the way, we work in a hybrid work environment, allowing you to work remotely or in the office as needed. We appreciate a healthy work-life balance for greater productivity.




What makes you successful in this role?

You are proficient in React Native, JavaScript/TypeScript and Redux/Redux-Saga. You have a flair for good UX and UI design, and you have experience working on large-scale IT projects.

You bring an engineering mindset and versatility that allow you to adapt to a broad knowledge domain. You are highly dedicated and take full responsibility for your work, ensuring that it is completed to the best of your ability and beyond.

You have a good balance between moving quickly and building long-term solutions. You're curious, innovative, enjoy tackling problems, and fluent in English.




Perks and benefits at SDC

30 days of paid vacation leave, plus 5 additional care-taker days (a total of 7 weeks off). We provide flexible working hours and private health and dental care for you and your family. At SDC, we also have a lot of exciting clubs such as a wine club, running club, theater club, and a Young Professionals Network.

When it's time to relax, you can take advantage of our SDC holiday apartments, available in Denmark, France and Spain, for you and your family. We also have an attractive pension scheme (11.65% of employer’s contribution), free parking, access to an affordable canteen, gym, holiday supplement (feriepenge) and more.




More about our benefits: https://www.sdc.dk/en/sdc/karriere/fordele-og-goder




We would love to hear from you

If you have any questions regarding the position, do not hesitate to contact Team Lead Jesper Mårtensson, via phone at +45 6110 3029 or email at jma@sdc.dk.

We will continuously review incoming applications and conduct interviews until we find the right candidates. Please submit your CV and cover letter.

Please note that we don’t consider unsolicited applications from agencies with whom we do not already have an agreement.




A bit about SDC

SDC is a full-service IT center that develops efficient banking solutions for millions of bank customers throughout the Nordic region. We were founded in 1963 when a number of small savings banks joined forces with the dream of economies of scale and digital bookkeeping. That dream still drives us. We call it "A great banking experience at a competitive price.”

In short, we offer small and medium-sized banks throughout the Nordic region efficient and user-friendly IT systems. This cross-Nordic collaboration makes us unique and enables us to work with economies of scale and share development costs.

We are more than 900 colleagues in offices in Ballerup, Warsaw, and Bergen.

Focusing on our internal values - "Winning Together", "Professional", and "Customer Oriented" - we work every day to meet the goals of the 2025 Strategy, "Execute Effective Banking".

You can find more information at www.sdc.dk

Show more
HTML:
Would you like to join an exciting digital transformation journey and contribute to a cutting-edge platform that is shaping the future of banking in the Nordics?


Help us at Digital Banking, build, develop and maintain our NEoS (New E-bank and Sales Platform) banking app, used by more than 2 million end-customers across Denmark, Sweden, Norway and the Faroe Islands.


SDC’s “golden platform”

The future of SDC is our “New E-bank and Sales Platform” – better known as NEoS. Our award-winning platform provides Scandinavian banks and their end-customers with a modern, flexible, and open digital self-service solution tailored to the needs of the individual bank. NEoS aims to revolutionize the banking experience for both individual and business customers across web and app.


How is it to work at NEoS App Product Stream?

As part of SDC’s Digital Banking department, the “App Product Stream” offers an excellent opportunity to become part of a flat and agile department that will, no doubt, both challenge and sometimes frustrate the seasoned developer.

30 days of paid vacation leave, plus 5 additional care-taker days (a total of 7 weeks off). We provide flexible working hours and private health and dental care for you and your family. Please note that we don’t consider unsolicited applications from agencies with whom we do not already have an agreement.

We were founded in 1963 when a number of small savings banks joined forces with the dream of economies of scale and digital bookkeeping. That dream still drives us. We call it "A great banking experience at a competitive price.”

In short, we offer small and medium-sized banks throughout the Nordic region efficient and user-friendly IT systems. This cross-Nordic collaboration makes us unique and enables us to work with economies of scale and share development costs.

We are more than 900 colleagues in offices in Ballerup, Warsaw, and Bergen.

Focusing on our internal values - "Winning Together", "Professional", and "Customer Oriented" - we work every day to meet the goals of the 2025 Strategy, "Execute Effective Banking".

You can find more information at www.sdc.dk

Title: Solutions Engineer - Denmark
Description:
Come join the company that is reinventing cloud security and empowering businesses to thrive in the cloud. As the fastest-growing startup ever, Wiz is on a mission to help organizations secure cloud environments that will accelerate their businesses. Trusted by security teams all over the world, we have a proven track record of success and a culture that values world-class talent.

Our Wizards from over 13 countries work together to protect the infrastructure of our hundreds of customers, including over 40% of the Fortune 100, who trust us to scan and secure over 230 billion files daily. We’re the leading player in a massive and growing market, but it’s still early enough for you to make a significant impact. At Wiz, you’ll have the freedom to think creatively, dream big, and use your full range of skills to contribute to our record growth. Come join our team and help us create secure cloud environments that allow the best companies to move faster.

Summary

As an Solutions Engineer, you will be responsible for supporting our enterprise customers, reporting to the regional Solutions Engineering Manager. You will partner directly with regional account executives to help change our customers view and how they approach cloud security. You will be their trusted advisor for all matters related to cloud security across AWS, Azure, and GCP. We are passionate about technical sales and helping our customers achieve the maximum value from our solution.

What You’ll Do


Partner with the sales team to provide technical leadership to our customers and prospective customers in conjunction with helping our team meet their quarterly sales targets.
Provide presentations to our customers and prospective customers such as whiteboards, product demonstrations, slides, and proof of value outcomes.
Help our customers and prospective customers plan in-depth test plans for showing the value of the Wiz platform in their environment (proof of value).
Invest time in learning new product features, industry related developments, and broadening your overall technical skillset.
Represent Wiz in technical forums such as trade shows, technical meet-ups, and industry events.


What You’ll Bring


Ability to deliver world class demonstrations and training experience to our channel customers
Mastered the technical sales process
Thrive in a creative technical role assisting partners to build a technical business delivery model
Experience in a sales engineering role delivering solutions to C-level executives at enterprise customers
Ability to travel up to 50%
Cloud security experience
AWS/Azure/GCP hands on experience
Network engineering experience
Strong operating system, virtual machine, and container knowledge
Knowledge of risk-based security assessments and frameworks
Understanding of cloud identity, access, certificates, and keys


BONUS POINTS:


Experience with traditional CSPM tools
SaaS experience
Awareness of the CI/CD process
Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code


If your experience is close but doesn’t fulfill all requirements, please apply. Wiz is on a mission to build a special company. To achieve our goal, we are focused on hiring Wizards with different backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences.

Wiz is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, political views or activity, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

By submitting your application, you acknowledge that Wiz will process your personal data in accordance with Wiz's Privacy Policy.

Title: Data Science Team Lead
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
My client is a leader in the maritime industry.




Role: Data Science Team Lead




Location: Remote (Must have eligibility to work in Denmark)




Overview




You will be working in a dynamic team with other data scientists in driving impactful insights and solutions through advanced analytics and machine learning techniques. You will play a pivotal role in shaping the direction of our data science initiatives and driving innovation.




Education




Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field




Ideal candidate

Strong understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, and libraries.
Ideally also AI LLM experience
Experience in machine learning and statistical modeling.
Work or research experience in discrete optimization / operation research.
Experience with production systems (not pure research)
Experience in the role of team lead building successful (web) applications in an agile environment.
Have a solid background in Data/Computer Science and/or Statistics/ Econometrics/ Mathematics .
Proficient in programming languages such as Python and SQL. Experience with Pandas and FastApi
Strong understanding of machine learning techniques, algorithms
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib.




Advantage

Maritime or SAS experience preferred, other industries considered




*** Only successful candidate will be contacted ***

Title: Associate Scientist - Drying Team
Description:
Are you a skilled academic with experience of drying processes? Do you have a profound interest in data-driven development of novel and challenging pharmaceutical products? Then you could be our new Associate Scientist in CMC API Development joining our drying activities in the Downstream Development department.

The position
In your job you will work in a development laboratory setting on pharmaceutical drying technologies focusing on API particle engineering and improved API bioavailability profiles. Furthermore, the role involves important contribution to the development of robust and scalable drying processes focusing on securing capacity demands from early-stage development projects through the final phases of process refinement to commercial scale manufacturing.

Your main tasks will be:



Perform spray-drying experiments in laboratory and pilot scale of APIs
Operate freeze drying experiments
Study and screen API solubility and stability
Conduct solid-state powder characterization and analysis of APIs
API purity analysis by UPLC
Planning, data management and documentation by using Excel and electrical laboratory notebook (ELN)
Develop and maintain equipment in the laboratories




Qualifications

To qualify you for the position, we imagine that you have:



You hold a BSc. or MSc in engineering/pharmaceutical/food science/ chemistry or equivalent
0-2 years of experience from spray drying and/or freeze drying of advance fine-chemical products (enzymes, microbes, proteins, peptides, small molecules)
Skilled at planning and documenting your work
Conversant in English and preferably know Danish (not a pre-requisite)
Experience from characterization of powders and a data science mind-set is an advantage
Profound interest in hands-on experimental laboratory development work




The position requires the ability to define and perform tasks independently with a dedicated commitment to deliver high quality data and documentation. At the same time, you are required to have a positive mind-set and thrive in a dynamic research environment where daily collaboration with various stakeholders is essential. You are a team player who actively participates in solving team tasks.

As an organization we provide you a broad range of exciting work challenges and the opportunity to become part of a workplace with an informal working environment and an active culture of cross-functional collaboration. You will have a unique possibility for professional and scientific development, and the chance to integrate into a dynamic team of highly qualified and enthusiastic colleagues both in the industrial environment and academic setting.

About The Department

As part of Novo Nordisk PSQIT organisation, Chemistry, Manufacturing and Control (CMC) Development & Scaling makes a real difference for patients with chronic diseases across the world. We develop, manufacture and distribute drug candidates for clinical trials and have a strong culture with a “can do” mind-set. As part of Novo Nordisk CMC API Development in Bagsværd, the Downstream Development department is focusing on the development of purification and drying processes for both early and late phase projects for semi-recombinant and fully synthetic APIs. And we do so in close collaboration with our internal research, pilot facilities and manufacturing units, and external Contract Manufacturing Organizations (CMOs). Here, you will have the opportunity to work in an open and dynamic working environment, where professionalism is highly valued. The department consists of 90+ employees divided into in total 8 teams.

Working in Novo Nordisk 
At Novo Nordisk, we don’t wait for change. We drive it. We’re a dynamic company in an even more dynamic industry, and we know that what got us to where we are today is not necessarily what will make us successful in the future. We embrace the spirit of experimentation, striving for excellence without fixating on perfection. We never shy away from opportunities to develop, we seize them. From research and development, through to manufacturing, marketing, and sales – we’re all working to move the needle on patient care. 

Contact
For further information, please contact hiring manager Markus Jondelius Hederos at +45 30751010.

Deadline
1st September 2024.

You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV. To ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your CV.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.
Show more

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
INSPIRE SUCCESSFUL DECISIONS




KAUZA & Kantar’s Worldpanel division are looking for an experienced and dynamic Senior Software Engineer to join our teams. Based in Copenhagen, Denmark – this is truly an incredible opportunity to be a part of our exciting vision for the future!




About us




Kauza ApS is a consulting company based in Copenhagen that provides fact-based advisory and shopper insights to players in the FMCG industry in the Nordic market. Kauza’s services are delivered in state-of-the-art dashboard solutions powered by cloud technology and machine learning, ensuring that they meet the clients’ key business questions with the right mix of data accessibility and data usability, making it possible to deliver shopper behavior and purchase data in rear real time.




Kantar is the world’s leading data, insights and consulting company. We understand more about how people think, feel, shop, share, vote and view than anyone else. Combining our expertise in human understanding with advanced technologies. Kantar’s 25,000 people based in more than 100 countries help the world’s leading organisations succeed and grow. Nobody knows people better than Kantar. We provide insight and inspiration to help our clients, our people and society to create and flourish in an extraordinary world.




Role’s mission




One of our most talented teams is revolutionising the way we work with shopper data, and we want you to be a part of what is promising to be a truly remarkable journey!




We are embarking on an exciting new challenge to significantly improve our analytical client driver offer through an innovative platform and this position will play a pivotal role in bringing this to market. Through an innovative tech stack that is promising to deliver NRT shopper data based on users’ digital receipts – which are collected through our consumer app (WhatIBuy) – KAUZA is aiming to mature its team and tech stack for a daring rollout in multiple new markets and landscapes in the coming years, and we need an experienced and creative Senior Software Engineer to join us and support the delivery of this innovative solution by implementing scalable data extractors and scale our solutions into a global scale.




This role focuses on working closely with our CTO and our Lead Software Engineer on primarily aiding UI/UX Developers and API Pentesters with source implementations and other pipeline areas to design, implement, and scale high-performance solutions. You will work with cutting-edge technology and large data sets to deliver state-of-the-art analytical solutions based on shoppers’ digital receipts. This position is crucial in ensuring our tools and APIs are robust, scalable, and efficient.




To do so, you will work with an international community of experts combining best-in-class data collection and preparation through top-end, efficient analytical thinking culminating with dynamic final client deliverables – helping them address their toughest marketing-related issues and identify strategic opportunities for their growth.




If you’re willing to go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion, and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in, apply for a career that’ll be out of the ordinary and join us!




*WhatIBuy is a cutting-edge TypeScript-based app hosted on Google Cloud Platform. Authenticated users contribute valuable data via APIs, processed by machine learning models for insightful classifications. Our mission is to transform brand-audience connections by building a community of panelists sharing opinions on products and services.




Key outcomes




Lead, mentor, and collaborate with UI/UX Developers, API Pentesters and other team members to implement data sources and other pipeline components.
Design and architect scalable solutions that integrate tools, APIs, data sources, and pipelines, ensuring performance and reliability.
Implement scalable and generic data extractors for public APIs, ensuring data flow supervision and validation.
Scale solutions to support global deployment, working with international teams to meet diverse market requirements.
Develop new analytical approaches and innovative ways to represent data insights to clients and users.
Provide expert advice internally to ensure approaches and outputs are innovative and best-in-class.




Key Capabilities

Your background will look like this…




University Degree (Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree) in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent fields.
Full Professional English Proficiency (C1 Level minimum required).
Minimum of 4 to 5 years of previous professional experience in Software Engineering preferably in back-end development and cloud infrastructure oriented roles.
Programming experience with (but not limited to) Typescript and/or Python.
Familiarity with SQL and RDBMS (BigQuery / PostgreSQL).
Considerable professional experience with Cloud Services platforms (Azure/AWS/GCP) and infrastructure.
Considerable experience with System Programming and Cloud Computing.
Familiarity with reverse engineering and vulnerability analysis.




With the following qualities…




Inquisitive, with critical thinking, and demonstrate genuine passion for consumer behaviour.
Enjoys actively looking for new and more efficient ways of improving processes, raising standards, reducing errors, and overcoming omissions.
Is proactive, optimistic, and willing to get involved to achieve the team's goals and objectives.
Is highly collaborative and adaptable with the ability to work effectively within different cultural and technical environments.
Possesses outstanding communication and interpersonal skills in order to comfortably build and connect with an online community.




The following, although not mandatory, will be appreciated…




High proficiency with network security and protocols (e.g., OAuth, token-based authentication).
Frontend/UI knowledge (using React/React Native).
Familiarity and interest in Machine Learning Engineering.
Full business Danish Proficiency (B2 Level minimum).




What our recruitment process looks like...




1st Stage – Virtual Screening Interview with Talent Acquisition.

2nd Stage – Onsite technical interview with CTO and our Lead Software Engineer.

3rd Stage – Onsite final interview with Senior Stakeholders.




Join us!




At Kantar, we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based on a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and to support a pay-for-performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.




We also make sure we create an equality of opportunity in a fair and encouraging working environment where people feel included, accepted and are allowed to thrive in a space where their mental health and well-being are taken into consideration.

Show more

One of our most talented teams is revolutionising the way we work with shopper data, and we want you to be a part of what is promising to be a truly remarkable journey!


We are embarking on an exciting new challenge to significantly improve our analytical client driver offer through an innovative platform and this position will play a pivotal role in bringing this to market. Through an innovative tech stack that is promising to deliver NRT shopper data based on users’ digital receipts – which are collected through our consumer app (WhatIBuy) – KAUZA is aiming to mature its team and tech stack for a daring rollout in multiple new markets and landscapes in the coming years, and we need an experienced and creative Senior Software Engineer to join us and support the delivery of this innovative solution by implementing scalable data extractors and scale our solutions into a global scale.


This role focuses on working closely with our CTO and our Lead Software Engineer on primarily aiding UI/UX Developers and API Pentesters with source implementations and other pipeline areas to design, implement, and scale high-performance solutions. You will work with cutting-edge technology and large data sets to deliver state-of-the-art analytical solutions based on shoppers’ digital receipts. This position is crucial in ensuring our tools and APIs are robust, scalable, and efficient.


To do so, you will work with an international community of experts combining best-in-class data collection and preparation through top-end, efficient analytical thinking culminating with dynamic final client deliverables – helping them address their toughest marketing-related issues and identify strategic opportunities for their growth.


If you’re willing to go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion, and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in, apply for a career that’ll be out of the ordinary and join us!


*WhatIBuy is a cutting-edge TypeScript-based app hosted on Google Cloud Platform. Authenticated users contribute valuable data via APIs, processed by machine learning models for insightful classifications. Our mission is to transform brand-audience connections by building a community of panelists sharing opinions on products and services.


Key outcomes


  • Lead, mentor, and collaborate with UI/UX Developers, API Pentesters and other team members to implement data sources and other pipeline components.
  • Design and architect scalable solutions that integrate tools, APIs, data sources, and pipelines, ensuring performance and reliability.
  • Implement scalable and generic data extractors for public APIs, ensuring data flow supervision and validation.
  • Scale solutions to support global deployment, working with international teams to meet diverse market requirements.
  • Develop new analytical approaches and innovative ways to represent data insights to clients and users.
  • Provide expert advice internally to ensure approaches and outputs are innovative and best-in-class.


Key Capabilities

Your background will look like this…


  • University Degree (Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree) in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent fields.
  • Full Professional English Proficiency (C1 Level minimum required).
  • Minimum of 4 to 5 years of previous professional experience in Software Engineering preferably in back-end development and cloud infrastructure oriented roles.
  • Programming experience with (but not limited to) Typescript and/or Python.
  • Familiarity with SQL and RDBMS (BigQuery / PostgreSQL).
  • Considerable professional experience with Cloud Services platforms (Azure/AWS/GCP) and infrastructure.
  • Considerable experience with System Programming and Cloud Computing.
  • Familiarity with reverse engineering and vulnerability analysis.


With the following qualities…


  • Inquisitive, with critical thinking, and demonstrate genuine passion for consumer behaviour.
  • Enjoys actively looking for new and more efficient ways of improving processes, raising standards, reducing errors, and overcoming omissions.
  • Is proactive, optimistic, and willing to get involved to achieve the team's goals and objectives.
  • Is highly collaborative and adaptable with the ability to work effectively within different cultural and technical environments.
  • Possesses outstanding communication and interpersonal skills in order to comfortably build and connect with an online community.


The following, although not mandatory, will be appreciated…


  • High proficiency with network security and protocols (e.g., OAuth, token-based authentication).
  • Frontend/UI knowledge (using React/React Native).
  • Familiarity and interest in Machine Learning Engineering.
  • Full business Danish Proficiency (B2 Level minimum).


What our recruitment process looks like...


1st Stage – Virtual Screening Interview with Talent Acquisition.

2nd Stage – Onsite technical interview with CTO and our Lead Software Engineer.

3rd Stage – Onsite final interview with Senior Stakeholders.


Join us!


At Kantar, we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based on a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and to support a pay-for-performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.


We also make sure we create an equality of opportunity in a fair and encouraging working environment where people feel included, accepted and are allowed to thrive in a space where their mental health and well-being are taken into consideration.

Title: Growth Engineer
Description:
Join the Tonsser Team as a Growth Engineer (Ruby on Rails)




Location: Copenhagen or Remote (within 2 hour time zone of Copenhagen)




Who We Are

Tonsser, the leading app and platform for youth football, is revolutionizing the football industry. With nearly 2 million football players in 11 countries, we're not just about discovering new talent; we're about building a community that celebrates the joy of football. Our mission? To democratize football by providing equal access to opportunities, empowering players to showcase their skills and connect with global clubs.




Your Role

As a Growth Engineer at Tonsser, you'll be a vital part of our growth team, and we expect a growth mindset and experience with social+ platforms. The growth team is a special part of the company focussed on analysing, developing, testing, validating and experimenting with smaller fast paced growth projects.




You will be working on a number of different projects, prototyping, validating and refining the ideas from yourself and the team, supporting our fast-growing football platform.




Key responsibilities

- Brainstorm, Develop, and rigorously test hypotheses to uncover new growth levers that can be scaled.

- Dive deep into user behavior analytics to pinpoint growth opportunities

- Conduct A/B testing and other experimental initiatives.

- Foster cross-functional collaboration to achieve key business objectives effectively




Qualifications

- Growth hacker mindset

- Innovative and creative thinker with a hypothesis-driven approach to problem-solving

- Strong analytical skills and comfort with data-driven decision-making 

- Comfortable with analytics tools and the ability to analyze user and acquisition data

- Strong in Ruby on Rails and partly some frontend and SQL

- Strong attention to detail and ability to balance multiple projects and deadlines

- Thrives in a fast-paced environment

- Curious by nature and a fast learner




What We Expect

We are looking for someone who is versatile, able to prototype, ideate, build and understand the underlying data, or even ensuring the data exists in the first place.

You should be a team player, ready to share ideas and respect diverse opinions. Your problem-solving skills should lead you to find the best solution for the moment. Your experience is broad, and covers Python, Ruby on Rails, Data scraping manipulation, maybe even some SEO. Keywords being broad, versatile and having a curious mindset.




We love to know that you did your homework, and read the entire listing before applying, so please include this in your application: Growth is great!




Our Engineering Culture

As part of Tonsser’s growth team, you'll join a group of passionate product enthusiasts. We are creative product builders who love to craft high-quality software using the best tools of the trade. Our environment is one that encourages innovation, creativity, and growth.




Position Details

Role: Growth Engineer (Ruby on Rails)

Start date: September 2024




About Tonsser

Offices in Paris, Berlin and HQ in Copenhagen

Backed by international investors, top level football players and founders of companies like Spotify, Booking.com, Peakon, Vivino ...




Being part of Tonsser means you're working on something very exciting: Shaping the future of football. Through technology we've seen a way to impact how new talents can be empowered and discovered; we're changing the game of football by placing the power where it belongs: in the hands of the 265 million performers of the sport. For the football players to be in control, they need their own football identity.




That's why we've built an app empowering football players to showcase their achievements and determine their success.




Curious to know more about us?

- Tonsser on LinkedIn 

- BBC: 'Meet the Underdog national team'

- Uncovering hidden football talent through social scouting app

- How a football app used data to challenge the best academies in Europe (Tonsser Medium blog)

- Huddersfield Town: Could e-scouting help Premier League side? (BBC)

- Tonsser, the social app for youth soccer players, collaborates with Nike and raises new funding (TechCrunch)

- Don't just take our word for it, check out our Glassdoor reviews

- Tonsser represents Denmark in the Nordic showcase as 'The next generation of superstars'




Download the app for iOS or Android.

Title: iOS Developer
Place: Odense Kommune, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you an experienced IOS developer who enjoys working in a team with other experienced developers? Are you interested in developing new features for a best-selling app? Then you might just be the next person to join the IOS team at Foreflight!




About the role

As an IOS developer at Foreflight, you will join one of two Danish IOS teams. The team is responsible for the business aviation segment and they work on building new features as well as maintaining legacy code.

Your tech stack will include Swift, Objective-C and Xcode.




Your responsibilities

As part of the IOS team, you will be working on the Foreflight app, which provides pilots from all over the world the capabilities to plan their flights with all the information they need.




Typical tasks and responsibilities include:

Software development of the Foreflight app
Maintenance and optimization of existing features
Collaboration with colleagues from other departments




Who are you?

In order to succeed in this role, you should be able to recognize yourself in at least some of the following:

Educational background within the software field, e.g. software engineering, informatics, computer science or similar
Experience with developing apps for IOS (Swift & Xcode)
Experience with maintaining legacy code (Objective-C)
You have a drive to make things happen, and you know when it is time to execute rather than plan
Used to working with others, and see the value in sparring and information sharing




Why should you apply?

ForeFlight offers all employees a rewarding career. You need challenging projects, a good work environment, and awesome coworkers. They believe in their employees, who are empowered to make a direct impact on products and services messaging. They strive to provide ForeFlighters and their loved ones with an excellent experience, focused on supporting their physical, financial, and emotional wellbeing, and offers a range of benefits, insurance as well as excellent offices, lunch and pilot training.




About Foreflight

ForeFlight produces the best-selling iPad and iPhone app for pilots flying personal and business aircraft, corporate flight departments, and aircraft operators. Customers include pilots, flight planners and dispatchers worldwide, Fortune 500 corporate flight departments, state and federal agencies, leading operators, the military, and leading aircraft OEMs.




Dispatch is the centerpiece of ForeFlights next-generation integrated product suite for Business Aviation, connecting scheduling, flight planning, and trip support functions via streamlined integrations, supporting all manners of flight planning with an approachable interface, and fostering frictionless communication and collaboration between flight planners and pilots.




Apply

You apply for the position by clicking the 'apply' button. If you have any questions, you are always welcome to reach out. Give us a call, and we can have a chat. Contact consultant Julius Hauge at phone number +45 48 80 34 50. Randstad manages the recruitment process on behalf of Foreflight. All applications are treated confidentially, and interviews are conducted on an ongoing basis.




About Randstad

Randstad is the world’s largest talent company and a partner of choice to clients. As a Partner for Talent, we are committed to providing equitable opportunities to people from all backgrounds and helping them remain relevant in the rapidly changing world of work.




We have a deep understanding of the labour market and help our clients to create the high-quality, diverse and agile workforces they need to succeed. We support people to realise their true potential throughout their entire working life. This is what we do and what motivates us every day.




Randstad DK is part of the international Randstad Group. Every day, we help more than 600,000 people around the world find jobs. We specialise in finding, attracting, and retaining skilled talent to power businesses at speed and at scale. Randstad DK is a leader in this field, with offices in Copenhagen, Aarhus, Aalborg, and Kolding.

Title: Application Software Developer, Medical Imaging
Place: Herlev, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Copenhagen Imaging, we are at the forefront of innovation within dental radiology with our X1 CBCT (Cone Beam Computed Tomography) scanner. To advance our technology, we are expanding our team with talented software developers who will enhance both current and future products.

Spun out from the most successful Danish start-up company in recent years, we are a small team dedicated to bringing CBCT scanning to the next level by enabling true motion correction and high fidelity scanning to clinics across the world. To do this, we expect to grow our team substantially in the coming years. As we expand, we offer exciting opportunities for career development and influence in a growing team.

Innovation is in our DNA. We are energized by making a positive ‘human’ impact in the work we do. Teamwork is king, and we pride ourselves on providing an opportunity for the industry’s best talent to spar, collaborate and learn from each other along the way. We do not know everything, but we are fast learners.

As a Software Developer at Copenhagen Imaging, you will be part of an agile team and will play a key role in developing our medical device application software that handles the following functions:


Scanner software user interface and workflows.
2D and 3D image processing.
Surface and volume visualization.
Patient data handling.


Your primary responsibility will be development of our User Interface (UI) for existing and new features, delivering a seamless and intuitive experience for end-users.

Key Responsibilities


UI Development: Design and implement new UI components using C# and WPF, adhering to the MVVM architecture.
3D Integration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop new tools and algorithms to interact with 3D data utilizing our internal framework for advanced graphics.
Testing: Contribute to the development and refinement of our testing processes - including automated testing - and participate in manual testing as needed to ensure quality and compliance of our software.
Code Quality: Participate in code reviews and contribute to coding standards and best practices within the team to maintain the integrity of a large code base.
Versatility: Explore new areas ripe for innovation and optimization, contributing to the overall enhancement of our software and development processes, depending on your expertise and interests.


As we are looking into a growth phase, the position may well evolve according to the wishes and ambitions of the successful candidate.

Your Profile

The ideal candidate will possess the following qualifications:


M.Sc. degree or higher in computer science or similar.
More than 5 years of professional software development.
Proficiency in C# and WPF within the .NET ecosystem, with a strong focus on UI development using the MVVM design pattern.
Experience with 3D graphics development, with an understanding of computer graphics principles.
Experience working with large, complex codebases and a commitment to writing well-tested, reliable code.
Excellent communication and documentation skills -- English at business level, and generally comfortable in an international atmosphere.
Some familiarity with medical device development standards, such as ISO 13485/14971 and 62304, ensuring high-quality and compliant software.


Most importantly, you are passionate about providing high-quality and innovative solutions, and enthusiastic about the possibility of working with skilled colleagues across the organization to influence the future of dental imaging.

To put it simply, we will prioritize energy, can-do attitude, and motivation over the number of years you have been in business.

We offer


Professional challenges in a small, dynamic, and globally oriented business environment.
Opportunities to work with experienced and skilled colleagues.
The chance to influence the next generation of 3D dental X-ray scanner solutions and shape the future of a startup company.
An open, honest, and constructive work environment.
A compensation package that matches your skills and commitment.


Apply

If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply by sending us your motivational cover letter and resume. We encourage you to apply today, as interviews will be conducted on a rolling basis.
Show more

Apply

If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply by sending us your motivational cover letter and resume. We encourage you to apply today, as interviews will be conducted on a rolling basis.

Title: Research Scientist, Molecular Biology (1-year maternity cover)
Place: Måløv, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you have the experience to optimize wet lab-based processes? Do you possess a high-throughput mindset for data gathering? Do you want to join us as maternity cover in building robots of the future while having the opportunity to grow as we grow too?

We're looking for a hands-on Scientist to join our team and help optimize research processes. If this sounds exciting, then this could be the right opportunity for you.

Apply today for a life-changing career!

The position
As a Scientist, you will be part of a team that builds automation machinery for the research laboratories of the future. We apply AI, machine vision, voice control, and advanced robotics to build automation solutions for our colleagues in the rest of Novo Nordisk Research and Early Development. You will be the developer and test driver of these novel solutions.

Key responsibilities:



Collaborate with lab automation specialists within our department to automate processes from R&ED collaborators in Novo Nordisk.
Modernize existing protocols with the latest methods and techniques.
Perform and optimize molecular biology, cloning, cell culture, biological assays or biophysics experiments by carrying out experiments - this is not a desk job.
Run experiments to generate high-quality data sets.




This is a 1-year maternity cover position.

Qualifications

To succeed in this role, you should have:



MSc or a PhD degree in a scientific discipline such as Biology, Biochemistry or similar with experience in wet lab work.
Prior experience in laboratory work in pharma-related fields is necessary. You enjoy working actively in the labs and are passionate about delivering high-quality data from laboratory processes.




As a person, you have:



A creative and innovative mindset with a track record of building solutions and fast proof of concepts to solve problems.
A high throughput, fast-paced attitude - driven to get the job done.
Willingness to learn about automated experimentation (prior experience is not required).




About The Department

You'll be joining our Digital Science & Innovation team, which supports the digital journey across all our therapy areas in Research & Early Development (R&ED). We work in multidisciplinary teams and collaborate with all areas across R&ED to leverage scientific knowledge, partner with our IT organization to ensure access to the most advanced technology platforms and tools and engage in drug development projects across the value chain. We're focused on developing and retaining top talent.

Working at Novo Nordisk
At Novo Nordisk, we do not wait for change. We drive it. We are a dynamic company in an even more dynamic industry, and we know that what got us to where we are today is not necessarily what will make us successful in the future. We embrace the spirit of experimentation, striving for excellence without fixating on perfection. We never shy away from opportunities to develop, we seize them. From research and development, through to manufacturing, marketing, and sales – we are all working to move the needle on patient care.

Contact
Thank you for your interest in working with us! For further information, please contact Fredrik Kryh Öberg, Director of Automation, at +45 3079 2226.

Deadline
8 September 2024.

Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible. You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV. To ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo to your CV.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.
Show more

  • Prior experience in laboratory work in pharma-related fields is necessary. You enjoy working actively in the labs and are passionate about delivering high-quality data from laboratory processes.



As a person, you have:


  • A creative and innovative mindset with a track record of building solutions and fast proof of concepts to solve problems.
  • A high throughput, fast-paced attitude - driven to get the job done.
  • Willingness to learn about automated experimentation (prior experience is not required).



About The Department

You'll be joining our Digital Science & Innovation team, which supports the digital journey across all our therapy areas in Research & Early Development (R&ED). We work in multidisciplinary teams and collaborate with all areas across R&ED to leverage scientific knowledge, partner with our IT organization to ensure access to the most advanced technology platforms and tools and engage in drug development projects across the value chain. We're focused on developing and retaining top talent.

Working at Novo Nordisk
At Novo Nordisk, we do not wait for change. We drive it. We are a dynamic company in an even more dynamic industry, and we know that what got us to where we are today is not necessarily what will make us successful in the future. We embrace the spirit of experimentation, striving for excellence without fixating on perfection. We never shy away from opportunities to develop, we seize them. From research and development, through to manufacturing, marketing, and sales – we are all working to move the needle on patient care.

Contact
Thank you for your interest in working with us! For further information, please contact Fredrik Kryh Öberg, Director of Automation, at +45 3079 2226.

Deadline
8 September 2024.

Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible. You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV. To ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo to your CV.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.

Title: Experienced Martech Developer
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
📢 Join Our Data Consultancy Team! 📢




Are you an experienced and passionate Martech Developer looking for your next challenge? Pyne is seeking a MarTech Analytics Engineer to join our innovative and growing team. At Pyne, you'll have the opportunity to make a significant impact while working in a fast-paced and forward-thinking environment.




Who are we?

We specialize in delivering actionable insights and strategic guidance to businesses. Our mission? To empower companies with data-driven solutions that drive informed decisions and growth.




Responsibilities:

Implement and optimize MarTech stacks including tracking plans and attribution models.
Develop and maintain data pipelines and support data warehousing efforts to make the MarTech stack fit into the overall data strategy of a company.
Collaborate with clients to understand their marketing technology needs and provide strategic recommendations.
Lead and manage client projects, ensuring timely and accurate delivery of data-driven solutions.
Mentor and guide team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement.




Requirements:

Extensive experience with marketing technology like CDPs, Analytics, and Engagement tools (e.g. GA4, Mixpanel, One Signal, Braze, Segment, AB Tasty).
Knowledge of tracking plans and attribution modeling, GDPR, and cookie compliance.
Proficiency in SQL and understanding of data warehousing concepts (data visualization experience is a plus).
Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to manage multiple projects and deliver results in a fast-paced environment.
Masters degree within a related field.

If you don't meet every single requirement but are excited about this role, we encourage you to apply. We value a diverse range of experiences and are committed to helping our team members grow and develop their skills.




What we offer:

Competitive salary, reflecting your skills and experience level.
Flexible work arrangements, including remote work options.
Extra perks such as team trips abroad and events to foster a fun and engaging work environment.
Work from our office in SOHO Kødbyen, a dynamic office environment with lunch, snacks of your choice, protein bars, and coffee on Pyne.
Opportunity to work closely with a talented and diverse team of data professionals.
Exciting challenges and opportunities to grow together with this young company.
A supportive and inclusive company culture that values diversity and encourages continuous professional development.

Ready to take your marketing technology expertise to the next level? Join us in shaping the future of data consultancy! Send your resume and a brief cover letter highlighting your passion for data and relevant experiences to michael@pyne.dk. We can't wait to hear from you!

Learn more about us at https://pyne.dk.
