Title: Software Engineer
Description:
About the Role

You will be part of a team developing in-house financial, where you will:

Implement, verify and optimize financial algorithms
Create infrastructure to support analysis of new algorithms and execution of the existing ones
Improve automated monitoring of the algorithms




About the Team

You will be working in a team of 10 backend developers.

We enjoy collaboration and are always willing to lend a helping hand. We are working alongside two other teams of quantitative analysts and economists that conceive the mathematical models.




What makes this constellation work great is that all of the individual team members write code and understand that a seemingly trivial change can actually require a lot of work, and vice versa.




About You

5+ years of experience with C#, .NET or other backend languages.
Working knowledge of SQL
A good understanding of algorithms and data structures
A scientific and inquisitive mind




Nice to have

Experience working with low latency systems
Proficiency in languages like C, C++, Python or Matlab
Knowledge of SQL Server tuning and administration
Ph.d or M.Sc in Computer Science or equivalent




What we can Offer You

Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy
Collaborative team
Nice office in central Copenhagen
Pension, Health Insurance and 28 days of vacation

Title: Full Stack Engineer
Place: Høje-Taastrup Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
The Company

Are you passionate about starting or pursuing a career in the renewable energy industry, with a focus on embedded laser systems in a global context? Then embark on a transformative journey with us as we continue to reshape the wind energy landscape!




Windar Photonics is a globally recognized leader in LiDAR-based optimization solutions for the wind energy industry. Established in 2008 as a spin-off from DTU-Risø (Technical University of Denmark), we employ a diverse and dedicated team of 35 professionals across our offices in Denmark and China.




Our pioneering WindEYE and WindVISION LiDAR systems are used worldwide by leading wind turbine manufacturers and major wind-farm owners. These advanced optical units, utilizing light reflection and the Doppler effect principles, equip wind turbine controllers with precise wind measurements. This is all achieved in the demanding conditions at the top of the nacelle.




The Role

We are looking for a Full-Stack Engineer to help advance and scale our maiden software product, Windar Nexus. Windar Nexus is a comprehensive software suite designed for managing LiDAR fleets on customer premises, offering a wide range of features including data collection, processing, event reporting, continuous optimization, user interface management, administrative tools, and advanced analytics.




The main tasks will include:

Feature Development: Collaborate closely with our software and analytics teams to design and implement innovative functionalities.
Platform Enhancement: Continuously refine and upgrade our existing platform to keep it aligned with the latest technological advancements.
Architectural Design: Craft and improve the system architecture to guarantee scalability, reliability, and optimal performance.




Your Profile

The ideal candidate has most of the following experience:
Python Development: Strong understanding of core Python concepts, advanced programming techniques, and familiarity with Python libraries and frameworks like Django, REST API, and Celery.
Database Management: Proficiency in working with relational databases, including experience with database design, query optimization, and management of database systems.
Linux Proficiency: Strong knowledge of Linux environments, including Bash scripting, file permissions, and package management.
System Administration: Expertise in process management, systemd, cron jobs, log management, and performance monitoring.
Networking: Solid understanding of networking concepts, including firewall management, SSH, NGINX, DNS configuration, and VPN setup.
Version Control: Good understanding of version control systems like Git.




We are looking for hands-on, cross-discipline, team-player with:

An analytical mindset and good problem-solving skills,
Education in software engineering or similar,
An autonomous and proactive attitude,
Ambition to become part of a young, enthusiastic, international development team in an informal workplace
Excellent English communication skills (oral and written)




Want to apply?

Please send your CV and cover letter to the Head of Software Engineering, Devashish Bhageerutty at db@windarphotonics.com

Applications will be processed continuously so do not hesitate to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Title: Scientist - Histology & Image analysis
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Brief description of the open role:

We are seeking a highly motivated scientist with specialization in Histology and Image analysis, to join our team as a Research Scientist or Senior Scientist in our Preclinical Department. The Research Scientist / Senior Scientist in Histology & Image analysis will be involved in a broad range of activities within target mapping and validation. Primary responsibilities will include developing IHC assays and image analysis procedures, including digital H-scoring, as well as more complex tasks such as multiplexing or bioinformatics (depending on the candidate’s skills and experience). The ideal candidate is structured and can handle several tasks and stakeholders at a time. You must have a dedicated and persistent attitude with an aim to consistently deliver high-quality data.




Key Responsibilities:

Development of IHC/ISH assays for target mapping and characterization, including hands-on work in the lab.
Development of image analysis for histological stainings including digital H-scoring using QuPath or other similar software.
Work in close collaboration with histology technician and scientist to ensure a good workflow.
Author histology reports and support writing of related sections of regulatory documents (e.g. IND).




Candidate Profile/Qualifications:

Life science background at minimum Master level (PhD preferred) and 2-5 years of experience specifically with histology and image analysis, preferably in an industrial environment (Biotech/Pharma/CRO).
Hands-on experience within immunohistochemistry and/or in situ hybridization including multiplexing.
Experience with image analysis and development of app/script for batch processing of digital slides.
Basic understanding of bioinformatic analysis and experience in mining public databases for comparative expression profiles of target candidates is an advantage.
Familiar with analysis of high-content microscopy images is a plus, but not a requirement.
Excellent written and spoken communication skills in English.
Self-motivated personality and ability to work independently while still being a team player.




How to apply:

If you thrive in an international environment and have experience in a similar role from either Pharma or Biotech, we encourage you to apply to join us at this exciting time for our company.




To apply, please send your CV that includes a short motivation for applying for the job to jobs@adcendo.com.




Please include the phrase “Job ID 2410 – Research Scientist / Senior Scientist, Histology & Image analysis” in the subject line.




Questions about the position can be directed to the same e-mail.




We will conduct interviews continuously, and we aim to fill the position as soon as possible.










About Adcendo:

Adcendo ApS is an international biotech company based in Copenhagen dedicated to developing highly differentiated antibody-drug conjugates (ADCs) for the treatment of underserved cancers. With substantial investments fueling our journey, we've assembled a world-class team, and we are poised to transition into a clinical-stage biotech, advancing a robust pipeline of ADC candidates. Our dedicated team of skilled scientists and professionals are headquartered at Symbion Frederiksberg, Copenhagen, Denmark. Learn more at www.adcendo.com.




Join us in shaping the future of Adcendo and transforming the landscape of cancer treatment!

Title: Full Stack Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
TypeScript Engineer – Copenhagen – 50,000 – 60,000 DKK per month




We’ve partnered with a truly exciting tech business in Copenhagen, as they look to grow their software engineering team by another 25% this year!




The company definitely fall under the ‘tech for good’ umbrella – as they help businesses and consumers to make the transition into using electric vehicles. Because of the complexity of their industry, they have a variety of products on offer to their users.




They currently have a headcount of approximately 120 – with 45 of those being in the technology team! The goal this year is to increase the team by another 8-10 people, following the successful launch of a new platform.




You’ll be working on a hybrid model in their stylish Copenhagen HQ. Most of the team do three days per week in the office, but you can do anywhere between 2-5 depending on what works best for you!




The role




Due to the amount of greenfield work & new feature development that will be happening this year, the business are looking a Full Stack Engineer! Their stack is TypeScript throughout so you will be utilizing the likes of Node, Nest.js, React, AWS and maybe even some React Native along the way!




You do not need to have experience in all of the above to be considered, so long as you have a strong background in TypeScript development.




The team you will be joining handles some of the most complex parts of the business’ technology, so you’ll need to be comfortable handling large-scale systems and taking ownership of features end to end when needed.




The process

Introductory call with Talent team
Call with hiring manager
Short coding challenge & meeting to review
In-person meeting to chat with the Founder & members of your new team.




On offer is up to 60,000 DKK per month plus incredibly strong pension, discretionary bonus, private healthcare and over 30 days of vacation per year!




Would you be interested in discussing this role with me?

Title: Staff R&D ML/AI Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description And Requirements

Staff R&D ML/AI Engineer

Develop an ML framework to assist customers in semiconductor process integration and optimization. Joining a dynamic international team you will contribute to the development and deployment of ML solutions for silicon manufacturing.

Physics aware ML models are created using large volumes of measurement data augmented by Technology-CAD (TCAD) simulations.

Duties Include


Analyze and understand the ML solution that works better for a specific application
Integrate the ML solution in the ML framework
Contribute to extend the ML framework and integrate it with TCAD tools
Support AEs to solve the problems that customers report
Contribute to collaborative projects with customers and other partners based on business needs
Develop reusable and testable software components for use in a large existing code base, optimize existing components.


Qualifications


MS or PhD in Computer Science, Software Engineering or equivalent.
Strong understanding and expertise in ML/AI.
3+ years of hands-on experience in software development.
Solid programming skills in python. C++ is a plus.
Familiarity with Keras/TensorFlow is a plus.
Familiarity with training and operating streaming ML models is required.
Knowledge of semiconductor manufacturing process is a plus.
Strong desire to learn and explore new technologies.
English language working proficiency and communication skills allowing teamwork in an international environment.
Willingness to work in a distributed international team.


We offer a strong salary including a competitive benefits scheme.

Our Silicon Design & Verification business is all about building high-performance semiconductor chips— faster. We’re the world’s leading provider of solutions for designing and verifying advanced semiconductor chips. And we design the next-generation processes and models needed to manufacture those chips. We enable our customers to optimize chips for power, cost, and performance—eliminating months off their project schedules. At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

Job Category

Engineering

Country

Denmark

Job Subcategory

R&D Engineering

Hire Type

Employee

Title: Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about data engineering and do you want to be a part of data driven growth at the world’s largest jewelry brand?

@Pandora we are growing our Data & Analytics footprint. As our new data engineer you will collaborate with product owners, architects and other key profiles across the global organisation. You will help business verticals and clusters maximising the value of our data and drive business change as an impact of this.

As a Data Engineer within our Data & Analytics – Marketing Analytics Engineering team, you will play a critical role in developing and maintaining robust data pipelines in both Azure Synapse and Databricks. Joining our team, you will contribute to building a solid foundation for our data infrastructure, supporting our marketing analytics organization's goal of becoming more data-driven and customer-centric. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, helping to drive impactful data product deliveries and optimizing our analytical framework for scalable insights globally.

Your key accountabilities will be to: 


Develop and maintain data integration pipelines in Databricks and Azure Synapse Analytics
Communicate with stakeholders and users of our data products by understanding their problems and supporting them in their needs
Improve existing data integration processes to provide better reliability and robustness



What is needed to succeed: 


Problem-solving team player with an analytical mind
Strong knowledge of SQL and Spark SQL
Understanding of dimensional data modelling concepts
Experience with Azure Synapse Analytics
Understanding of streaming data ingestion processes
Ability to develop / manage Apache Spark data processing applications using PySpark on Databricks
Experience with version control (e.g. Git), DevOps and CI/CD
Experience with Python
Experience with Microsoft data platform, Microsoft Azure stack and Databricks
Experience in marketing is a plus.



Did we get your attention?

We hope you got all your questions answered and feel confident applying for this position, however if you have more questions regarding the position, please contact:

Joe McBrien, TA Specialist, Global Office  @jomcb@pandora.net

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake:

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Established in 1982, Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished jewellery made from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora’s products are available in more than 100 countries on six continents through more than 6,500 points of sale, including around 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 32,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery at two LEED certified facilities in Thailand, using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023. 

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.
Show more
HTML:
Are you passionate about data engineering and do you want to be a part of data driven growth at the world’s largest jewelry brand?

@Pandora we are growing our Data & Analytics footprint. As our new data engineer you will collaborate with product owners, architects and other key profiles across the global organisation. You will help business verticals and clusters maximising the value of our data and drive business change as an impact of this.

As a Data Engineer within our Data & Analytics – Marketing Analytics Engineering team, you will play a critical role in developing and maintaining robust data pipelines in both Azure Synapse and Databricks. Joining our team, you will contribute to building a solid foundation for our data infrastructure, supporting our marketing analytics organization's goal of becoming more data-driven and customer-centric. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, helping to drive impactful data product deliveries and optimizing our analytical framework for scalable insights globally.

Your key accountabilities will be to: 

  • Develop and maintain data integration pipelines in Databricks and Azure Synapse Analytics
  • Communicate with stakeholders and users of our data products by understanding their problems and supporting them in their needs
  • Improve existing data integration processes to provide better reliability and robustness


What is needed to succeed: 

  • Problem-solving team player with an analytical mind
  • Strong knowledge of SQL and Spark SQL
  • Understanding of dimensional data modelling concepts
  • Experience with Azure Synapse Analytics
  • Understanding of streaming data ingestion processes
  • Ability to develop / manage Apache Spark data processing applications using PySpark on Databricks
  • Experience with version control (e.g. Git), DevOps and CI/CD
  • Experience with Python
  • Experience with Microsoft data platform, Microsoft Azure stack and Databricks
  • Experience in marketing is a plus.


Did we get your attention?

We hope you got all your questions answered and feel confident applying for this position, however if you have more questions regarding the position, please contact:

Joe McBrien, TA Specialist, Global Office  @jomcb@pandora.net

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake:

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023.

We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.

Title: Quantative Developer Internship
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for:

A Junior Analyst who is quantitatively driven and has an interest to work with NFTs. You may have already explored NFT trading either personally or professionally and have an interest in working with large data sets. In this role you will collaborate with like-minded people to develop solutions for our trading activities.

You may be a dynamic analyst who is quantitatively driven and has an interest in track record in programming; DeFi, and data science are subjects you already have explored. In your role, you will collaborate with like-minded people to develop solutions for our trading activities.

Job Description

This role will be focusing on the liquidity provision of NFT ecosystems. You will have a heavy emphasis on data analytical modelling and potentially financial strategies. The role will be also be supporting our existing trading teams working in our NFT Business Unit.

Skills Needed


Understanding of how to pull data from the blockchain
Knows how to read and present data or parse it to create models
An interest or experience in financial strategies, e.g. arbitrage (not essential)
Knowledge of SQL
A degree of technical aptitude with programming skills across any software languages for example: Python/C++/C/Rust or Java (not essential)
Any exposure into trading NFT’s would be highly advantageous
Exposure to DeFi ecosystems would be highly advantageous


Interview process:

1st Stage is a short technical interview with the Hiring Manager

2nd stage: Tech Challenge

3rd Stage: Tech Challenge Debrief

4th Stage: Final meeting with the wider team

Offer

Our recruitment philosophy

We believe the most important aspect of our recruitment process is self-awareness: we are looking for people who have a clear understanding of themselves and what they are looking for in their professional career. That means that we expect to work with people who not only have the right skills, but who have also made the conscious decision to look for a company in our industry and with our characteristics and are willing to ask questions and learn in a context that may not be familiar to them.

Our offer


A 6 month paid internship at Belgians leading digital assets company
The standard type of contract used in Belgium for professional internships is a so-called convention d'immersion professionnelle, with a fixed salary of ~1k EUR
The opportunity to learn about digital assets and blockchain from a 30,000 ft view of the entire ecosystem
Working from one of Brussels newest, nicest and most advanced office spaces


We have a strong preference for the internship to take place on-site in Belgium. In rare cases, for candidates based outside of Belgium, an alternative type of contract can be considered.

Keyrock offers you both a career and a large range of benefits that we will gladly discuss in the course of the application process.

As an employer we are committed to build an inclusive, diverse and non-discriminating work environment. We welcome employees of all backgrounds, ethnicities, genders, creed and sexual orientation. We hire, reward and promote entirely based on merit and performance.


Show more

Title: Python Software Engineer (Data Science Team)
Description:
This role can be full-remote from within the EU.

We are a remote-first, international SaaS company dedicated to helping businesses find and target the right accounts primed for conversion. By merging Leadfeeder and Echobot, we've brought together two leading companies to create a powerful sales intelligence and web visitor identification platform that gives sales and marketing teams the real time data, insights, and tools they need to win more deals.

What makes us unique? Originating in Finland and Germany, the country with the highest privacy standards in Europe, Dealfront is built on a foundation of compliance and transparency. Our platform ensures users know exactly where the data comes from, maintaining integrity while enhancing profitability.

Join our diverse and dynamic team of over 270 Dealfronters spread across 40 countries. Together, let's redefine success for B2B companies across Europe and beyond. Join us and be a part of our journey to transform the way businesses win more deals!

Position Overview

We are looking for an experienced Python Software Engineer to join the Data Science team. In this role, you help to bridge the gap between data science models and production environments while ensuring reliability, performance, and scalability of our solutions.

Being part of the Data Science team, you play an active role in shaping, discussing, learning and experiencing developments in an exciting field, while you always advocate software quality. You become part of a nice, motivated and skilled team in which everyone pulls together.

What You'll Work On


Design and implementation of efficient processing pipelines, mainly in Python
Implement model APIs and integrate models into existing software systems
Support the translation of data science models from prototypes to production-ready code
Ensure robust CI/CD pipelines for smooth deployment and version control
Collaborate with data scientists to design software solutions that align with data science workflows
Implement data quality controls, logging, and monitoring systems
Document code, processes, and best practices for maintainability
Share insights and mentor other team members on software engineering principles



Requirements


At least 3 years of software development experience, mostly in Python
Interest in working with data-centric applications
Good understanding of GIT workflows, CI/CD + working with Unit Tests
Solid experience in interacting with technologies such as SQL (especially PostgreSQL), Kafka, Redis, Solr/Opensearch
Ability to help and improve the work of your colleagues through your teamwork and communication skills
Desired: Experience with a K8s environment and Docker
Be physically located within European timezones



Benefits


In this role, your contributions will directly influence the future direction and success of our products, shaping their growth and ensuring they meet the evolving needs of our customers
The chance to work with a very knowledgeable, high-achieving and fun team
An international, diverse, dynamic and committed work environment
The opportunity to work remotely, with a flexible work schedule
Mental Health support with Auntie
Annual company retreats in sunny locations and team off-sites :)


We encourage all interested candidates to apply, even if you don't meet all of the criteria listed.

We value diversity and inclusion in our workplace and welcome applications from candidates across all backgrounds and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability or any other protected characteristics.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our highly-skilled development team in Copenhagen is seeking a versatile Senior Data Scientist with a passion for formalism, heuristics and algorithms as well as an understanding of software engineering. As a Senior Data Scientist, you will be a key player in a challenging and dynamic developmental story. We are passionate about new solutions, technologies and algorithms, but pragmatic in our choice of solutions. LiveIntent Copenhagen is responsible for the development and deployment of the company's next generation technology in close collaboration with the company's other departments in New York and Berlin.

Our team in Copenhagen consists of a couple of hand picked veterans from the start-up environment as well as 30 handpicked highly competent and focused colleagues who have joined since the end of 2016. Both the level of competence and focus is therefore very high and for that reason, many exciting tasks are constantly flowing from the rest of the organization to Copenhagen. We want to expand the team with more skilled and innovative talents and we are looking for both Data Scientists and Data Engineers, but prefer people with an interest in both areas of work.

About The Job

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist for LiveIntent Copenhagen, who can analyze issues based on data, and design, develop and maintain algorithms, reports and software solutions for LiveIntent. This person will largely be able to plan, choose and organize their own tasks, but will also be expected to work closely with the other team developers and stakeholders in the company's international product division. The Senior Data Scientist will be part of all stages of development, from initial sparring and exchange of ideas to prototyping, development, testing, deployment, maintenance / improvement and reporting, but with the expected focus on the first three parts. We believe in flexibility under responsibility, and our development process is therefore a loosely defined hybrid of agile methods and rapid prototyping. Our Ideal Candidate:


Has experience with data analysis and software development from other positions.
Is interested in translating real world issues into mathematical models, mathematical statistics and algorithms.
Ideally also has an interest in programming (in several languages), in machine learning and / or adtech technology.
Has one of the heavier mathematical educations such as computer science, mathematics or physics.
Has several years of practical experience with real programming, practical and / or deep theoretical understanding of some of the following: Classical statistics (hypothesis tests, confidence intervals), Data mining, ETL processing, machine Learning, Probabilistic graphical models (eg Markov logic networks or Bayesian networks), Data Processing in MapReduce using Hadoop / Cascading / Scalding, Programming in Scala, Python programming, Data reporting and ad hoc analysis in Athena, Google BigQuery or the "PyLab" suite.
Has experience mentoring and guiding other team members in a previous role.


Our ideal candidate attacks problems analytically and solutions pragmatically. This person is full of good ideas, able to see opportunities in other people's ideas, and can find out about ideas in a distanced and constructive way. They love thinking about many issues and connecting them with data. Our ideal Senior Data Scientist candidate understands that finding new facets of data is more important than adjusting meta parameters to algorithms. They are happy to implement and optimize and are curious about new tasks.

We're looking for someone who will be excited to understand and involve themselves in the company's problem areas and can communicate in English with management and colleagues at the other LiveIntent offices. This person will be immersed in a dynamic environment where overall priorities and definitions will change over time, and therefore tasks will not always be prioritized. This person will work independently and take initiative.

The Company

LiveIntent, one of the world’s largest people-based marketing platforms, connects 2,500 publishing and advertising brands with over 250 MM verified people every month across all types of media. With the anonymized email address at the center of its industry-leading identity graph, LiveIntent provides brands with solutions that help them monetize, acquire, and retain real people, even where cookies don’t work. LiveIntent enriches a brands’ data, making it possible for them to deepen their understanding of their audiences, and more effectively market to people wherever they are present and paying attention. LiveIntent is home to over 180 people worldwide with offices in New York, Chicago, Berlin, and Copenhagen.

LiveIntent Copenhagen started as a Danish startup company in 2013 and was acquired by LiveIntent in November 2015. We develop and operate both an online, real-time service that receives billions of requests from all over the world and from other LiveIntent components, and an offline, batch-oriented analytical data processing pipeline that prepares data for the online service by processing billions of data points.

We Offer

You can look forward to being a key player in a challenging and dynamic developmental story where you will be part of a team with some of the industry's hottest talents. There will be rich opportunities to both learn from and mentor others, and you will have the flexibility to dive into experiments on your own. We are passionate about new solutions, technologies and algorithms, but pragmatic in our choice of solutions.

We believe in freedom and flexibility under responsibility so that office hours can be adapted to your life as long as meetings are covered. If you need to work from home one day, it is completely fine, as long as you live up to what is expected. We are an international company, so while this position is located in our Copenagen office, there is frequent collaboration between the teams in Berlin and New York City.

Does that sound exciting? If so, send us an application! We are a small office with a social atmosphere so your personal profile is just as valuable to us as your technical skills. A cover letter will therefore be greatly appreciated.


Show more

Title: Research Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you ready for a new beginning?

We need your talent, knowledge and dedication to better our world with biology.

Our purpose points the way

In Novonesis, we know that solutions rooted in biology can help solve humanity’s biggest challenges. Since we began more than a century ago, this has been our guide. It’s how we've gotten so far. And it’s how we'll impact the future. Now, more than ever, the world needs change. And with biosolutions, the possibilities for transformation are endless.

We’re here to better our world with biology.

Join us as our new Molecular Discovery research scientist.

Molecular Discovery drives early innovation through natural and engineered enzyme and protein diversity. At our site in Lyngby we are organized into two wet labs, covering approximately 50 scientists and technicians, and are complemented by a bioinformatics and design department. As part of Molecular Discovery, you will play a central role in developing state-of-the-art enzyme/protein solutions in close collaboration with our industry partners across a broad range of applications. This includes contributions to sustainable practices such as low-temperature laundering, energy-efficient manufacturing, renewable energy sources, and enhancing the sensory experience of food products.

As Part Of This Role, We Offer


Exceptional opportunities for professional growth
A friendly, transparent and supportive work environment
A team-oriented structure that values empowerment and collaboration


Molecular Discovery is an integral part of the Enzyme, Protein & Strain Engineering Research area within R&D.

To Succeed In This Role, You Must


Possess a degree in biotechnology, molecular biology, biochemistry or related field (PhD or equivalent experience).
Exhibit proficiency in molecular biology & DNA modification; experience with enzyme and protein expression in Aspergillus/Bacillus systems is a plus.
Have a good enzyme-substrate understanding with the ability to apply this to select the right enzyme activity (protein) and develop assays for effective screening
Have experience with protein engineering and understanding of structure-function relationships.
Ideally have a keen interest in data analysis and programming (e.g. Python, Jupiter notebooks etc.).
Embody the spirit of a team player, committed to continuous learning and leading initiatives that drive team success.
Thrive in a multi-cultural environment, communicating effectively in English to unite diverse perspectives.


Application deadline: August 26th 2024

Contact details: Senior Department Manager Lars Giger (lgi@novonesis.com) or Senior Department Manager Katrine Pontoppidan (kpon@novonesis.com)

Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

At Novonesis we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. We recommend you not to attach a cover letter to your application. Instead, please include a few sentences in your resume/CV about why you are applying. To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your resume/CV.

Novonesis is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, disability, or veteran status.

Want to learn more?

Learn more about Novonesis, our purpose, and your career opportunities at novonesis.com

Not the right fit for you?

Even if this job isn't the right fit for you, perhaps you know someone who might find it interesting. If so, please feel free to share the job link and encourage them to apply. Thank you for your referral! Please check out our other open positions. The right fit for you could just be a few clicks away.

Title: Research Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you ready for a new beginning?

We need your talent, knowledge and dedication to better our world with biology.

Our purpose points the way

In Novonesis, we know that solutions rooted in biology can help solve humanity’s biggest challenges. Since we began more than a century ago, this has been our guide. It’s how we've gotten so far. And it’s how we'll impact the future. Now, more than ever, the world needs change. And with biosolutions, the possibilities for transformation are endless.

We’re here to better our world with biology.

Join us as our new Molecular Discovery research scientist.

Molecular Discovery drives early innovation through natural and engineered enzyme and protein diversity. At our site in Lyngby we are organized into two wet labs, covering approximately 50 scientists and technicians, and are complemented by a bioinformatics and design department. As part of Molecular Discovery, you will play a central role in developing state-of-the-art enzyme/protein solutions in close collaboration with our industry partners across a broad range of applications. This includes contributions to sustainable practices such as low-temperature laundering, energy-efficient manufacturing, renewable energy sources, and enhancing the sensory experience of food products.

As Part Of This Role, We Offer


Exceptional opportunities for professional growth
A friendly, transparent and supportive work environment
A team-oriented structure that values empowerment and collaboration


Molecular Discovery is an integral part of the Enzyme, Protein & Strain Engineering Research area within R&D.

To Succeed In This Role, You Must


Possess a degree in biotechnology, molecular biology, biochemistry or related field (PhD or equivalent experience).
Exhibit proficiency in molecular biology & DNA modification; experience with enzyme and protein expression in Aspergillus/Bacillus systems is a plus.
Have a good enzyme-substrate understanding with the ability to apply this to select the right enzyme activity (protein) and develop assays for effective screening
Have experience with protein engineering and understanding of structure-function relationships.
Ideally have a keen interest in data analysis and programming (e.g. Python, Jupiter notebooks etc.).
Embody the spirit of a team player, committed to continuous learning and leading initiatives that drive team success.
Thrive in a multi-cultural environment, communicating effectively in English to unite diverse perspectives.


Application deadline: August 26th 2024

Contact details: Senior Department Manager Lars Giger (lgi@novonesis.com) or Senior Department Manager Katrine Pontoppidan (kpon@novonesis.com)

Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

At Novonesis we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. We recommend you not to attach a cover letter to your application. Instead, please include a few sentences in your resume/CV about why you are applying. To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your resume/CV.

Novonesis is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, disability, or veteran status.

Title: Data Scientist - Form Fremtidens Elnet med Dataanalyse
Place: Esbjerg Municipality, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Brænder du for at skabe synlig værdi og nye muligheder gennem data og AI, der kan gøre en forskel i hverdagen og på den lange bane for både kunder, forretning og samfund? Kan du gå foran i arbejdet og udviklingen med fx Databricks og andre cloud-platforme samt skabe resultater og værdi i praksis? Så har vi en spændende mulighed for dig hos Elnetselskabet N1.




Du bliver en del af et stærkt team og fællesskab, der arbejder for at udvikle forretningen. Som en del af afdelingen Forretningsudvikling, der har ansvaret for at identificere og udvikle nye forretningsmuligheder, vil du være med til at sikre vores fremtidige relevans og forretning med udgangspunkt i vores vision, strategiske retning og målsætning. I Elnetselskabet N1 er vi på en udviklingsrejse mod at blive et langt mere datadrevet elnetselskab og vi stræber efter at være branchens nytænker. Som Data Scientist får du sammen med resten af teamet ansvaret for at udtænke og udvikle nye koncepter, der gør en forskel både for vores kunder, forretning og for vores samfund.




Du får stor indflydelse på vores fremtidige services og vores måde at arbejde med datadrevet innovation

Som Data Scientist bliver din vigtigste opgave at se, omsætte, modellere og anvende data/AI til nye forretningsmuligheder og services. Dette er målrettet såvel kunder som Elnetselskabet N1 selv. Forretningsudviklingsafdelingen driver blandt andet udviklingen af prædiktive modeller og analytiske værktøjer, der understøtter en effektiv drift af vores elnet og langsigtet prioritering af investeringer i elnettet.




Dine primære arbejdsopgaver:

Ansvarlig for at udvikle, implementere og vedligeholde analytiske modeller i Databricks.
Udvikle og implementere avancerede statistiske modeller og machine learning-algoritmer for at understøtte forretningsmål.
Preprocessere, rense og validere datainput til analysemodellerne.
Automatisere dataanalyseprocesser i Azure Data Factory pipelines.
Samarbejde med forretningsudviklere for at omsætte analytiske resultater til strategiske og taktiske initiativer.
Præsentere og formidle analytiske resultater og indsigter til både tekniske og ikke-tekniske stakeholders.




Hvem er du?

Du kommer med relevant viden og erfaring, der kan løfte os til næste niveau. Vi forestiller os, at du har en relevant videregående uddannelse inden for data science, matematik, computer science eller lignende og har solid erfaring med dataanalyse og statistisk modellering. Det er et krav, at du behersker Python eller R og har stærke programmeringsfærdigheder i SQL. Erfaring med Azure services som Data Factory, Databricks og Analysis Services er nødvendigt. Derudover ser vi at det er en fordel at du har kendskab til Power BI eller Tableau, samt big-data tecnologier så som Hadoop eller Spark.

Du har stærke analytiske kompetencer, kan arbejde selvstændigt og i teams, og kan kommunikere komplekse analyser klart og effektivt.




Som person er du nysgerrig, og du holder dig naturligt opdateret på seneste nyt inden for data/AI. Du evner at prioritere egne arbejdsopgaver og trives med at arbejde med mange ubekendte. Du håndterer projekter med høj indlæringskurve og abstraktionsniveau. Du tør gå forrest, ser muligheder og får løst de udfordringer, som opstår undervejs i tæt dialog med dine kollegaer. Du begår dig professionelt på dansk og engelsk i både skrift og tale.




Vil du være en del af fællesskabet?

Vi ser diversitet som en styrke og opfordrer alle kvalificerede uanset baggrund til at søge jobbet. Vi tager jobannoncen ned, når vi har fundet den rette kandidat. Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!




Hvis du skulle have spørgsmål, er du mere end velkommen til at tage kontakt til din kommende leder Manager, Lasse Møller på +45 2236 9942 indtil d. 12. juli. Grundet en skøn barsel hos Lasse vil Director, Jesper Klitgaard Frederiksen være stedfortræder. Jesper kan træffes fra d. 29. august på +45 2437 0236 eller Jesper Klitgaard Frederiksen | LinkedIn




Du vil have mulighed for at kunne tilgå jobbet fra Esbjerg eller Silkeborg, og der vil naturligvis være mulighed for fleksibilitet via hjemmearbejde, når jobbet tillader det.




Vi indkalder til samtaler løbende, så upload dit CV hurtigst muligt.




Netselskabet N1 - Who are we?

N1 is the largest electricity grid company in Jutland and is owned by the Norlys Group. We are more than 600 employees who ensure every day that more than 800,000 homes and businesses have power in their power outlets - both now and in the future.




The electricity grid paves the way for green energy in Denmark, and at N1 we want to ensure that the grid is equipped for increased electrification. Green transition is a natural part of our daily life.

Here we dare to think differently, use our individual professional skills, and do things differently. Together, we solve an important societal task - and that is something we take pride in.

Geographically, N1 is anchored in Esbjerg and additionally spread across offices in Støvring, Silkeborg, and Sønderborg.




Read more about Electricity Grid Company N1 at www.n1.dk or find us on LinkedIn under Electricity Grid Company N1

Title: Data scientist med fokus på dataanalyse og sensorteknologi
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Har du lyst til at arbejde med avanceret dataanalyse og sensorteknologi? Hos Teknologisk Institut i Taastrup får du muligheden for at sætte dit aftryk på den teknologiske udvikling inden for fødevareindustrien med deltagelse i udviklingsprojekter fra idé til implementering.

Du bliver en del af Dataanvendelse, hvor vi bruger data til at fremme den grønne agenda i fødevaresektoren ved at optimere råvareudnyttelsen og produktionsprocesserne. Vi udvikler algoritmer bl.a. baseret på ny måleteknologi inden for 2D og 3D vision, video, ultralyd og røntgen CT. Vores løsninger implementeres online i virksomhedernes IT-systemer og understøtter effektivitet, fødevaresikkerhed og sporbarhed. Datakilderne er både egenudviklede avancerede målesystemer samt et bredt udvalg af sensorer og databaser fra virksomhederne.

Dine arbejdsopgaver vil bl.a. bestå af:



Deltagelse i udviklingsprojekter fra analyse-idé til implementering, test og validering
Udvikling af algoritmer og den bagvedliggende pipeline
Projektledelse af mindre projekter
Bidrage med ny viden inden for machine- og deep learning-feltet.



Derudover kommer du til at arbejde med udviklingsprojekter sammen med store kunder inden for fødevareindustrien.

Jobbet indebærer mindre rejseaktivitet i forbindelse med besøg hos kunder i ind- og udland.

Kendskab til machine learning og computer-vision

Du har en videregående uddannelse inden for det naturvidenskabelige område f.eks. civilingeniør, cand.scient. i fysik, matematik, statistik, IT eller datalogi, eller anden ingeniørvidenskabelig baggrund.

Du har den nyeste teori på plads og har et godt kendskab til flere programmeringssprog f.eks. Python, C# og C++. Du kan lide at arbejde med alt fra klassisk statistik, billede/video-behandling til Deep learning, og du har en interesse for samspillet mellem sensorteknologi og den efterfølgende dataanalyse. Som person er du detalje- og resultatorienteret.

Derudover er du velformuleret på dansk og engelsk, både mundtligt og skriftligt.

Vi tilbyder dig en alsidig hverdag med højt til loftet, hvor der er fokus på både den faglige og personlige udvikling. Som data scientist får du et fagligt udfordrende job, hvor du arbejder tæt sammen med højt kvalificerede og erfarne kolleger i centret.

Du bliver en del af Teknologisk Institut

Til dagligt vil du være tilknyttet sektionen Dataanvendelse, som er en del af centret Bæredygtighed og Digitalisering, hvor vi er 30 medarbejdere. I centret arbejder vi med at få udviklet og implementeret algoritmer i produktion, hvor vi anvender de nyeste teorier inden for kunstig intelligens og tager de nyeste teknologier i brug. Hos os vil du opleve mange forskelligartede udfordringer, hvor du både skal trække på dine teknisk faglige, analytiske og kommunikative kompetencer.

Kontakt

Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, er du velkommen til at kontakte centerchef Dennis Brandborg Nielsen på tlf. nr.: 7220 1904.

Vi inviterer løbende til samtaler og ansætter, når den rette kandidat er fundet, så vi ser frem til at modtage din ansøgning hurtigst muligt og senest d. 4. september 2024.

Title: Data Science & AI Lead
Description:
Join Bunker Holding as our Data Science & AI Lead to drive innovation and shape the future of bunker trading. Lead the design of groundbreaking AI solutions, inspire a diverse team, and turn business ideas into impactful results. Work in a dynamic environment where your expertise will thrive and make a significant impact.







About Us

Bunker Holding is one of the world’s leading companies in bunker trading. Our history as one of the pioneers in bunkering inspires us to be ever forward-looking and goal oriented. Family ownership allows us to remain grounded in our values, and to stay the course in our vision of sustainable development.

We are dedicated to leveraging data and AI to enhance our operational efficiency and drive innovation. Our team thrives on diversity and inclusivity, believing that a wide range of perspectives leads to groundbreaking solutions and a stronger organization.







Position Overview

We are seeking a visionary Data Science & AI Lead to accelerate our efforts in harnessing data to create value across our business. In this role, you will be spending time in our business and ensuring that business ideas are transformed into practical, impactful solutions. Together with our Director of Architecture and Intelligence, you’ll build and drive a new established function: Data Science & AI Center of Excellence (CoE) - which aims to drive innovation and integrate AI technologies by aligning initiatives with business goals, fostering cross-departmental collaboration, and ensuring scalable and sustainable practices. This approach will enhance organizational performance and maintain a competitive edge.”

You’ll collaborate with dynamic cross-functional teams to uncover key data-driven opportunities in the bunkering industry and bridge the gap between business stakeholders and technical teams for seamless communication and alignment.

Additionally, you’ll lead the design and implementation of innovative AI models and data analytics that tackle industry challenges, optimizing fuel logistics, pricing, and customer satisfaction. Inspire a culture of continuous improvement and excellence within the data science team, staying ahead with emerging technologies. Your hands-on expertise in data analysis, modeling, and coding will be invaluable in guiding and mentoring team members.




Your key responsibilities will thus include:

Drive AI strategies to achieve ambitious goals
Align business and IT for seamless communication
Design innovative and scalable AI solutions
Inspire continuous improvement and excellence
Promote diversity and inclusion within the team







What do you bring?

Bring your passion and expertise to our team with a degree in Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field, and 5-7 years of experience in data science or AI. If you have experience in the maritime or bunkering industry, that's an advantage!

Showcase your technical prowess in programming and machine learning frameworks, and use your industry knowledge to turn business needs into innovative solutions.

Inspire and lead your team with your exceptional communication and problem-solving skills. Embrace our dynamic environment with enthusiasm, ready to learn and adapt to new technologies.




Specifically, we expect you to have:

Bachelor's or Master's in Data Science or related field; Ph.D. is a plus
5-7 years of experience in data science or AI
Proficiency in Python, R, SQL, and machine learning frameworks
Strong business acumen in the bunkering industry
Excellent leadership and problem-solving skills
Adaptability to fast-paced, dynamic environments







Why Join Us?

Join our team and help shape the future of the bunkering industry with innovative, data-driven solutions. Work in a collaborative and forward-thinking environment where your ideas are celebrated and encouraged. Experience ample opportunities for professional growth and career advancement within a leading company. Become part of a diverse and inclusive team dedicated to creating a supportive environment where everyone thrives.

The position is in Middelfart or Aarhus, and travels to our location in Middelfart on weekly basis is to be expected.







How to apply

Note that applications are handled on an ongoing basis. So please send your application and CV as soon as possible by filling in the form below.

In case you have any questions about the position, please contact Director of Architecture and Intelligence, Anders Butzbach Christensen on +45 88 81 17 64.

We are already looking forward to hearing from you!

Please be advised that response times for applications may be extended due to the summer holiday period.







Bunker Holding is the global leader in purchasing, selling, and supplying marine fuel and lube oil as well as providing risk management and other vital services for the shipping industry. The company operates via more than 1,660 ports worldwide and is present in 32 countries with 62 offices and more than 1,500 skilled employees.

The group has a long history but remains forward-looking and focused on answering the needs and challenges of an ever-changing industry.

Bunker Holding is the largest company in the USTC Group, a family-owned company based in Denmark. USTC holds activities in oil & energy, ship owning, shipping & door-to-door logistics, risk management, car activities, IT, sustainable energy, and environment & recycling. The USTC Group is currently present with more than 160 offices in 40 countries and employs more than 4,300 people worldwide.

Read more at https://www.bunker-holding.com/

HTML:
Join Bunker Holding as our Data Science & AI Lead to drive innovation and shape the future of bunker trading. Lead the design of groundbreaking AI solutions, inspire a diverse team, and turn business ideas into impactful results. Work in a dynamic environment where your expertise will thrive and make a significant impact.



About Us

Bunker Holding is one of the world’s leading companies in bunker trading. Our history as one of the pioneers in bunkering inspires us to be ever forward-looking and goal oriented. Family ownership allows us to remain grounded in our values, and to stay the course in our vision of sustainable development.

We are dedicated to leveraging data and AI to enhance our operational efficiency and drive innovation. Our team thrives on diversity and inclusivity, believing that a wide range of perspectives leads to groundbreaking solutions and a stronger organization.



Position Overview

We are seeking a visionary Data Science & AI Lead to accelerate our efforts in harnessing data to create value across our business. In this role, you will be spending time in our business and ensuring that business ideas are transformed into practical, impactful solutions. Together with our Director of Architecture and Intelligence, you’ll build and drive a new established function: Data Science & AI Center of Excellence (CoE) - which aims to drive innovation and integrate AI technologies by aligning initiatives with business goals, fostering cross-departmental collaboration, and ensuring scalable and sustainable practices. This approach will enhance organizational performance and maintain a competitive edge.”

You’ll collaborate with dynamic cross-functional teams to uncover key data-driven opportunities in the bunkering industry and bridge the gap between business stakeholders and technical teams for seamless communication and alignment.

Additionally, you’ll lead the design and implementation of innovative AI models and data analytics that tackle industry challenges, optimizing fuel logistics, pricing, and customer satisfaction. Inspire a culture of continuous improvement and excellence within the data science team, staying ahead with emerging technologies. Your hands-on expertise in data analysis, modeling, and coding will be invaluable in guiding and mentoring team members.


Your key responsibilities will thus include:

  • Drive AI strategies to achieve ambitious goals
  • Align business and IT for seamless communication
  • Design innovative and scalable AI solutions
  • Inspire continuous improvement and excellence

Title: Experienced Data Scientist
Description:
Be a key player in the success of our cutting-edge product, SitaWare Insight.

AI is rapidly changing how complex raw data is turned into useful information, and information is what fuels the military intelligence process. For us, utilizing advanced algorithms on text, images, audio, video, and real-time geo-positional data gives our customers an advantage on the battlefield. This is what saves lives and helps win the battle.

SitaWare Insight is a decision support tool that uses AI to convert data into invaluable military intelligence. This involves transforming data into information, providing commanders with advanced data capture and analysis capabilities, and leveraging technologies such as machine learning.

The team
You will become part of a Scrum team of 11 highly skilled and competent colleagues in Denmark. From day one, you will be met with a collaborative and dynamic environment where you can develop your competencies.

Our mission for the team is to advance toward an operational AI platform. Currently, we service AI models such as LLM for text and audio, the latest deep learning models for images and videos and custom models for time series. Still, we aspire to elevate these models to the next level of maturity through improved generalization, scalability, and efficiency of our platform.

In short, you can look forward to:


Developing high-quality machine learning models to enhance decision support
Collaborating with MLOps for the seamless integration of models
Contributing to the growth, improvement, and maintenance of SitaWare Insight



Experienced Data Scientist
We are looking for an experienced data scientist to work on a broad spectrum of data science tasks, including model development and model deployment. We expect that you are passionate about transforming data into actionable insights and that you bring:


Proven product development experience as a Data Scientist with knowledge and experience with LLM and NLP methods
Minimum of a Master's or Ph.D. in a relevant field (e.g., Cognitive Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science).
Demonstrated expertise in developing and implementing machine learning models
Strong programming skills in Python and popular ML frameworks such as PyTorch, Transformers, Tensorflow
Proficiency in data preprocessing and feature engineering
Computer science skills supporting the overall development of the data science service
Solid understanding of data handling, model evaluation, visualization of data-driven solutions and development of best-practices
Appreciate teamwork and sparring with colleagues
Great communication skills
Proficient in English



Please note that you must be able to present a clean criminal record and have lived in a NATO/EU country for the past seven years as we work with security-classified projects. Read more here.

Never stop developing
Systematic is truly international, proudly Danish and uniquely people-centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. It is not just a place to work but a place to belong.

You can look forward to joining our Employees Club, which offers almost 100 events of both social and professional character a year – plenty to choose from. Our colleagues also highlight our canteen, which serves various delicious and healthy dishes daily. In addition, we offer several employee benefits such as paid Home Internet, health insurance and a company pension scheme. Finally, we are always up for a friendly game of padel at our new padel court in Aarhus!

Start your development here
We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis as we wish to welcome our new colleague as soon as possible, so click Apply Now and send us your CV today. If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Preben Schmidt Nielsen, Senior Project Manager.

Get in touch

Mette Mørch Rasmussen

Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant


Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer in Intraday power team
Description:
Join the team as MFT Energy's new Machine Learning Engineer in Intraday power team

In MFT Energy, we trade energy to make markets efficient and to facilitate the green transition. We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join our ambitious Intraday power team with experienced colleagues, who strive to be the best every day.




The job as Machine Learning Engineer

You will be a part of our great Intraday power team and as a Machine Learning Engineer, you will be one of the driving forces behind designing and maintaining a robust machine learning setup encompassing over 100 models. Your role is pivotal in bringing our ML setup to the next maturity stage, significantly expanding our model portfolio. You will collaborate closely with data scientists, platform engineers, quants, and traders to achieve these goals.




Your key responsibilities

Design, implement, and maintain a scalable ML infrastructure.
Support, manage and optimize a portfolio of 100+ ML models.
Work with cross-functional teams to integrate ML models into trading systems.
Enhance the maturity and scalability of our ML setup.




Your core skills

Proficiency in Python.
Hands-on experience with Docker for containerization.
Experience with public cloud services (Azure, AWS, GCP).
Experience with Git for version control.
Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines.
Familiarity with Bash and Linux environments.
Strong analytical skills and an eye for detail.




Beneficial skills

Proficiency in core ML frameworks/tools is a plus: MLFlow, Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch.
Strong SQL skills or similar database tools.
Familiarity with workflow orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow, Prefect).




Your qualifications

Minimum of 2 years of relevant experience.
MSc or Ph.D. in a quantitative field (e.g., Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, Business Intelligence, Economics, or similar).




Working in MFT Energy

You will be part of a young, global, and vibrant working environment in the heart of Aarhus. MFT Energy is a transparent and flat organization with entrepreneurship at heart. We are 163 employees working out of our headquarters in Scandinavian Center in Aarhus C and from our international offices in Turkey, Australia, Austin, Singapore, and several remote colleagues working from all over the world. Our mission is to empower entrepreneurs to become the best and our work culture is based on collaboration, transparency, and a proactive mindset.




We offer:

A competitive and entrepreneurial work environment.
Professional and committed colleagues with great ambitions.
Great employee benefits and a people-centered leadership approach.
A celebrative work environment, a modern workplace, and an entrepreneurial, professional culture.




Make the Most of Your Talent! Join us!

If you think there is a match between our values and your aspirations, we will be looking forward to receiving your application with a short cover letter and CV. For questions, please contact career@mft-energy.com.




Start date: As soon as possible.




We will be screening and interviewing candidates on an ongoing basis.

Title: Experienced Martech Developer
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
📢 Join Our Data Consultancy Team! 📢




Are you an experienced and passionate Martech Developer looking for your next challenge? Pyne is seeking a MarTech Analytics Engineer to join our innovative and growing team. At Pyne, you'll have the opportunity to make a significant impact while working in a fast-paced and forward-thinking environment.




Who are we?

We specialize in delivering actionable insights and strategic guidance to businesses. Our mission? To empower companies with data-driven solutions that drive informed decisions and growth.




Responsibilities:

Implement and optimize MarTech stacks including tracking plans and attribution models.
Develop and maintain data pipelines and support data warehousing efforts to make the MarTech stack fit into the overall data strategy of a company.
Collaborate with clients to understand their marketing technology needs and provide strategic recommendations.
Lead and manage client projects, ensuring timely and accurate delivery of data-driven solutions.
Mentor and guide team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement.




Requirements:

Extensive experience with marketing technology like CDPs, Analytics, and Engagement tools (e.g. GA4, Mixpanel, One Signal, Braze, Segment, AB Tasty).
Knowledge of tracking plans and attribution modeling, GDPR, and cookie compliance.
Proficiency in SQL and understanding of data warehousing concepts (data visualization experience is a plus).
Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to manage multiple projects and deliver results in a fast-paced environment.
Masters degree within a related field.

If you don't meet every single requirement but are excited about this role, we encourage you to apply. We value a diverse range of experiences and are committed to helping our team members grow and develop their skills.




What we offer:

Competitive salary, reflecting your skills and experience level.
Flexible work arrangements, including remote work options.
Extra perks such as team trips abroad and events to foster a fun and engaging work environment.
Work from our office in SOHO Kødbyen, a dynamic office environment with lunch, snacks of your choice, protein bars, and coffee on Pyne.
Opportunity to work closely with a talented and diverse team of data professionals.
Exciting challenges and opportunities to grow together with this young company.
A supportive and inclusive company culture that values diversity and encourages continuous professional development.

Ready to take your marketing technology expertise to the next level? Join us in shaping the future of data consultancy! Send your resume and a brief cover letter highlighting your passion for data and relevant experiences to michael@pyne.dk. We can't wait to hear from you!

Learn more about us at https://pyne.dk.

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
About the Role

You will be part of a team developing in-house financial, where you will:

Implement, verify and optimize financial algorithms
Create infrastructure to support analysis of new algorithms and execution of the existing ones
Improve automated monitoring of the algorithms




About the Team

You will be working in a team of 10 backend developers.

We enjoy collaboration and are always willing to lend a helping hand. We are working alongside two other teams of quantitative analysts and economists that conceive the mathematical models.




What makes this constellation work great is that all of the individual team members write code and understand that a seemingly trivial change can actually require a lot of work, and vice versa.




About You

5+ years of experience with C#, .NET or other backend languages.
Working knowledge of SQL
A good understanding of algorithms and data structures
A scientific and inquisitive mind




Nice to have

Experience working with low latency systems
Proficiency in languages like C, C++, Python or Matlab
Knowledge of SQL Server tuning and administration
Ph.d or M.Sc in Computer Science or equivalent




What we can Offer You

Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy
Collaborative team
Nice office in central Copenhagen
Pension, Health Insurance and 28 days of vacation

Title: Full Stack Engineer
Place: Høje-Taastrup Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
The Company

Are you passionate about starting or pursuing a career in the renewable energy industry, with a focus on embedded laser systems in a global context? Then embark on a transformative journey with us as we continue to reshape the wind energy landscape!




Windar Photonics is a globally recognized leader in LiDAR-based optimization solutions for the wind energy industry. Established in 2008 as a spin-off from DTU-Risø (Technical University of Denmark), we employ a diverse and dedicated team of 35 professionals across our offices in Denmark and China.




Our pioneering WindEYE and WindVISION LiDAR systems are used worldwide by leading wind turbine manufacturers and major wind-farm owners. These advanced optical units, utilizing light reflection and the Doppler effect principles, equip wind turbine controllers with precise wind measurements. This is all achieved in the demanding conditions at the top of the nacelle.




The Role

We are looking for a Full-Stack Engineer to help advance and scale our maiden software product, Windar Nexus. Windar Nexus is a comprehensive software suite designed for managing LiDAR fleets on customer premises, offering a wide range of features including data collection, processing, event reporting, continuous optimization, user interface management, administrative tools, and advanced analytics.




The main tasks will include:

Feature Development: Collaborate closely with our software and analytics teams to design and implement innovative functionalities.
Platform Enhancement: Continuously refine and upgrade our existing platform to keep it aligned with the latest technological advancements.
Architectural Design: Craft and improve the system architecture to guarantee scalability, reliability, and optimal performance.




Your Profile

The ideal candidate has most of the following experience:
Python Development: Strong understanding of core Python concepts, advanced programming techniques, and familiarity with Python libraries and frameworks like Django, REST API, and Celery.
Database Management: Proficiency in working with relational databases, including experience with database design, query optimization, and management of database systems.
Linux Proficiency: Strong knowledge of Linux environments, including Bash scripting, file permissions, and package management.
System Administration: Expertise in process management, systemd, cron jobs, log management, and performance monitoring.
Networking: Solid understanding of networking concepts, including firewall management, SSH, NGINX, DNS configuration, and VPN setup.
Version Control: Good understanding of version control systems like Git.




We are looking for hands-on, cross-discipline, team-player with:

An analytical mindset and good problem-solving skills,
Education in software engineering or similar,
An autonomous and proactive attitude,
Ambition to become part of a young, enthusiastic, international development team in an informal workplace
Excellent English communication skills (oral and written)




Want to apply?

Please send your CV and cover letter to the Head of Software Engineering, Devashish Bhageerutty at db@windarphotonics.com

Applications will be processed continuously so do not hesitate to apply for this exciting opportunity.

  • Database Management: Proficiency in working with relational databases, including experience with database design, query optimization, and management of database systems.
  • Linux Proficiency: Strong knowledge of Linux environments, including Bash scripting, file permissions, and package management.
  • System Administration: Expertise in process management, systemd, cron jobs, log management, and performance monitoring.
  • Networking: Solid understanding of networking concepts, including firewall management, SSH, NGINX, DNS configuration, and VPN setup.
  • Version Control: Good understanding of version control systems like Git.


We are looking for hands-on, cross-discipline, team-player with:

  • An analytical mindset and good problem-solving skills,
  • Education in software engineering or similar,
  • An autonomous and proactive attitude,
  • Ambition to become part of a young, enthusiastic, international development team in an informal workplace
  • Excellent English communication skills (oral and written)


Want to apply?

Please send your CV and cover letter to the Head of Software Engineering, Devashish Bhageerutty at db@windarphotonics.com

Applications will be processed continuously so do not hesitate to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Title: Scientist - Histology & Image analysis
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Brief description of the open role:

We are seeking a highly motivated scientist with specialization in Histology and Image analysis, to join our team as a Research Scientist or Senior Scientist in our Preclinical Department. The Research Scientist / Senior Scientist in Histology & Image analysis will be involved in a broad range of activities within target mapping and validation. Primary responsibilities will include developing IHC assays and image analysis procedures, including digital H-scoring, as well as more complex tasks such as multiplexing or bioinformatics (depending on the candidate’s skills and experience). The ideal candidate is structured and can handle several tasks and stakeholders at a time. You must have a dedicated and persistent attitude with an aim to consistently deliver high-quality data.




Key Responsibilities:

Development of IHC/ISH assays for target mapping and characterization, including hands-on work in the lab.
Development of image analysis for histological stainings including digital H-scoring using QuPath or other similar software.
Work in close collaboration with histology technician and scientist to ensure a good workflow.
Author histology reports and support writing of related sections of regulatory documents (e.g. IND).




Candidate Profile/Qualifications:

Life science background at minimum Master level (PhD preferred) and 2-5 years of experience specifically with histology and image analysis, preferably in an industrial environment (Biotech/Pharma/CRO).
Hands-on experience within immunohistochemistry and/or in situ hybridization including multiplexing.
Experience with image analysis and development of app/script for batch processing of digital slides.
Basic understanding of bioinformatic analysis and experience in mining public databases for comparative expression profiles of target candidates is an advantage.
Familiar with analysis of high-content microscopy images is a plus, but not a requirement.
Excellent written and spoken communication skills in English.
Self-motivated personality and ability to work independently while still being a team player.




How to apply:

If you thrive in an international environment and have experience in a similar role from either Pharma or Biotech, we encourage you to apply to join us at this exciting time for our company.




To apply, please send your CV that includes a short motivation for applying for the job to jobs@adcendo.com.




Please include the phrase “Job ID 2410 – Research Scientist / Senior Scientist, Histology & Image analysis” in the subject line.




Questions about the position can be directed to the same e-mail.




We will conduct interviews continuously, and we aim to fill the position as soon as possible.










About Adcendo:

Adcendo ApS is an international biotech company based in Copenhagen dedicated to developing highly differentiated antibody-drug conjugates (ADCs) for the treatment of underserved cancers. With substantial investments fueling our journey, we've assembled a world-class team, and we are poised to transition into a clinical-stage biotech, advancing a robust pipeline of ADC candidates. Our dedicated team of skilled scientists and professionals are headquartered at Symbion Frederiksberg, Copenhagen, Denmark. Learn more at www.adcendo.com.




Join us in shaping the future of Adcendo and transforming the landscape of cancer treatment!
