Title: R Shiny Application Developer (Data Scientist)
Description:
As part of our vision to transform our Operations team at City & Guilds, we have an opportunity to expand our data team to assist in the development of user-centric analytical solutions that improve the capabilities of the Operations team and help drive process efficiency.




You will need a broad working knowledge of R, including R Shiny, which will be used to design and develop unique application tools to improve existing solutions in scale, efficiency, and usability.




Good coding practices and the ability to deploy code to production are essential skills, as is the ability to communicate ideas in an interdisciplinary setting and translate operational business challenges into actionable solutions.




This is a full time, permanent role working 35 hours a week. Your office hub will be Wakefield (WF1) so you will need to be in reasonable commuting distance. However, applicants must also be willing to travel to London or Burntwood where part of our team are also based, for meetings and/or workshops as and when required.




This role is offered on a hybrid basis; predominantly you will be working from home, but you will need to attend the Wakefield office regularly to work with the team, especially when designing and implementing new R Shiny tools and applications.




Please note that we shortlist applicants on an ongoing basis and depending on volume we may close the advert early, so please submit your application as soon as possible to avoid disappointment.




This appointment will be made on merit.




We believe that diversity and inclusion strengthens and enriches us, and that it is the responsibility of everyone at the City & Guilds to drive this value. As ethnic minority groups and disabled people are currently under-represented, we particularly encourage and welcome applications from these communities.




About the role




In this role within the data & analytics arm of our Operations team, you will contribute to the design and development of data-driven solutions aimed at improving our operational efficiency and analytical capabilities. This includes a unique opportunity to help shape and implement these tools at an early stage of the project, with joint-leading responsibility for the development, production and delivery of high-quality data analysis and user centred R Shiny apps/tools and solutions to support the team with reporting, analytics, and improved workflow management.




We primarily use R and are working towards the development of a suite of R shiny applications that can deliver these analytical capabilities to the wider team, replacing a range of manual tools and reporting built on Excel, MS Lists and Power BI reports. This change presents an opportunity to implement creative and cutting-edge analytics that can help reveal unique business insights to the team. The workstream is focused on good use of data, so you will need to understand how data is stored, managed and processed as well as analysed to make it actionable and insightful.

A key part of the role will involve working closely with internal teams, customers and stakeholders to deliver projects in a timely and efficient manner whilst championing data quality principles and embedding good practice.




About you




You will need to have extensive knowledge and experience in the use of R to develop innovative solutions that can benefit the team. This includes use of analytical methods and procedures across various datasets and the ability to deliver these solutions via robust, deployable R shiny applications. Additionally, skills in translating policy, operational and business challenges into actionable analytical problems and solutions will be essential. You will also have the ability to collaborate across an interdisciplinary team to develop ideas that align with departmental goals and enhance overall efficiency.




Attributes we are looking for:




Knowledge, Skills & Behaviours we are looking for:

Extensive experience of programming in R, including use of R Shiny to develop and deploy applications.
Experience in deploying code to production environments, including use of git and GitHub or similar development workflows.
Can work both independently and collaboratively as part of a multidisciplinary team, at all stages of project implementation, including development and maintenance of our codebase.
Strong analytical skills, with good knowledge, understanding and experience in the application of statistical methods.
Experience working with various types of data, with an understanding of data privacy and ethical principles.
Strong skills in data visualisation, including interactive visualisation packages.
Experience creating detailed documentation. Knowledge in package development will be a bonus.
Functional knowledge of SQL and the ability to work with databases.
A critical thinker with great attention to detail and a strong aptitude for problem solving.

The following Knowledge, Skills & Behaviours would also be beneficial:

Practical experience in data analytics, including statistics, with the ability to deploy models.
The ability to train or deliver tutorials in use of data science techniques.
Knowledge of the vocational education sector.




Our story and mission




Our vision is for a world in which everyone has the skills and opportunities to succeed. We support almost five million people each year to develop skills that help them into a job, develop on that job and to prepare for their next job. As a charity, we’re proud that everything we do is focused on achieving this purpose.




Through our assessment and credentialing, corporate learning and technical training offers, we partner with our customers to deliver work-based learning programmes that build competency to support better prospects for people, organisations and wider society. We create flexible learning pathways that support lifelong employability, because we believe that people deserve the opportunity to (re)train and (re)learn again and again – gaining new skills at every stage of life, regardless of where they start.




At the heart of our business sits the City & Guilds Foundation which amplifies our purpose by helping to remove barriers to getting into a job, celebrating best practice on the job, and advocating for jobs of the future.




We were founded in 1878 by the City of London and the trade guilds of the time, to help people, organisations and economies to develop their skills for growth.




Our rich experience means we’re uniquely positioned to understand the future of work and learning. And, we continually evolve to develop and deliver skills for the workplace of the future. Today, as well as qualifications and assessment, we offer digital credentialing, elearning technologies, executive leadership development, technical training and consultancy.




What we offer




We offer the opportunity to work in an innovative, engaging and market-leading organisation with opportunities to develop your existing skills and explore new ones.




You’ll receive an excellent benefits package which typically includes a great base salary, 25 days holiday plus bank holidays, pension, private healthcare, volunteering opportunities and much more.




We welcome a discussion about how this role could work flexibly for you. For example work pattern, hours or location.




Next steps and how to apply




If you think this is the role and organisation for you then we would love to hear from you. Please submit your CV and complete our short application form using the apply button.

Title: Swift Coders - AI Training
Description:
* Swift coding experience required




This is a great opportunity to supplement your income while looking for longer or more full-time work, all while contributing to the development of new AI models using your domain expertise!

Our client has hired over 1,000 Braintrust talent and intends to hire hundreds more!

Many Braintrust coders earn over $12,000 per month!




You’ll have the flexibility to work as much or as little as you choose - 20hrs/week is suggested, but not a limit. Start working in as little as 48 hours.




What to expect: If qualified, you’ll be invited to complete a screening questionnaire with an example task, showing the type of work you'd be doing for Scale. It takes 15-20 minutes. If you successfully pass the questionnaire, you’ll be approved and able to begin work ASAP.




Required qualifications:

Proficiency working with Swift

Complete fluency in the English language is required. You should be able to describe code and abstract information in a clear way.




Preferred qualifications:

Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent. Students are welcome.

Proficiency working with any of the the following (in addition to the languages above):

Python, Java, JavaScript / TypeScript, SQL, C/C++/C# and/or HTML, Ruby, Rust, Go, NET, Matlab, PHP, HTML, DART, R, Apex, and Shell

Data Science experience




Note: Scale AI is partnering with Remotasks for this opportunity

What you’ll be working on

Our client has partnered with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code.

Example projects might include:
Evaluating the quality of AI-generated code, including human-readable summaries of your rationale
Solve coding problems, writing functional and efficient code
Optimize code to run at maximum efficiency
Writing robust test cases to confirm code works efficiently and effectively
Writing human-readable summaries of coding problems
Writing explanations of how code can solve problems and evaluate various solution approaches

No previous experience with AI necessary! You will receive detailed instructions on what is expected of you after you complete the application and verification process.

Show more
HTML:
* Swift coding experience required


This is a great opportunity to supplement your income while looking for longer or more full-time work, all while contributing to the development of new AI models using your domain expertise!

Our client has hired over 1,000 Braintrust talent and intends to hire hundreds more!

Many Braintrust coders earn over $12,000 per month!


You’ll have the flexibility to work as much or as little as you choose - 20hrs/week is suggested, but not a limit. Start working in as little as 48 hours.


What to expect: If qualified, you’ll be invited to complete a screening questionnaire with an example task, showing the type of work you'd be doing for Scale. It takes 15-20 minutes. If you successfully pass the questionnaire, you’ll be approved and able to begin work ASAP.


Required qualifications:

Proficiency working with Swift

Complete fluency in the English language is required. You should be able to describe code and abstract information in a clear way.


Preferred qualifications:

Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent. Students are welcome.

Proficiency working with any of the the following (in addition to the languages above):

Python, Java, JavaScript / TypeScript, SQL, C/C++/C# and/or HTML, Ruby, Rust, Go, NET, Matlab, PHP, HTML, DART, R, Apex, and Shell

Data Science experience


Note: Scale AI is partnering with Remotasks for this opportunity

What you’ll be working on

Our client has partnered with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code.

  • Example projects might include:
  • Evaluating the quality of AI-generated code, including human-readable summaries of your rationale
  • Solve coding problems, writing functional and efficient code
  • Optimize code to run at maximum efficiency
  • Writing robust test cases to confirm code works efficiently and effectively
  • Writing human-readable summaries of coding problems
  • Writing explanations of how code can solve problems and evaluate various solution approaches

No previous experience with AI necessary! You will receive detailed instructions on what is expected of you after you complete the application and verification process.

Title: Graduate Software Engineer
Description:
BAE Systems Digital Intelligence is home to 4,500 digital, cyber and intelligence experts. We work collaboratively across 10 countries to collect, connect and understand complex data, so that governments, nation states, armed forces and commercial businesses can unlock digital advantage in the most demanding environments.

Graduate Software Engineer – Java/C#/C++/.Net

Start Date: April 2025

Base location: Leeds

Role Profile

As a Graduate Software Engineer, we expect you to be ready to tackle (and enjoy!) programming tasks from the outset, but we will take the time to mentor you through smaller packages of work and enhancements to our product range. You will work primarily in Java, however we always look for the best framework for the job; some of our developments use C# .NET, C++ and HTML5 technologies.

Day To Day Tasks Could Include


Assisting in the design, test and implementation of software which forms part of a properly engineered system
Overcoming development obstacles to deliver quality code on time
Helping to specify user/system interfaces
Assisting in producing detailed designs and documents using required standards, methods and tools
Understanding and translating business design into a logical design, for a simple software application
Producing physical designs that describe the required structure and behaviour of a simple software application characterised by low-risk non-functional requirements


Who are we looking for?


Passionate about Software Engineering and have a level of experience programming
Aptitude in one or more of the following:
Java - Java JEE, JSP, JSF, EJB, Spring, JDBC
Microsoft - C#, C++, .NET, SharePoint, ODBC
Web - HTML, XML, SOAP
O/S - Linux, Windows
Mobile – iOS, Android


Entry Requirements


On track to achieve/ already achieved a 2:2 or above in Computer Science (or similar)
You will need to have graduated within the last 3 years


What’s in it for you?


Work-life balance is important; you’ll get 25 days holiday a year and, via our flexible benefits package the option to buy/sell and carry over from the year before
Our flexible benefits package includes; a competitive pension scheme, cycle to work scheme, taste cards and more
You’ll have a dedicated Career Manager to help you develop your career and guide you on your journey through BAE
You are welcome to join any/all of our Diversity and Support groups. These groups cover everything from gender diversity to mental health and wellbeing.
£34,000 starting salary, rising over the course of the programme
£2,000 welcome payment


Security Clearance

Only those with the permanent and unrestricted right to live and work in the UK will be considered for a position within BAE Systems Digital Intelligence. Due to the nature of our, work successful candidates for this role will be required to go through Government SC clearance prior to starting with us. https://www.gov.uk/guidance/security-vetting-and-clearance

What are the next steps?


CV Submission & Review
Digital Assessment
Live Interview


Life at BAE Systems Digital Intelligence

We are embracing Hybrid Working. This means you and your colleagues may be working in different locations, such as from home, another BAE Systems office or client site, some or all of the time, and work might be going on at different times of the day.

By embracing technology, we can interact, collaborate and create together, even when we’re working remotely from one another. Hybrid Working allows for increased flexibility in when and where we work, helping us to balance our work and personal life more effectively, and enhance well-being.

Diversity and inclusion are integral to the success of BAE Systems Digital Intelligence. We are proud to have an organisational culture where employees with varying perspectives, skills, life experiences and backgrounds – the best and brightest minds – can work together to achieve excellence and realise individual and organisational potential.

Division overview: Capabilities

At BAE Systems Digital Intelligence, we pride ourselves in being a leader in the cyber defence industry, and Capabilities is the engine that keeps the business moving forward. It is the largest area of Digital Intelligence, containing our Engineering, Consulting and Project Management teams that design and implement the defence solutions and digital transformation projects that make us a globally recognised brand in both the public and private sector.

As a member of the Capabilities team, you will be creating and managing the solutions that earn us our place in an ever changing digital world. We all have a role to play in defending our clients, and this is yours.

Title: Software Developer - Python, Azure - Remote
Company: YourCode - Award Winning IT & Digital Consultancy
Description:
Senior Software Developer (Python & Azure)

Location: Remote (UK-based)

Department: Engineering

Reports To: CTO

Salary: 100-110k depending on experience

About The Role

We are seeking a Senior Software Developer to join our clients dynamic and fully remote Engineering team. In this role, you will take a leading position in the development of a cutting-edge web application that integrates AI technologies. Working closely with a very entrepreneurial CTO and wider leadership team, you'll be instrumental in designing and building the application using Python and Azure technologies.

As the most senior developer within the team, you'll also have the opportunity to grow into a leadership role, mentoring other developers and helping to shape the future of the engineering function.

The leadership team is not only driven by innovation and business growth but also has a strong interest in philanthropy. If you are passionate about leveraging technology to make a positive impact, this role could align with your values and aspirations.

Key Responsibilities


Web Application Development: Design, develop, and maintain a robust web application using Python, Azure services, and AI integration.
Collaboration: Work closely with the CTO to translate business requirements into technical solutions, ensuring high performance, scalability, and reliability.
Team Leadership: Mentor and support junior developers, with the potential to grow into a leadership role as the team expands.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate with Data Engineers, Data Scientists, and DevOps Engineers within an Agile environment to deliver high-quality solutions.
Code Quality: Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code, adhering to best practices in software development.
Technical Problem Solving: Analyse and resolve technical issues, providing input on system architecture and optimisation.
Continuous Improvement: Stay updated on emerging technologies, particularly in AI and cloud computing, and advocate for their adoption where appropriate.
Social Impact: Engage with leadership on projects and initiatives that align with the company’s broader goals in social impact.


Qualifications


Experience: Minimum of 5 years of experience in software development, with a strong focus on Python and Azure.
Technical Expertise: Proven experience in building scalable web applications, ideally with AI and cloud integration.
Leadership Potential: Demonstrated ability to mentor and guide other developers, with a willingness to take on team leadership responsibilities.
Agile Methodologies: Solid experience working within an Agile environment, particularly with cross-functional teams.
Problem-Solving Skills: Strong analytical skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex technical issues.
Communication: Excellent communication skills, with the ability to articulate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Entrepreneurial Mindset: Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, innovative environment, with a passion for both technology and social good.


Nice-to-Have


Experience with AI/ML frameworks and tools.
Familiarity with DevOps practices and CI/CD pipelines.
Previous experience in a fast-paced environment.
Interest in or experience with philanthropy-related projects.


Benefits


Competitive salary
Flexible, remote working within the UK
Opportunity to lead and grow a team
Ongoing professional development and training
Collaborative and innovative work culture
Be part of a leadership team that values entrepreneurship and philanthropy


If you are a seasoned developer looking to take the next step in your career, work on exciting AI-driven projects, and contribute to meaningful social impact initiatives, we'd love to hear from you!

Apply Now or contact Seon Ripley via LinkedIn for more information.

Senior Software Developer (Python & Azure)

Location: Remote (UK-based)

Department: Engineering

Reports To: CTO

Salary: 100-110k depending on experience

Title: Senior Cloud Engineer
Description:
Job Title/Req Number: Senior Cloud Engineer




Base Location: Leeds based (Hybrid – 3 days per week in office)




www.kpmgcareers.co.uk/experienced-professional/#LeBlender.OfficeLocations




As a result of the work that we do, we require applicants to hold or be capable of obtaining UK National Security Vetting, the requirements for which could include but not be limited to having resided in the UK for at least the past 5 years and being a UK national or dual UK national. Please note your application will not be taken forward if you cannot fulfil these requirements.




The KPMG Technical Engineering function is a cornerstone of our business. We do work that matters to our local business and communities – supporting Technical innovation and adoption of cutting edge solutions across the United Kingdom. This team will be responsible for delivering technology enabled outcomes for some of our clients most challenging business issues using modern and best in class engineering methodologies. We drive this transformation through the adoption of Cloud based technologies and have strategic relationships with Google, Microsoft among others. We have a technology agnostic view and select the right tool/language/cloud provider to achieve the best outcome for the client.

KPMG is one of the world's largest and most respected consultancy businesses, we've supported the UK through times of war and peace, prosperity and recession, political and regulatory upheaval. We've proudly stood beside the institutions and businesses which make the UK what it is.




Why Join KPMG Technology and Engineering as a Senior Cloud Engineer




This is a chance to be part of a new concept at KPMG. We are creating an onshore engineering team to gain access to a new segment of the technology market where there is opportunity for significant growth. We are looking for people to help establish the culture and ways of working of the team so we are well placed to make the most of this opportunity. We need help in curating and evolving this culture over time as it’s the most important element to the business.




What will you be doing?




Automate like your life depends on it
GTD – Get things done. Use the DevOps culture to bring capabilities together and ship projects
Obsessed with quality and measuring key metrics to drive improvement such as DORA
Deliver Technology solutions that are in alignment with business goals
Interest in researching and analysing new technologies and trends
Take technical responsibility for your code
Perform code reviews and pair-program with other team members




What will you need to do it?




A high percentage of work will require individuals to hold or be capable of obtaining UK National Security Vetting, the requirements for which could include but not be limited to having resided in the UK for at least the past 5 years and being a UK national or dual UK national.




Experience in designing and building infrastructure using a DevOps mindset in any of the main public cloud providers including AWS/Azure/GCP
Experience with distributed systems and ability to build secure cloud at scale
Experience using containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes etc)
Ability to manage key stakeholders, including clients on engagements with effective communication skills
Experience with IaC such as Terraform
Experience with CI/CD tooling (Github Actions, CircleCI etc)




Skills we’d love to see/Amazing Extras:




Experience building infrastructure testing within the pipeline for automated deployments
Knowledge of Database systems and models
Ability to use and also contribution to open-source technologies
Knowledge of test automation




To discuss this or wider Technology roles with our recruitment team, all you need to do is apply, create a profile, upload your CV and begin to make your mark with KPMG.




Our Locations:




We are open to talk to talent across the country but our core Tech hubs for this role are:

Glasgow
Leeds
London Canary Wharf
Manchester

This position will be based from our Leeds offices, with 3 days per week in the office

We can potentially facilitate flexible hours, and part-time options. If you have a need for flexibility, please register and discuss this with our team.




Find out more:




Within Tech and Engineering we have a range of divisions and specialisms. Click the links to find out more below:

Technology and Engineering at KPMG: www.kpmgcareers.co.uk/experienced-professional/technology-engineering/
ITs Her Future Women in Tech programme: www.kpmgcareers.co.uk/people-culture/it-s-her-future/
KPMG Workability and Disability confidence: www.kpmgcareers.co.uk/experienced-professional/applying-to-kpmg/need-support-let-us-know/

For any additional support in applying, please click the links to find out more:

Applying to KPMG: www.kpmgcareers.co.uk/experienced-professional/applying-to-kpmg/
Tips for interview: www.kpmgcareers.co.uk/experienced-professional/applying-to-kpmg/application-advice/
KPMG values: www.kpmgcareers.co.uk/experienced-professional/applying-to-kpmg/our-values/
KPMG Competencies: www.kpmgcareers.co.uk/experienced-professional/applying-to-kpmg/kpmg-competencies/
KPMG Locations and FAQ: www.kpmgcareers.co.uk/faq/?category=Experienced+professionals

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
hackajob is a matching platform partnering with BAE Systems helping them to hire the best talent and build the future. To get the chance to get matched to this role and other similar roles, click on Apply to set up your free profile.




At BAE Systems, they help customers to stay a step ahead when protecting people and national security, critical infrastructure and vital information. They provide some of the world’s most advanced, Technology-led Defence, Aerospace, Security and Cyber Solutions. A career at BAE Systems will ignite your passion to improve security, defend freedom and make the world a safer place.




Skills:

Essential:




Good understanding of Modern Object Orientated Programming Concepts
Full Stack Development Experience
Experience writing applications in Java or Kotlin
Experience developing with modern Web Application Frameworks in Typescript or JavaScript
Willing to travel (within UK)
Able to obtain security clearance




Desired:




Willing to work on Client site 50:50; this would be in the West of England
Experience developing React applications with TypeScript
Experience working with SQL Databases
Experience of UI testing frameworks (e.g. Cypress / Selenium)
Previous experience working as part of an Agile team
Good understanding of MDM related technologies




At BAE you will find an environment that supports your personal development. You will have the opportunity to work on a variety of different projects and technologies. Their clients are constantly moving forwards with the technology that they use, and you will move forwards with them.




These roles require security clearance; if you are not security cleared already, you must be eligible to obtain clearance.




Life at BAE Systems Digital Intelligence




They are embracing Hybrid Working. This means you and your colleagues may be working in different locations, such as from home, another BAE Systems office or client site, some or all of the time, and work might be going on at different times of the day.




By embracing technology, they can interact, collaborate and create together, even when they're working remotely from one another. Hybrid Working allows for increased flexibility in when and where they work, helping them to balance their work and personal life more effectively, and enhance well-being.




Diversity and inclusion are integral to the success of BAE Systems Digital Intelligence. They are proud to have an organisational culture where employees with varying perspectives, skills, life experiences and backgrounds – the best and brightest minds – can work together to achieve excellence and realise individual and organisational potential.




Division overview:

Capabilities




At BAE Systems Digital Intelligence, they pride themselves in being a leader in the cyber defence industry, and Capabilities is the engine that keeps the business moving forward. It is the largest area of Digital Intelligence, containing their Engineering, Consulting and Project Management teams that design and implement the defence solutions and digital transformation projects that make them a globally recognised brand in both the public and private sector.




As a member of the Capabilities team, you will be creating and managing the solutions that earn them their place in an ever changing digital world. They all have a role to play in defending their clients, and this is yours.

Title: DevOps Engineer
Description:
SPG Resourcing are currently hiring for two permanent Systems Engineers that have strong experience in Python and Kubernetes. We have offices based in Leeds and Newcastle, but the majority of this role can be worked remotely in the UK.




Role: DevOps Engineer / Distributed Systems Engineer




Start date: start of September 2024




Salary: up to £55,000




Interview date: W/C 12th August 2024




Job Description:




Design, implement, and manage CI/CD pipelines to streamline the software development lifecycle.
Develop and maintain infrastructure as code using tools like Terraform, Ansible, or similar.
Utilize Kubernetes for container orchestration, including deploying, managing, and scaling containerized applications - specific experience of python interacting with k8s APIs would be ideal
Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code in Python for automation tasks, scripts, and backend services.
Collaborate with development, QA, and operations teams to ensure smooth integration and deployment of applications.
Monitor system performance, troubleshoot issues, and ensure high availability and reliability of infrastructure.
Implement security best practices in all aspects of the DevOps workflow.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in DevOps, Kubernetes, and Python development.
Document processes, configurations, and procedures for internal use and knowledge sharing.




Required Skills and Qualifications:




Proven experience as a DevOps Engineer, Developer, or similar role.
Strong proficiency in Python programming and scripting.
Hands-on experience with Kubernetes, including setting up clusters, managing deployments, and scaling applications.
Familiarity with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins, GitLab CI, CircleCI, or similar.
Experience with cloud platforms like AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure.
Solid understanding of containerization technologies (Docker).
Knowledge of configuration management tools (Terraform, Ansible, Puppet)
Understanding of networking concepts, including DNS, load balancing, and firewalls.
Excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and ability to work in a team-oriented environment.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
Experience with monitoring and logging tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, ELK stack, or similar.
Knowledge of microservices architecture and related technologies.
Familiarity with version control systems like Git.




Interviews will be held w/c 12th August so please apply today for futher information.




SPG Resourcing is an equal opportunities employer and is committed to fostering an inclusive workplace which values and benefits from the diversity of the workforce we hire. We offer reasonable accommodation at every stage of the application and interview process.

Title: Java developer
Description:
Java Developer




Alscient

Leeds, UK




Why Alscient?

We provide great opportunities for people to develop and grow their career. We provide a fulfilling and enjoyable environment that supports that growth while working with the best people and teams around.

You succeed, we succeed, it’s that simple, and we like to keep it simple. That said, you will be working with the latest technologies, platforms, languages and best practices.

This role will require an excellent working knowledge of Java and related technologies.







What’s in it for you?

From your first day we will provide you with everything you need to succeed, we just need you to play your part. There will be lots to learn, but we’ll be there to support, guide and help at every stage.




As you gain experience and knowledge, we’ll help you grow your certifications and experience delivering customer solutions. You’ll be working with some of the best people in the industry who are there to help and support you on your journey.




In return we will guarantee a welcoming, inclusive and supportive culture working on exciting and progressive projects alongside one of the best packages in the industry including market leading salary, healthcare, pension, flexible working options and a personalised development plan to match your ability and ambition ensuring your personal and professional growth is in line with our commercial development.




What we need from you?

This is also simple. Our culture is non-negotiable so we need you to be passionate about your work, technically adept, open with those you work with and for you to do your best to support your colleagues and teams.




As a Java developer we expect you to hit the ground running. You will know Java well and will be comfortable using JUnit, Ant, JSON, REST, Eclipse IDE and related technologies. You will be comfortable following design documentation and specifications and maintaining them as solutions change. A knowledge of data platforms including relational DBMS platforms and SQL is necessary.




We are looking for people who are bright, talented and a pleasure to work with and alongside. Whether you enjoy working on new solutions, learning new technologies, problem solving or working with customers, we can find the best role to suit you.




Are you a good fit?

We’ve mostly covered it above so if you think you are a good fit and have a hunger to grow and develop your career with us, get in touch.




Benefits and Opportunities include:

Excellent market leading salary.
A benefit package including life assurance, pension and healthcare.
A generous holiday allowance, including a day off on your birthday.
A flexible working policy.
An inclusive, supportive and welcoming culture.
Challenging projects at the fore front of developing technologies.
A personalised development plan, including practical project experience alongside continuing supported professional certification.




You will have:

At least two years’ experience of developing Java applications and services
A working knowledge of relational DBMS platforms and SQL.
Experience of working in agile environments and the use of Jira and Confluence.
A hunger to develop, learn and grow.
A meticulous attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills including the maintenance of system documentation.
Strong analytical skills with a passion for problem solving.
A resourceful and professional curiosity, with a drive to find appropriate solutions.







If the above excites or interests you, please contact david.owen@alscient.com attaching your CV.

Title: Engineer, Software Development
Description:
Come join Analog Devices (ADI) – a place where Innovation meets Impact. For more than 55 years, Analog Devices has been inventing new breakthrough technologies that transform lives. At ADI you will work alongside the brightest minds to collaborate on solving complex problems that matter from autonomous vehicles, drones and factories to augmented reality and remote healthcare.

ADI fosters a culture that focuses on employees through beneficial programs, aligned goals, continuous learning opportunities, and practices that create a more sustainable future.

ADI At A Glance

Analog Devices, Inc. (NASDAQ: ADI) is a global semiconductor leader that bridges the physical and digital worlds to enable breakthroughs at the Intelligent Edge. ADI combines analog, digital, and software technologies into solutions that help drive advancements in digitized factories, mobility, and digital healthcare, combat climate change, and reliably connect humans and the world. With revenue of more than $12 billion in FY22 and approximately 25,000 people globally working alongside 125,000 global customers, ADI ensures today’s innovators stay Ahead of What’s Possible.

Position Overview

As ADI expands into new product and market segments, the E-mobility group (EMG) is looking for a highly skilled Software Development Engineer based in Edinburgh, UK who will be responsible for developing tools used to test and deploy very complex embedded wireless systems.

 

Context on the role:

As a Software Development Engineer, you will perform a full range of product development activities including, but not limited to: 


Working with the embedded engineering and architecture teams to specify tool requirements.
Designing and testing tools.
Using the tools to develop, test and deploy wireless systems.
Working with customer facing teams.


 

Job Duties:


SW requirements gathering and analysis.
Architect, implementation of SW.  
Design and/or integration of SW into larger systems.
Improve module and system testing.
Evaluate and troubleshooting complex problems in the system.


 

Requirements:


Computer Science or equivalent graduate with 2-4 years of experience developing software.
Have expert knowledge of modern Web Technologies and testing frameworks, especially React and Node.JS.
Experience of Agile development.
Motivated, results oriented and creative problem solver with good writing, presentation and overall communication skills.
Willingness and ability to learn something new quickly.


 

Advantageous skills:

Having some of these skills will be an advantage.


Functional Programming concepts
Python
Embedded development experience
MongoDB
JIRA
Wireless systems.


 

Why you will like working at ADI:


We place great value on individual judgment.
We allow our employees the freedom to explore new ideas and the autonomy to determine how to best achieve business goals and objectives.
We emphasize professional development and mentoring.
Above all, we recognize that the personal goals of our employees and the company’s goals are closely related and must support each other.


For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls. As such, applicants for this position – except US Citizens, US Permanent Residents, and protected individuals as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3) – may have to go through an export licensing review process.

Analog Devices is an equal opportunity employer. We foster a culture where everyone has an opportunity to succeed regardless of their race, color, religion, age, ancestry, national origin, social or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, disability, medical condition, genetic information, military or veteran status, union membership, and political affiliation, or any other legally protected group.

Job Req Type: Graduate Job

Required Travel: No

Title: Software Developer
Description:
Software Developer - Leeds - C#, .Net - £35K-£45K, 3 days in the office, flexible working hours, 25 days holiday + BH

The client is a leading software development company specialising in delivering innovative, high-quality digital solutions tailored to meet the unique needs of businesses across various industries. With a team of experienced developers, designers, and technology experts, they offer a comprehensive range of services, including custom software development, web and mobile application development, cloud solutions, and IT consulting.

The role

As a Mid-Level .NET Developer, you will be responsible for developing, maintaining, and enhancing web applications and software solutions using the .NET framework. You will work closely with their senior developers, designers, and product managers to deliver high-quality software that meets the needs of their clients. This role requires a solid understanding of the .NET ecosystem, strong problem-solving skills, and the ability to work both independently and as part of a team.

Requirements


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
3-5 years of experience in .NET development.
Proficiency in C#, ASP.NET, and the .NET Framework/Core.
Experience with front-end technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and popular frameworks (e.g., Angular, React).
Familiarity with database technologies like SQL Server, Entity Framework, or LINQ.
Understanding of RESTful APIs, MVC architecture, and Web Services.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication and teamwork skills.


Desirable


Experience with cloud platforms such as Azure/AWS
Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies


What They're Offering


Salary of £35,000-£45,000
Hybrid working with 3 days in the office
25 days holiday + BH
Flexible working hours
Chance to work with the latest technologies


APPLY NOW

If you think you match up to the requirements and the role is of interest then waste no time and apply now! Interviews are commencing this week.

Software Developer - Leeds - C#, .Net - £35K-£45K, 3 days in the office, flexible working hours, 25 days holiday + BH

Oscar Associates (UK) Limited is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

To understand more about what we do with your data please review our privacy policy in the privacy section of the Oscar website.

Title: CAM Programmer
Description:
Position: CAM Programmer


Location: Bradford

Role Summary:

Recruit Engineering is seeking a skilled CAM Programmer for a client based in Bradford. This role offers a mix of shop floor and office responsibilities. We are looking for a candidate with strong CNC milling skills, proficiency in CAD/CAM software (preferably OneCNC), and experience in programming with Fanuc or Haas controls.

Key Responsibilities:


Program machining tasks using CAD/CAM software.
Operate CNC milling machines to create precise parts according to specifications.
Optimise machine performance using G Codes.
Verify designs and tolerances to ensure high-quality output.
Maintain a clean and safe working environment.
Collaborate with the team to enhance production processes.
Earn £17 - £18 per hour, with optional overtime available during day shifts, based on experience.


Qualifications:


Demonstrated experience as a CNC Miller in precision engineering.
Proficiency in CAD/CAM software, with a preference for OneCNC.
Skilled in programming machines using G Codes.
Strong understanding of engineering drawings and specifications.
Excellent attention to detail and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced manufacturing environment.


If you have the required expertise and are seeking a new opportunity, apply today!

By applying for this position, you consent to Recruit Engineering processing and storing your personal data, including your CV, contact details, and any other relevant information, for the purpose of providing work-finding services. This consent includes forwarding your details to our clients and storing your information on our recruitment software database. Your consent will last for two years, and you can withdraw it at any time by contacting us in writing or via email

Title: CMM Programmer
Description:
12:30 Finish on Fridays, 33 days annual leave, optional healthcare plans and free parking are just a few of benefits the CMM Programmer will enjoy whilst working with this globally operating manufacturing business

Supplying precision machined components & assemblies to a variety of industries, this company employs over 1000 people across the world, 500 of which are based in the UK. Because of organic growth, they are looking for a CMM Programmer to permanently join their business.

Based in LEEDS, just a few miles from the M621, the CMM Programmer can easily accessible from Bradford, Wakefield, Dewsbury, Huddersfield, Halifax, Wetherby, York and Harrogate.

The CMM Programmer Will Be Responsible For


Acting as a Lead Inspector in the Quality department and offering support, guidance and help to colleagues
Inspecting and approving finished components by confirming specifications and conducting visual inspection
Writing and developing programs for Mitutoyo machines using MSCOSMOS software
Assisting Senior Quality personnel with NCR investigations


The CMM Programmer Will Possess


IDEAL NOT ESSENTIAL: Formal qualifications within Mechanical Engineering or similar (Apprenticeship, NVQ Level 3, BTEC, HNC, HND etc.)
Experience working in similar position, ideally within a Machine Shop environment
The ability to program Mitutoyo Coordinate Measuring Machines using MCOSMOS software


Working Hours Of The CMM Programmer

37 Hours per week, spread across a regular day shift


Monday to Thursday: 07:30 - 16:00
Friday: 07:30 to 12:30

In Return The CMM Programmer Will Receive


Annual Salary: 32,611.80 (16.95 per hour)
Auto-enrolment to company pension after initial probation
Optional Simply Healthcare plans
24/7 Employee Assistance Programme for employees & immediate family
Stable employment that will offer long-term career opportunities


To apply for this role, please click the "APPLY NOW" button and attach a copy of your CV. Alternatively, please contact Callum Good at E3 Recruitment for more information

Title: Lead Developer
Description:
Interested in becoming the Lead Software Engineer for a SaaS Startup?

Highly experienced with NodeJS & TypeScript?

ADA is exclusively partnered with an emerging startup that has built its security compliance tool.

Their easy-to-use tool automates tasks, streamlines processes, simplifies workflows and keeps up with the latest regulations and standards.

They’re looking to onboard a Lead Engineer experienced in Node/TypeScript/GCP to play a fundamental role in developing and scaling their greenfield product.

Role:


Lead Developer (NodeJS)
£75k DOE
Hybrid (Manchester - twice a week in the office)
Professional development, social events, progression


You will have complete autonomy and ownership of product development and will be working very closely with the Head of Tech, mentoring one Developer.

Ideally, you’ll have experience in a start-up environment previously and enjoy the fast-paced nature of this. You’ll value simplicity and best practice - but don’t let perfection get in the way of progress.

You’ll need to be passionate about building awesome stuff and not afraid to roll up your sleeves. Whilst you are predominately hands-on, you can expect to dive into everything from architecture, and bug fixes to big-picture strategy sessions.

Company Values:


We move fast
We take ownership
We are solution focussed
We look after each other
We refuse to lose


Tech:


Restful APIs with NodeJS / NestJs
GCP/AWS
Postgres
Release Management
Swagger Documentation
Atlassian Jira etc
Google APIs
Agile
Github


Requirements of the Role


Knowledgeable with the fundamentals of coding.
Know NodeJs like the back of your hand.
Atleast one DB type: Postgres, Mysql and MongoDB.
You’ve played an active part in the planning and delivery one or many integrations.
You enjoy complex problem solving.
You don’t see technical planning as a chore
You welcome healthy technical debate


Benefits:


£75k DOE
Hybrid Remote working
Flexible working hours
True Start-up Culture
Training Budget
Holiday/Pension


We understand that job adverts only give a snapshot of the role, so we know you will have plenty of questions.

Rest assured, we will share everything from the full job description, location, salary, benefits, and more on our initial briefing call.

You can also contact me at (url removed) / (phone number removed)

Title: Affiliate Java Software Engineer
Description:
Who We Are:

Join our affiliate network, working flexibly with a variety of clients across the UK. Our affiliate contracts are all fixed-term in line with client engagements.

AND Digital are a tech company focused on accelerating digital delivery and dedicated to closing the digital skills gap. We've been helping organisations build better digital products and stronger digital teams since 2014.

We believe our work should always leave a legacy for the client. We do this through close relationships with our offices (or ‘Clubs') so that our partners are always prioritised by a regional team close to them.

This unique model has driven success for our clients and ourselves, evidenced by our remarkable organic growth since 2014. Today we number more than 1,300 people with Clubs all over the UK and Europe with plans for global expansion in the next couple of years.

Join us - and help us fulfil our mission to close the world's digital skills gap.

Requirements


Solid development experience of working as an engineer in a commercial environment, a good understanding of Java and wider experience in different tools and frameworks and across the stack.
Commercial experience working with agile methodologies.
Experience dealing with challenges from stakeholders on technical issues and influencing technical decisions in the team.
Understanding and ownership of best practice as a Senior Engineer (eg. TDD, SOLID, XP)
Significant experience working with AWS Cloud Services.
AWS Associate Developer Certification (or above)
Proficient with Angular.js.
Experience with Jenkins.
Experience with testing tools like Gherkin, Karate & Cypress.
Working knowledge of CI/CD practices and deployments.
Experience of writing effective documentation and knowledge sharing.


Benefits

Why join AND Digital?

We have three values: wonder, share, and delight. These values inform how we work with clients, and our culture: what it feels like to work for AND. We believe collaboration, ambition, curiosity and fun can drive innovation by creating a better environment for problem-solving.

Benefits


Pro-Rata holiday in line with contract length.
Opt-in to contributory pension scheme (3% employer, 3% employee contribution)


Equal Opportunities Statement

At AND Digital we embrace diversity and are committed to equal opportunities. We are actively recruiting for a diverse and inclusive workforce so want to ensure we do everything we can to support your application.

We want you to feel safe and empowered to let us know if you require any adjustments to be made to your application or interview process so please speak to our recruitment team.

Please note that this position requires an active SC clearance. Candidates without a current and valid SC clearance will not be considered for this role.
